Efficiently communicate the user needs and ask an offshore team so that the idea is shared across. Manage changing priorities, change requests, and tracking them in the plan. Experience in applying performance optimization techniques. Experience in upgrading MicroStrategy and applying patches to the existing environments. Job Description  We are hiring for our Singapore office! Role:  Solutions Engineer,  Start Date:  Immediate 3Forge is a ground-breaking FinTech, founded in New York over 10 years ago  after the revolution in high frequency electronic and algorithmic trading. Ultra-high performance and agility set apart this real-time data platform from its nearest competitors. The 3Forge AMI platform is both industry and data agnostic; it overlays existing architecture and data-sources, representing not just high-level business information, but dynamic alerting, functionally rich workflows, supported by deep charting & statistical analytics. Award-winning 3Forge AMI is the data virtualization layer of choice, deployed globally at Citi, Morgan Stanley and other leading institutions. 3Forge has offices in  New York, London  and is now expanding into Asia with the  launch of the Singapore office  to support its rapidly growing and global client base. In the role of Solutions Engineer, not only will you work side by side, and  receive mentoring by 3Forge’s seasoned Subject Matter Experts and Senior Business Architects , but you will be  supported by Quantitative Developers across all three regions  and  receive training by the CTO . Working on-site with 3Forge clients provides a truly  unrivalled level of exposure  to some of the most  interesting and challenging use cases  across trading, risk, settlement and more. This opportunity gives you a bird’s eye view into how financial institutions and capital markets operate, across asset classes. 3Forge has solved the world’s most complex real-time streaming data challenges efficiently with a best-of-breed product that coordinates hundreds of adapters, complex event real-time processors and an intuitive web-based dashboard with a drag and drop interface. Further information: https://3forge.com & see the AMI Platform itself https://3forge.wistia.com/medias/rvjj95as99   Solutions Engineer This position is for our Singapore office. The Solutions Engineer position will play a crucial role in the development and execution of Asian related projects.  These client projects will require extensive proficiency in 3Forge’s AMI platform.  Given the current Covid-19 situation, all work will be done remotely to start, then hybrid working at office and on client site. Areas of Responsibility ● Application development and maintenance with 3Forge platform ● Software deployment and tech support ● Project management  Requirements ● Quantitative skills: curious about data and technology, natural  problem solver ● Technical skills: experience with SQL and programming languages  (Java, JavaScript or C++) ● Basic Unix: writing scripts, vi editor, permissions, etc. ● Basic Windows: installing, editing files, etc. ● Troubleshooting: ability to diagnose log files & interpret a stack trace ● Can-Do mentality: driven and motivated to accomplish tasks and  projects ● Personal and professional communications skills: can effectively  understand and discuss technical and business requirements ● STEM background: degree in Computer Science, Engineering or  relevant field  Preference Given to Candidates with these Skills ● Technical writing ability for documentation ● Finance background, specifically sell-side trading The following factors are also important: these individuals must have strong client  facing and communication skills and the ability and aptitude to work in international  settings. The successful candidate will also have good project management skills and  an entrepreneurial mindset. While academics are important, technical smarts are  essential.  The 3Forge personality profile is bright and motivated with lots of drive and initiative.  The ideal candidate should also demonstrate ‘future leader’ qualities that will facilitate  growth and evolution within the business. No phone calls. All correspondence, including interview selection will be  managed via email            Fast Apply      No CV Required   Fast Interview via Chat     Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_description: Job Description  Job Summary:  Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) brings together the Company’s best-in-class product, technology, and commercialization teams together into one global organization. DMED is responsible for the P&L management and all distribution, network and engineering operations, sales, advertising, data, and certain key technology functions worldwide for the Company's content engines. DMED also manages operations of the Company's streaming services including Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+ and Disney+ HotStar; and domestic broadcast and cable television networks.  DMED Technology creates products, platforms, and innovations for the DMED Segment and the Walt Disney Company by driving the strategic development and use of technology, building scalable systems and products to empower our businesses and engage consumers. With global scale, local presence, and deep technological excellence, DMED Technology helps DMED and The Walt Disney Company optimize technology, platforms, and resources, bring creative ideas to life and create industry-shaping approaches.  The Media Engineer II is a key role within in the DMED Media Technology group. This position is based in our Singapore office and supports multiple systems supporting content preparation and post production workflows across the APAC region and for Japan. The person in this position will build relationships with the LOB for technical & workflow issues in the Technology group. The engineer will work alongside engineering, operational team and creative members to ensure content delivery deadlines and expectations are met and issues addressed and resolved within an agreed SLA.   Responsibilities:   Works within a support team and alongside vendor partners to respond to issues within a timely manner  Update and maintain ticketing system ensuring operational team members are kept up to date on progress of ticket resolution  Offers remote technical support of post-production machines and workflows  Meet with operations team on a regular basis to discuss long standing issues or potential system enhancements   Basic Qualifications:   At least 2 years of relevant experience in television broadcast, transmission, IT or related fields  Proficiency in Japanese language (written and spoken)  Strong communication skills and a demonstrated ability to explain complex information to others at all levels of the organization  Knowledge of systems commonly used in asset management workflows, to understand issues identified by stakeholders and allocate work within the team  Knowledge of Dalet Galaxy MAM is essential  Knowledge of Evertz Mediator is preferable  Knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud applications is required  Knowledge of Harding PSE workflows is preferable   The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. Job Description  Role Description  As a Senior Data Strategist, you will use your data analysis experience, business acumen and creativity to drive sales pipeline rigor with automated reporting and insights. As a member of the Pipeline & Programs team, you will use a data-driven approach to sharpen decision-making and hone in on the metrics that matter to deepen our understanding of our fast growing business. Combined with the resources of a dedicated sales force, our insights translate directly to accelerated revenue growth and improve Google’s ability to serve its Cloud customers at scale. In this role, you'll be building scalable solutions that will help make data relevant to the Cloud on current and historical performance, visualizing the key opportunities for growth. Using your strong technical skills, you will build tools to automate reporting and dashboard updates so the Cloud leadership team can quickly and accurately see how their businesses are performing. You’ll be the liaison with the broader community of BI analysts globally ensuring global consistency and practices. You’ll be involved in defining user requirements, building & maintaining the data infrastructure, designing reports, & ensuring timely delivery to the end users.   Responsibilities   Build channel attribution model to understand the effectiveness of different marketing channels and its impact on the customer’s decision to convert, or to take the desired next step, so Google can allocate its marketing resources accordingly.  Understand and critically analyse the demand generation funnel and provide strategic recommendations on funnel optimisation.  Understand the current business model, improve on or develop a better forecast model to predict business performance.  Work with the cross functional teams throughout the organisation to create work that distils multiple sources of information into a cohesive strategy and ensure that the strategy is understood and integrated into the business.  Proactively identify patterns or trends in the business and anticipate potential problems; and work with wider teams to develop preventative measures.  Leads and manages the data engineers to collaborate and devise performance measure frameworks and incorporate learnings into documentations and briefs.  Work with data engineers to continuously innovate, automate existing manual processes and seek out new opportunities.  Make recommendations to improve the current rhythm of the business reporting, taking best practices from other regions  Work on propensity modeling to devise better account targeting and improve areas of investment  Participate in QMRs, QBRs and Planning cadence to facilitate business insights for the business  Design and produce project trackers; provide weekly reporting updates for better visibility. Job Description  IT Risk Manager (Operational | Healthcare)   Our client is a leading technology agency that revolutionalises, provides innovative and integrates smart technologies for the healthcare sector. You are a facilitator, an integrator of people, process and technology. You should have a track record of competency in the field of risk management with direct experience in IT/Technology. Manages day-to-day maintenance of the risk management infrastructure.  3. Identifies potential areas of vulnerability and risk; help risk owners develop or implement mitigation action plans for resolution of risks, and provide general guidance on how to avoid or deal with similar situations in the future.  4. Monitors risk activities of departments to remain abreast of the status of all risk status and to identify conformance to risk standards and procedures.  5. Provides information to assist management in measuring risk response against desired objectives.   Requirements  1. Minimum 5 years' experience in an operational risk, IT audit or related field gained within IT / Healthcare industry  2. Critical thinking skills that encompasses effective analysis of data, and the ability to disaggregate business or project plans into component risks.  3. Ability to operate in a consultative manner with all levels of program management.  5. Ability to gain consensus and on going collaboration with management  6. Strong verbal and written communication skills  7. ERM Planning & Management, PMP Risk, CITPM, Six Sigma Green Belt certification is preferred. job_description: Job Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world’s leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. Learn more about a career opportunity as a Business Analyst in the Cloud Sales Center (CSC) at AWS.  As a the Strategy & Operations Manager for the Cloud Sales Centre you will lead our most strategic initiatives to uncover new opportunities or solve our biggest challenges. You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically to identify problems and gaps, collect and analyze data, generate insights, and come up with solutions. Job Description  About TikTok  TikTok is the world's leading destination for short-form mobile videos. Our mission is to capture and present the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter in everyday life. job_description: Job Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world’s leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing start-ups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation.  At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in Singapore. Learn more about a career opportunity as a Business Analyst in the Cloud Sales Center (CSC) at AWS.  As a the Strategy & Operations Manager for the Cloud Sales Centre you will lead our most strategic initiatives to uncover new opportunities or solve our biggest challenges. You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically to identify problems and gaps, collect and analyze data, generate insights, and come up with solutions. You will execute on your proposed business strategies to solve difficult problems and remove blockers for our customers and our business. To do so, you will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders such as sales, operations, product, and marketing teams. Through leading initiatives across APJ, you will gain a unique insight into the internal workings of the world’s fastest growing billion dollar IT organization, as you learn and explore your passion. The ideal candidate will possess a keen business sense and exceptional analytical skills, is able to articulate and communicate a clear value proposition across customers, partners, and within the AWS organization, and its comfortable working across internal functions and geographies. Job Description  Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals.  Role Profile  The Technology Summer Analyst (Cybersecurity) Program is a 10-week program beginning in June that provides an intensive hands-on introduction to the Technology Division and Cybersecurity at Morgan Stanley. The program is designed to offer a real-world, project-based experience of what it’s like to be a Cybersecurity technologist for a top financial firm.  The mission of the global Technology Division is to provide a highly reliable and commercial technology platform, which supports the Firm’s strategy, delivered by an innovative, world-class team of professionals. Technology Risk (TR) is part of the global Technology organization and manages operational and technology related risks on behalf of the Firm. The group's key principles are to provide proactive, comprehensive and consistent risk management, to enable the execution of the Firm’s strategy. TR's mandate is to enable the Firm to manage its technology and data related risks through implementing proactive, comprehensive and consistent risk management practices across the Firm to protect the franchise while capturing business opportunities. The TR team partners with the business by ensuring that Technology understands how to manage escalate and monitor risk.  Morgan Stanley’s state-of-the-art Cybersecurity Fusion Center (Fusion) is charged with orchestrating prevention, detection, and response to cyber events that threaten the Firm’s clients, assets, and reputation. Partnering with key stakeholders across Technology and the business, Fusion manages cyber events from detection through response to resolution, and serves as the Firm’s focal point for cyber communications and reporting. Fusing together information received externally from our partners and internally from our detection and analytics teams to enable rapid decision-making, Fusion is the cornerstone of the Firm’s agile and adaptive cyber defense strategy – enabling the Firm to rapidly align our defensive capabilities to adapt to changing adversary tactics.  Training Program  The Summer Analyst program includes a Firmwide orientation to Morgan Stanley’s businesses and division specific training. Your training will continue throughout the summer with structured learning sessions run by senior executives. Similarly, you will have many opportunities to integrate with peers and senior colleagues through a series of networking, social, and charity events.  Responsibilities  As a Summer Analyst, you will be placed into either of the teams below. Team placement will be determined based on a mutual fit, taking into consideration your interest and skill set.   Identity & Access Management:  Enables onboarding, viewing, and off-boarding access to Firm applications, ensuring least privileged access and segregation duties  Fraud & Cyber Analytics:  Leverages offensive cyber tactics to identify threats within the Firm’s network through the creation of advanced custom cyber analytics to hunt for higher end threat actors  Enterprise Security Platforms:  Implements the architecture, engineering, deployment and operations of technical security controls and capabilities for the Enterprise.  Cyber Incident Response:  Provides incident response capability to support day to day cross enterprise event investigations and provides strategic input into security controls and countermeasures   Responsibilities may include:   Analyze security logs to look for indicators of attack and compromise, and threat activity patterns  Research on latest threat actor tactics, techniques and procedures for analytic development potential  Develop specific, cutting edge analytics to detect malicious activity in our technology environment  Engage with stakeholders to identify opportunities to tune existing analytics  Investigate cybersecurity incidents and threats  Engage with stakeholders and leadership teams as part of the response and remediation efforts  Improve the detection, escalation, containment and resolution of incidents  Enhance existing incident response methods, tools, and processes  Maintain knowledge of technologies and the threat landscape   Qualifications:   You are an undergraduate, Masters or Ph.D. student and graduating between December 2022 and July 2023.  Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Data Analytics or other technical / quantitative majors preferred.  A genuine interest in cybersecurity.  You have experience with at least one programming language or scripting language: e.g. Python, C++ or Java.  You have operating system knowledge (Windows and Unix).  You are detail oriented, and a critical thinker who can anticipate issues and solve problems.  You have excellent problem-solving, communication, teamwork, and analytical skills.  You are fluent in English.  Experience in the Financial Services sector is not required.   Application Process and Deadline  Application processes will vary by division, but will likely include the following: CV review, OnDemand Video Interview, HackerRank technical assessment, Superday    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_title: Head of Business Performance and Insights, Google Cloud - Singapore
job_description: Job Description  The area: Google Cloud  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.  The role: Head of Business Performance and Insights, Google Cloud - Singapore  The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  Additional Role Description:  We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. Our team of highly creative visionaries thrives in deconstructing and re-creating businesses to meet changing strategic and operational needs, enable, incubate and scale innovation, establish more efficient practices, align functions and stakeholders to help the company continue to achieve its vast potential.  As the Head of Business Performance and Insights, you will be a critical leader on the APAC Google Cloud Go-to-Market Strategy and Operations team. You will be responsible for driving deep forward-looking insights (market, competition, internal) on our business and shaping our business actions and strategies, establishing and driving a consistent business operating rhythm and act as the steward of our data and tools and drive a consistent tools landscape across our teams.  Reporting to the Head of Go-to-Market Strategy and Operations, you will engage with senior global and regional business and cross-functional leaders, drive global thought leadership, and build and scale a business performance management team.  Responsibilities:  - Develop insights on the APAC Google Cloud business performance and present actions, programs, and strategies to improve our performance (business growth, pipeline, productivity, health indicators) for the short and long-term.  - Support Google Cloud leadership on our regular business performance reviews and drive market and competitive insights within the region to influence our strategies and plans.  - Establish and drive a consistent business operating rhythm and tools and dashboards to inspect the numbers and drive remedial actions (or scale best practices).  - Lead, manage, and mentor a business performance management and insights team.  - Work cross-functionally with other leaders, including Global Strategy and Operations and Finance, to drive a tightly integrated set of strategies and plans.  Minimum qualifications:  - MBA or Master's degree.  - 12 years of experience in either Finance, Management Consulting, Corporate Strategy, Sales Strategy, and Operations or Sales Analytics, or equivalent relevant experience in sales finance or planning and project management.  - Experience in developing and scaling teams.  Preferred qualifications:  - Experience in standardizing, streamlining, automating critical business analytics, and reporting.  - Experience in co-designing/developing robust management information systems.  - Experience leading cross-functional project teams through outstanding problem-framing and problem-structuring skills, project management skills, and the ability to communicate insights and “so what’s” to highly technical management teams.  - Demonstrated business acumen and ability to successfully navigate and influence within a complex business environment.  - Understanding of cloud economics and analyzing a consumption based business model. In this Senior Developer position, you will be working with a team that are building the best possible eCommerce application for our B2C customers. You’ll work closely with our business stakeholders and other partners to implement new solutions. In this role, you will be working with other talented engineering minds across the company working on some of the coolest technologies. Write software and participate in code reviews in debugging and coding to resolve issues.  Responsible for the production monitoring, incident management, change requests and projects. Train and transfer knowledge to other team members, users and stakeholders as required.  Keep up to date with latest technologies and tools and evangelize their value within the development teams.   Pre-Requisites   Bachelor’s Degree in IT or equivalent with 5+ years of experience within an eCommerce industry  In depth knowledge of SAP commerce cloud. Hands on experience in SAP commerce cloud 6.0+ versions. At least 2 SAP commerce cloud E2E implementations.  Strong Java/J2EE background with deeper knowledge on Spring frameworks such as spring-security, spring-mvc, spring-data, JPA & hibernate.  Strong knowledge on integrating with SAP backend systems. Strong knowledge in front end technologies involving JavaScript, jQuery, Angular JS, Bootstrap, HTML/CSS.  Experience with the build & deployment processes with Jenkins, code quality tools like Sonar, Fortify  Experience with Linux, Tomcat and Apache httpd.  Good working knowledge of change control and version control processes using source code control tools, specifically Git.  Working knowledge of build tools such as Ant and Maven and hands on with the devops processes.  Have excellent interpersonal, listening, verbal, and written communication skills.  Experience in design, integrations, interfacing with vendor technology/solutions, guiding and mentoring internal teams on architectural/integration decisions. Familiarity with template driven rendering and client and server side MVC architectures.  Familiarity with Splunk / Loggly / Kibana for investigating or monitoring problems on systems. company: AMAZON WEB SERVICES SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED
job_description: Job Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world’s leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing start-ups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation. At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in Singapore. Learn more about a career opportunity as a Business Analyst in the Cloud Sales Center (CSC) at AWS.  As a Business Analyst, you are the subject matter expert to fulfil data-driven decision making demands, querying and extracting large datasets and effectively using the accompanying tools and programming languages needed to work with them. As the successful candidate, you must be willing to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large and complex datasets. You will continuously evolve business reporting, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting and analytical tools, and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity. You will possess good communication and project management skills, is customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights; both verbally and in writing; in a clear and precise manner.   ABOUT THIS ROLE  In this role, you will be part of an exciting and newly formed team who is on a mission to accelerate customer adoption of AWS services and forming a high velocity and scalable inside sales organisation across APJ. To be successful, you will demonstrate the ability to Invent and Simplify and always Dive Deep (see Amazon Leadership Principles). You will lead the development of self-service reporting and analysis by creating and owning business reports and insight products, conduct data analysis to solve business problems through the use of statistical and/or machine learning models. You will continuously sharpen your skillset by learning and maintaining knowledge of existing and emerging reporting/analytical tools. In addition, the Business Analyst will collaborate with the internal and global reporting/analytical teams on the design, development and maintenance/enhancement of insights products demonstrating Customer Obsession.  Want to know more about what it’s like to be part of our team at AWS? Hear from our builders (see AWS Builder Stories).   Basic qualifications   Bachelor’s degree with emphasis on statistical and analytical skills  7+ years of relevant experience  Demonstrated proficiency in relational databases (Redshift, RDS, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.) and SQL for querying and extracting data  Demonstrated proficiency in at least one programming language (Python, Java, R, etc.) for data gathering, data cleansing and statistical analysis  Expertise in data visualisation software (QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.) for effective data presentation   Preferred qualifications   Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial  Proficiency in different types of databases (relational vs. non-relational, etc.) and their relevant use cases  Experience working with Cloud Computing  Experience in deploying artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models into production   What if I’m not an expert in all the above? That’s okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world’s leading cloud provider, apply now. We can’t wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS. CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that’s inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We’re committed to putting in the work for more equal representation Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Job Description  PURPOSE AND SCOPE   Our client is embarking on a major transformation journey that focused on improving value, deepen market presence, and capture product innovation and growth. At the core of this transformation is our client's Digital business aiming to further strengthen its leadership position through the modernization and innovation of its technology capability. The candidate responsible in Business Network team will help to deliver the business network projects leveraging both on premise and cloud infrastructure to support business and help to improve the operations of network infrastructure including data centers.   ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES   • Lead and drive on network projects and business expansion projects which support business demands,  • Drive improvements in network infrastructure operations, architecture design and delivery processes,  • Evaluate and recommend new technologies, co-ordinate with other IT sub-function heads to understand user requirements across geographies and design the IT services to meet the business needs, review the delivery of current services and assess ways to improve efficiency; supervise network infrastructure deployment and conduct post release reviews and provide in-depth technical advice & level 3 support to resolve complicated technical issues to maintain service availability and improve service levels,  • Liaise with business stakeholders to understand requirements, advise on new technologies or opportunities for cost savings, and service quality improvement, advise on capabilities and constraints of the infrastructure environment and communicate about implementation and expansions of network infrastructure strategy, architecture, and delivery processes; build relationships with third-party infrastructure and tool providers, lead negotiations with IT providers and vendors, oversee administration of vendor contracts and service agreements.  • Operation management - Manage incident and requests from customers. Ensure SLA and uptime meet business requirement. Manage IT asset utilization and plan for capacity requirement. Maintain and assure good security posture of computer resources. Manage IT business continuity plan and disaster recovery. Manage and track IT expenses to ensure operating within approved budgets and cloud expenses.  • Develop and maintain IT manuals, operational SOPs, technical architecture documentations and catalogues to ensure governance and consistency in delivery of IT services globally.  • Ensure high availability of IT service & network infrastructure in line with the stipulated service level agreements (SLAs). Manage recovery process and prepare incident reports in cases of system outages.  • Support overseas/ remote office IT infrastructure setup.  • Providing global level 3 administration & support on networking (LAN, WiFi, NAC, WAN, SD-WAN, Internet),  • Monitoring of IT Infrastructure to ensure optimal IT Services delivery,  • Support data center operation and administration,  • Management reporting – To provide monthly and yearly reports to Senior Management on IT Service SLA achievements, IT systems, networking and cloud capacity management, planning, utilizations, trending, and cost utilization.   QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE   • Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent with minimum 8 years of working experience network infrastructure design and support,  • Good knowledge in principles to provide customer satisfaction by meeting quality standards / SLA.  • Strong knowledge and a large experience on a broad range of infrastructure technologies such as Public & Hybrid Clouds platforms (Azure, Office 365, AWS, etc.) Networking, Windows/Linux Server platforms, Windows Desktop platforms, Directory Services, High Availability configurations, Virtualization (VMware, Hyper-V, Citrix), cloud services, collaboration tools and trends.  • Technical know-how and experience in IT solutions such as (but not limited to) and at least operated in more than one of the following:  • A must to have in-depth experience in architecture design, managing and support the following applications/systems – Cisco Networking & Aruba WiFi solutions, 802.1x NAC technologies, BGP/OSPF/MPLS/IPSec/SDN WAN/Internet, Hybrid Cloud Networking Computing Platforms & Technologies (Office365, Azure, AWS,etc) and AAA technologies (TACACS+ and RADIUS).  • Good knowledge in administrating the following technologies will be a plus – Microsoft Windows, Linux based Operating Systems, Open Source, VMware & Hyper-V hypervisors & Solarwinds.  • Certifications such as Cisco CCNP/CCDP/CCIE, PMP/ PRINCE2, ITIL V3, AWS Certified Solutions Architect/ Azure Solutions Architect will be an added advantage.   PREFERRED SKILLSSTRONG INTERPERSONAL, COMMUNICATION AND PRESENTATION SKILLS.   • Independent worker with initiatives, resourceful, positive attitude, friendly deposition, good team player and able to deliver results within tight deadlines.  • Ability to deal effectively with senior and mid-level executive/management teams.  • Independent with excellent problem-solving skills.   • Must be highly energetic, analytical, self-driven, proactive and have excellent attention to details.   • Some on-call, after hours and or weekend work may be required.   • Ability to coordinate with cross-functional work teams toward task completion.   • Ability to efficiently prioritize and organize competing work demands with little oversight.  • Open to learn new technologies. This position interacts frequently with internal and external personnel; must work and think independently as well as in teams; duties of this position are to be completed under minimal guidance. Decision making is a key component of this position, and decisions have a serious impact on the overall success of the Organization. In addition, he /she also act as a supervisor to all the Onsite Support Staffs.    Knowledge, Skills and Abilities   The following competencies are required for this position:   Communication  Good in verbal and written communications in English  Ability to articulate information  Ability to converse fluently in technical and non-technical manner  Ability to interact well with end users and internal team   Team work   Good Team player and leader who can motivate his / her team  Able to manage team members from various competencies.   Problem solving   Ability to perform root cause analysis and resolve end-user related issues or escalate accordingly.  Ability to work with various competencies to analyze the root cause   Self Management   Must be organized and responsible  High Integrity and diligence   Technology / Skill   Very good knowledge on desktop services and technology  Some knowledge on Server and Network Infrastructure  Fluent on basic IT Services and Service Management  Project Management.   Excellent written and verbal communication skills including excellent listening skills to communicate clearly, concisely and effectively.  Position-relevant computer experience including Microsoft Office.  Follow all company safety practices, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) and policies.   KEY PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES   a. SLA Performance – Ensure no SLA Failure  b. IMAC Reports – Ensure all IMAC Requests are performed in accordance to the SLA  c. Tracking of Cases – Ensure all cases are tracked to closure in accordance to the deliverables  d. Resources – Manage the resources on day to day basis to ensure designated resources are in place.  e. All meetings with internal and external parties are documented and followed through  h. Responsiveness – All emails, calls and any other communication are responded to, on a timely manner   Working location: Singapore General Hospital    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

company: AMAZON WEB SERVICES SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED
job_description: Job Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world’s leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing start-ups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation. At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in Singapore. Learn more about a career opportunity as a Business Analyst in the Cloud Sales Center (CSC) at AWS.  As a Business Analyst, you are the subject matter expert to fulfil data-driven decision making demands, querying and extracting large datasets and effectively using the accompanying tools and programming languages needed to work with them. As the successful candidate, you must be willing to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large and complex datasets. You will continuously evolve business reporting, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting and analytical tools, and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity. You will possess good communication and project management skills, is customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights; both verbally and in writing; in a clear and precise manner.   ABOUT THIS ROLE  In this role, you will be part of an exciting and newly formed team who is on a mission to accelerate customer adoption of AWS services and forming a high velocity and scalable inside sales organisation across APJ. To be successful, you will demonstrate the ability to Invent and Simplify and always Dive Deep (see Amazon Leadership Principles). You will lead the development of self-service reporting and analysis by creating and owning business reports and insight products, conduct data analysis to solve business problems through the use of statistical and/or machine learning models. You will continuously sharpen your skillset by learning and maintaining knowledge of existing and emerging reporting/analytical tools. In addition, the Business Analyst will collaborate with the internal and global reporting/analytical teams on the design, development and maintenance/enhancement of insights products demonstrating Customer Obsession.  Want to know more about what it’s like to be part of our team at AWS? Hear from our builders (see AWS Builder Stories).    Basic qualifications   Bachelor’s degree with emphasis on statistical and analytical skills  7+ years of relevant experience  Demonstrated proficiency in relational databases (Redshift, RDS, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.) and SQL for querying and extracting data  Demonstrated proficiency in at least one programming language (Python, Java, R, etc.) for data gathering, data cleansing and statistical analysis  Expertise in data visualisation software (QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.) for effective data presentation   Preferred qualifications   Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial  Proficiency in different types of databases (relational vs. non-relational, etc.) and their relevant use cases  Experience working with Cloud Computing  Experience in deploying artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models into production   What if I’m not an expert in all the above? That’s okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world’s leading cloud provider, apply now. We can’t wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS. CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that’s inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We’re committed to putting in the work for more equal representation Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. job_description: Job Description  As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family.   Information Technology  IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board’s IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems.   Responsibilities  You will be responsible to provide storage administration support and configuration of the storage, archival and backup systems to achieve a high level of security, resiliency and recoverability, including disaster recovery provisions.  The area of your responsibilities include   Perform storage monitoring, configuration and patching management and operational support including incidents management and troubleshooting  Establish and review the storage, archival and backup policies, architecture and design artefact for all systems and databases and ensure operational compliance.  Accountable for capacity management, optimisation and sustainable operations in the allocation and utilisation of infrastructure resources  Develop and maintain technical documents where applicable   Requirements   Minimally 4 years of hands-on experience in storage, archival or backup management and administration on enterprise class SAN Storage, Archival and Backup systems  Familiarity in one or more of the followings:  Deep technical knowledge of multi-vendor storage technologies.  Various SAN platform from EMC, NetApp, IBM, HP and Cisco  SAN Storage Technologies – EMC VMAX, Unity, VNX, NetApp, HP 3PAR, IBM XIV and DDN  NAS Storage Technologies – EMC Isilon and NetApp  operational experience in managing critical backup infrastructure, restorations and database restorations  Good knowledge in hardware and software, clustering solutions, enterprise SAN, server and storage virtualization technologies  Windows server platform, knowledge of Unix/ Solaris/ Linux & VMWare platform  Familiarity in ITIL processes and procedures  Ability to work beyond business hours and weekends for work contingencies where necessary  Position will be on 2-year contract   Seniority of appointment will commensurate with relevant work experience. job_description: Job Description  The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on ByteDance platforms (e.g. TikTok, CapCut, Resso, Lark), covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc. In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences.   Description   - Provide risk assessment and risk solution plans for different products and businesses, promote the implementation of relevant plans, and ensured the safe development of TikTok , live broadcast, e-commerce and advertising business;   - Develop forward-looking risk control strategies through analyzing user behavior, content, user feedback and other data, drive the improvement and upgrade of product safety mechanism, and be responsible for the effect of risk solution plans;   - Cooperate with risk control RD, build and improve risk perception, identification, intervention and governance effect measurement system, and design common risk control products and services that can support different businesses;   - Conduct in-depth investigation into the changing trend of CIB networks in different countries, and be sensitive to the company's business and strategy; be able to discern new risk points from the industry and business trends; deploy risk control mechanisms in advance to prevent the occurrence of risks, and ensur that the risk control ability was at the leading level in the industry.   Requirements   - Bachelor degree or above, major in computer/information security/statistics/mathematics or related is preferred, with technical background is preferred;   - At least 5 years of working experience in Internet products, preferably in strategy, risk control or related fields;   - Strong sense of responsibility and team work spirit, excellent learning ability, and goal-oriented;   - Strong curiosity and self-motivated, willing to accept challenges and aim for the best    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  About Envision Digital:  Envision Digital is focused on bringing technology solutions to the sustainability challenge . Its world-class AIoT technology helps governments and companies across the world accelerate progress toward a net zero future and improve their citizens’ quality of life. Having established itself as a leading solutions provider for intelligent renewable energy generation, consumption efficiency and smart flexible storage, it has extended its capabilities beyond energy to enable and optimise applications notably in smart cities, smart buildings and estates, smart infrastructures, e-mobility and smart plants.  EnOS™, Envision Digital’s proprietary AIoT operating system, connects and manages more than 100 million smart devices and 200 gigawatts of energy assets globally, while its growing ecosystem of more than 350 customers and partners spans 10 industries and includes Accenture, Amazon Web Services, GovTech Singapore, Keppel Corporation, Microsoft, Nissan, PTT, Sonnen, Solarvest and Total. The company has around 700 employees and 12 offices across China, France, Japan, Germany, Norway, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, and the United States, with headquarters in Singapore. job_description: Job Description  Job Summary and Mission  This position contributes to the success of wizlynx group by performing the following:   Responsible for development and operational activities across the entire scope of our clients Security Governance, Risk and Compliance programs.The job encompasses leading and participating in the assessment of security, risks, and control effectiveness for applications, infrastructure, and technology projects. The Specialist will identify, classify, and document control issues in our clients computing environment by documenting assessment results, recommending corrective action, tracking remediation, evaluating policy and control standard exceptions, and regularly reporting to our clients IT management.  Serve as the primary contact point for issue escalation  Manage service support requirements and ensure that quality plan, KPIs/SLAs are met  Draft support SOP and documentation  Models and acts in accordance with wizlynx group guiding principles   With this position, you will also have the opportunity to get introduced to different areas of information and cyber security such as Offensive Security & Penetration Testing  Summary of Key Responsibilities.   Leads IT control assessments for our clients to ensure effective IT controls are in place to meeting operational and compliance requirements.  Works with our clients IT, Internal Audit, Compliance and other key stakeholders to create an IT GRC strategy that complies with professional standards and addresses the IT risks inherent in our client’s operations and industry.  Develops Vendor Risk Management policies and supports client’s risk profile assessment for vendor on-boarding process and conducts annual review of critical vendors.  Performs ongoing logical access reviews and recommends updates to access control privileges to ensure proper Segregation of Duties based on user access reviews.  Effectively reports and communicates testing results to client’s IT management for corrective action, where required.  Conducts information security awareness training.  Performs evidence collection and project management assistance of our clients annual compliance (e.g. CREST, PCI DSS) certification program.  Track and monitor risk exceptions to ensure control deviations are identified and mitigating controls are in place.  Assist our clients with drafting and maintaining information security policies  Provides mentoring for other team members.  Demonstrates excellent project management skills, inspires teamwork and responsibility with engagement team members, and uses current technology/tools to enhance the effectiveness of deliverables and services.  Facilitates the performance and testing of our client’s annual disaster recovery tests and business continuity plans.   Summary of Ideal Experience, Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities  Ideal Experience   One to two years of experience in information security audit or in a technology-related audit or compliance field, and strong knowledge base in operations, enterprise networking, system evaluation/architecture and consulting experience preferred  Strong understanding of and ability to provide security configuration and testing of networking and operating systems including TCP/IP, WAN/LAN routing, VLAN architecture, and a wide array of large-scale environments including various major web application servers  Strong understanding of information security principles such as ISO 27001, PCI-DSS, and PDPA.   Language Skills   Fluent technical English (speech and writing)  Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing, in local language   Soft Skills   Excellent team leadership, team oriented and team player who takes ownership  Flexible attitude, reliable, action oriented  Customer friendly approach and appearance  Willingness to travel  Innovative to push new ideas, dynamic and forward looking with clear management principle towards the team  Able to work independently, critical thinking and be able to communicate effectively with the support team and customers  Enjoys working in global team with different cultures   Technical Skills and Abilities   Microsoft OS and Office knowledge  Technical document writing  Experience in Project Management in IT  Knowledge in perimeter firewall infrastructure and VPN remote access   Summary of Education  Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university in an appropriate field  Certifications / Training   CISM, CISA, CRISC, CISSP certified  ITSM or ITIL certified  Functional certification such as MCSE, CCNA, CNE preferred   KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS / MEASURES OF SUCCESS   Achieve agreed targets/SLA/KPI in terms of quality, time and cost  Lead team members to achieve team/organizational goals  Improve and retain high customer satisfaction   POTENTIAL CAREER DEVELOPMENT  Advance to higher business development tiers or geographic reach    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

We expect everyone to play their part in :  Putting Members First  Building an Inclusive Community  Delivering the Unexpected  Be Always Evolving, and  Keeping it Real  Why work for us   At Aaqua we are committed to real economic value distribution and this extends to our people. Job Details  Supports IBX Operations and Security teams within the following areas:    Business Systems  Develops hands-on knowledge of security systems to resolve issues within a moderate scope  Provides security systems support and directs moderate installations and configurations for IBX Operations  Performs the Single Point of Failure (SPOF) and End of Life (EOL) reviews, including site physicals, assessments   Project Management  Responsible for the coordination and completion of security projects, sets deadlines, assigns responsibilities, monitors and summarizes progress of project, within a moderate scope  Assists in the planning and coordination of project scheduling, budgeting, administrative tasks, and facilitates and conducts meetings, records meeting minutes/action items, and performs basic follow-up, while utilizing developing expertise  Researches and analyzes data to evaluate moderate operational difficulties, may make recommendations to solve problems, identifies, and monitors issues that affect profitability, growth, and productivity, and manage lists, libraries and related workflow   Process Engineering  Resolves the rollout of information security processes across all sites within a moderate scope  Uses developing skills in reviewing physical security processes (e.g., access card key management process) within the IBX and identifies opportunities for process improvement; Must have excellent written and verbal communications skills, and ability to use Microsoft Office Suite, AutoDesk REVIT, AutoCAD and SketchUp with proficiency. Job Description  The Academic Computing and Information Services (ACIS) division oversees and supports the information communication technologies (ICT) needs of NIE. We invite applications for the position of ICT Support Engineer in the ACIS division. Join us for an exciting career as we work towards transforming the education landscape in Singapore.   Job Summary  The ICT Support Engineer reports to the IT Service Delivery Manager of Service Management Department. His/her primary responsibilities are to engage and manage customers while meeting their needs and expectation for IT services, provides ICT support to NIE stakeholders, identify root causes, offer appropriate solutions and escalate to suppliers if necessary. He/she shall also focus on managing the IT assets, establishing the essential technical know-how, ensure prompt resolution to equipment and service failure, and work closely with the service desk team, engineers and managers to achieve proper operation and good end-user experience.   Job Responsibilities:   Handle customers’ service calls and enquiries that covers all IT issues and complaints and attend to them in a pleasant and professional manner.  Work closely with the IT Service Desk and technical support teams to provide IT customer service to NIE, deliver efficient and quality IT services as well as ensuring seamless end-to-end delivery of services to the NIE community.  Fulfil service requests and provide technical support for IT-related incidents via various customer touchpoints by performing technical analysis and resolution.  Generate useful knowledge for service improvement through analysis of issues encountered at Service Desk.  Meet SLA targets by tracking assigned tasks and provide timely reports. Job Description  About Envision Digital:  Envision Digital is focused on bringing technology solutions to the sustainability challenge . Its world-class AIoT technology helps governments and companies across the world accelerate progress toward a net zero future and improve their citizens’ quality of life. Having established itself as a leading solutions provider for intelligent renewable energy generation, consumption efficiency and smart flexible storage, it has extended its capabilities beyond energy to enable and optimise applications notably in smart cities, smart buildings and estates, smart infrastructures, e-mobility and smart plants.  EnOS™, Envision Digital’s proprietary AIoT operating system, connects and manages more than 100 million smart devices and 200 gigawatts of energy assets globally, while its growing ecosystem of more than 350 customers and partners spans 10 industries and includes Accenture, Amazon Web Services, GovTech Singapore, Keppel Corporation, Microsoft, Nissan, PTT, Sonnen, Solarvest and Total. The company has around 700 employees and 12 offices across China, France, Japan, Germany, Norway, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, and the United States, with headquarters in Singapore.  Job Description:  The Envision Digital Cyber Security organization is growing rapidly to help guide the company through its own global hyper growth phase. This growth is fueled by customer demand for our innovative cloud-based software and embedded product lines. As a Penetration Tester and Vulnerability Researcher you will be responsible for performing penetration testing, red team assessments, and conducting deep vulnerability research on the company’s technology stack and third party software and hardware. You will also:   Develop internal Red Team and Penetration Testing framework to facilitate assessments of products, services, including software, hardware, as well as new and existing public and private cloud instances  Conduct deep vulnerability research on disruptive technologies that could help the company grow its products and services offerings  Collaborate with 3rd parties including consulting firms and security researchers on coordinating assessments, validating vulnerability reports/findings and influencing remediation  Collaborate with team members, mentor, and teach them to create a positive work environment  Promotes best practices and design patterns   Required Qualifications:   Bachelor's Degree in Computer Engineering or in a STEM major (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math) and/or 4 years of equivalent experience in the Security field.  3 years of hands-on experience in penetration testing and research  Ability to successfully manage assessments and timeline commitments  Deep experience with assessing encryption, IAM services, VPN and other cloud services.  •Experience facilitating penetration testing efforts in one or more of the following Compliance frameworks (FedRAMP, SOC)  Experience with reverse engineering tools (e.g. disassemblers, debuggers, instrumentation frameworks, etc.).  Good understanding of concepts in vulnerability research: Shell code, ROP, ASLR, exploit types, and heap manipulation  Must be able to manage new and existing security requirements, help with training personnel, and implement controls  Experience with Python, PowerShell, BASH, PHP, Ruby or similar scripting language  Experience recommending controls in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure and alike to facilitate remediation cadence  Experience with broad set of information security technologies and processes within a SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, or cloud environment   Preferred Qualifications:   Possess professional-level certifications (OSCP, GPEN, GWAPT, GXPN)  Significant experience in cryptography, network security or systems security  Significant experience in micro segmentation, clusters, virtualization, containerization (K8, Docker) high availability, load balancing  Experience in large enterprise and cloud environments  Credited with one or more CVEs in 2020  Skilled at explaining complex technical issues in terms understandable by the business  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially experience with executive-level communications  Experience with web-based applications and/or web services-based applications, especially at massive scale   Travel:  Occasional travel is required (COVID pending)    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  About Envision Digital:  Envision Digital is focused on bringing technology solutions to the sustainability challenge . Its world-class AIoT technology helps governments and companies across the world accelerate progress toward a net zero future and improve their citizens’ quality of life. Having established itself as a leading solutions provider for intelligent renewable energy generation, consumption efficiency and smart flexible storage, it has extended its capabilities beyond energy to enable and optimise applications notably in smart cities, smart buildings and estates, smart infrastructures, e-mobility and smart plants.  EnOS™, Envision Digital’s proprietary AIoT operating system, connects and manages more than 100 million smart devices and 200 gigawatts of energy assets globally, while its growing ecosystem of more than 350 customers and partners spans 10 industries and includes Accenture, Amazon Web Services, GovTech Singapore, Keppel Corporation, Microsoft, Nissan, PTT, Sonnen, Solarvest and Total. The company has around 700 employees and 12 offices across China, France, Japan, Germany, Norway, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, and the United States, with headquarters in Singapore.    Roles and Responsibilities:  We are seeking a candidate with technical background in Solar, Wind and Energy Storage System to join a fast growing team in digitalization of Renewable Energy and Energy IoT at Envision Digital Singapore HQ office. You will work in the renewable energy team, and take on the responsibilities of customers engagement and technical presales, closely collaborating with global cross-functional teams from go-to-market, presales, solution architects, and domain experts.  · Work closely with Go-to-market (GTM) / sales teams, meet with customers, attend exhibitions and trade shows, lead renewable software product demo and UAT sessions;  · Liaise with customers to understand needs / project requirements (e.g. regarding data connectivity, real-time monitoring, performance analytics and technical asset management), define appropriate solutions with solution architects, delivery team and product team, and be responsible for technical proposals, responses to RFP/RFI;  · Assist in achieving sales and margin targets for renewables software products, including solar, wind, energy storage system and hydro in the APAC region;  · Explore, screen and identify new business opportunities; Follow through and ensure deals’ contractual close;  · Develop business plans and go-to-market strategies for renewables products;  · Build technical relationships with renewable asset owners, asset managers, developers, EPC and O&M companies, in the APAC region;  · Address customers, channel partners, and go-to-market teams’ request about all presales issues;  · Prepare and maintain high quality presales materials, demo and product marketing materials;  · Gather information from market and customers and feedback to internal teams;  · Travel is required   Desired Skills and Experience:  · Master’s degree and above, in engineering or physical science degrees or equivalent, with emphasis in renewable technologies (e.g. solar, wind or energy storage);  · Minimum 5 years of experience in renewable industry, with good knowledge in PV, Wind or BESS design, balance of plant design, resource assessment, modeling, operation and maintenance requirements;  · Good experiences in renewable asset management, condition monitoring, operation and maintenance, performance modeling, and performance engineering; Asset performance, reliability and failure analyses are preferred;  · Experiences in digitization, IoT, AI, SaaS, EMS, SCADA and data communication protocols are preferred;  · Have a good mix of technical, business and soft skills;  · Excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation and writing skills, with demonstrated experience in communicating and operating in a fast-paced global environment and the ability to engage with audiences at different levels including C-suites senior management;  · Self-motivated and strong interests in digital software solutions for renewable energy, energy storage and other low carbon technologies;  · Willing to travel    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Fenergo's Client Solutions Consulting Team is at the forefront of our company's success and growth strategy as it works collaboratively with prospect clients to identify current opportunities and challenges, develop knowledge and understanding of our solution and determine how to leverage Fenergo it for their business. Essentially, we build on our extensive industry experience to identify a client’s strategic and tactical goals and align them to where Fenergo can solve their challenges and realise their ambitions. We then take this analysis a step further by demonstrating how Fenergo can add real quantifiable value for their organisation.   The Client Solutions team work closely with our Global Sales Teams who identify potential opportunities and we then provide the detailed business and technical support throughout the sales cycle. Similarly, we work closely with our product team identifying gaps and opportunities directly contributing to the product roadmap and our future success.  This is a client-facing role so you will have to build relationships and act as the first point of contact with the client’s stakeholders and subject matter experts. The role requires absolute professionalism in advising clients and guiding them through the multi-faceted change process to deliver early and continuous value to their organisations.   Core Responsibilities:  For each prospect engagement you will work alongside the sales team and other internal stakeholders including the regulatory team, professional services, and a technical team to guide the client through the following key tasks:   Ensure that the Fenergo application is presented in the best light with new and existing customers  Deliver product demos to demonstrate how Fenergo can help them deliver meaningful and rapid improvements in their organisation this includes demo preparation, delivery and follow up outstanding questions  Understand client challenges and develop appropriate solutions necessary to win new business  Lead and conduct onsite engagements to understand customer processes, requirements and facilitate architecture / solution discussions.  Work with prospect clients to align their tactical and strategic challenges through implementing the Fenergo product across their organisation  Proactively scope the functional and technical requirements to address customer requirements, assesses customers met and unmet needs, and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and the Fenergo.  Maintain and expand working knowledge of the Fenergo product. Provide feedback to the product organization on enhancements.  In conjunction with Sales Ops Support complete RFx documents on behalf of the company  Use knowledge of competitive solutions to help the sales organization to propose the most optimal solution for the customer  Ensures that sales, product and professional services organizations are properly aligned to achieve client and sales objectives.  Build strong relationships within the project team, client teams and internal Product Management team  Keep abreast of product, regulatory and industry changes    About you:   Excellent Client Facing Skills with the ability to Own the Room. Soft Skills include Communication, Co-ordination, and Negotiation  Bilingual skills and experience working within Asia  Natural leader looking to ensure a positive outcome for the organization  Understands business goals and market perceptions and how the Client Solutions team impacts both.  Seeker of information (internal and external) to help drive the right approach to lead to the right outcomes  Knowledge on organization offerings with a strong focus on attention to detail.  It is an advantage to have worked in the Financial Services industry or a software company in a different industry, but neither are mandatory.  We are looking to hire people who are passionate about using our technology to solve customer problems. If you are self-motivated, detail-oriented and have the confidence to communicate your ideas both verbally and in writing then you should talk to us. It could be that a new exciting chapter in your career awaits.  Previous experience in the consulting industry would be highly favourable.   Benefits:   23 days annual leave per year  Comprehensive health insurance policy for employee and dependents  Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale  Extensive training programmes, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University’  Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies  Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress  Active sports and social club. job_description: Job Description  Technology Transformation is the leading practice within public and private-sector organizations around the world. In the age of rapidly evolving technology systems and standards, utilizing technology as a business advantage is more critical than ever, but the multitude of options add complexity to business decisions around technology investments. At KPMG, the Technology Transformation team is at the core of innovation to deliver the most technically challenging and cutting-edge solutions to help our clients lead transformation in their business.  Together with the Technology Transformation team, you will work with cross-functional teams of experts to help customers design, plan, implement, and govern enterprise architecture based on client’s business requirements.   The role includes:   Lead and drive the delivery of transformation projects with our clients  Develop KPMG’s transformation proposition and capabilities to take to market  Build new market entry strategies and drive transformative changes in our clients  Work with C-suite at our clients to define and implement a comprehensive, agile blueprint to transform the enterprise architecture that underpins the digital IT strategy, and execute the infrastructure and security strategy to minimize risk  Play a crucial role in the team, shaping and contributing to KPMG’s strategy and thought leadership for clients around large-scale IT transformation and next generation technologies   The ideal candidate should possess:   Tertiary Qualification in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Business Finance, Business Management or equivalent  Minimum of 8 years of experience in consulting, banking or fintech environment and focuses on delivering transformation projects in process re-design, operational efficiency, branch transformation, etc  Take the lead in the strategy, plan, and design of IT enterprises roadmap & solutions to support business and operations across the enterprise/organization.  Lead in initiatives to identify relevant cloud (or hybrid) technologies that are secure, scalable, reliable, trusted, and effective for adoption across the organization  Professional certifications such as AWS Solution Architect or other relevant qualifications (Google Professional Cloud Architect, Azure solutions architect)  Develop productivity tools and training for other Sales / Pre-Sales Consultants, Solution Engineers and Solution Architects.  Strong client and project management abilities coupled with excellent communication, written, analytical, organisational and problem-solving skills  Strong understanding of DevOps and Agile Methodologies  Experience in Government Commercial Cloud (GCC) or Government Private Cloud (GPC) will be an added advantage   Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team, personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.
