job_title: Associate Cybersecurity Engineer IMDA CLT - Part-Time
job_description: Job Description  Our Company  For more than a century, our Company has been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, it continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.   Our Singapore IT Hub  Established in 2015, our Singapore IT Hub aims to harness digital solutions for better business outcomes. One of its key focuses is in using analytics and data science to guide better decision-making.  Home to more than 300 employees with over 20 nationalities, the Singapore IT Hub is part of a global network, with sister hubs located in the United States and Czech Republic. In Singapore, the hub houses a wide span of IT capabilities teams ranging from Data Science, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity & Risk Management to Enterprise Platforms and many more. Across Japan, China and the Asia Pacific region, the hub works closely with colleagues from all divisions of the company to drive our core business.   This position is part of the  Company Led Training (CLT) programme  which is structured development programme jointly developed by the our Singapore IT Hub and the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) that aims to enable fresh and mid-level professionals to acquire specialist expertise for jobs in demand by the industry, especially those that support Smart Nation projects. More details  here .  The position's charter includes engineering, designing, and deploying cybersecurity security solutions in accordance to the program or project requirements, corporate policies and security standards   Responsibilities:  · Research, select, develop, test and deploy security products providing capabilities in the following areas: antimalware, network security, web security, application/platform security, encryption, data leakage protection, and security analytics.  · Ensure security solutions designed, engineered and deployed are in alignment with the security architecture and strategy, and support MSD’s policies and standards, best practices, as well as meeting performance, scalability and availability requirements.  · Create technical designs, recommended configurations and drawings necessary to design, implement and deploy our current and future state security capabilities.  · Develop and execute various tests and procedures on a variety of security equipment to ensure that security systems are operating as designed.  · Assist in support, utilize and sustain various information security solutions such as, but not limited to network and web security solutions, application security solutions, and endpoint security solutions. Activities like problem resolution, equipment hardware/software issue resolution, system and product upgrades/updates and coordination of resources required for complex problem resolution.  * This role focuses on Cyber Security and technical domains may include Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Computing or Data Science & Analytics.   Who we are  Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.  We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.   What we look for  In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.   We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.   Please submit your application together with your resume directly via link -  https://msd.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/SearchJobs/job/SGP---Singapore---MYP-Centre-WeWork/Cloud-Specialist-IMDA-CLT_R141304   *NOTE:  “Only shortlisted candidates will be notified”. This role is supported under IMDA’s TeSA Company-Led Training Programme (CLT). By applying to the job posting, it is deemed that the applicant agrees to share their data with IMDA for the purpose of programme administration and verification purpose. Job applicants must be Singaporeans.   #TeSA #CLT    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Sr. Data Platform Engineer   Job Description:  In the role of Sr. Data Platform Engineer, you will be responsible for the end-to-end development of Data Analytics Platform and AI/ML Ops use cases to take our data engineering and analytics team and system into the future. The role must be hands-on.  The role is for a self-motivated individual with software engineering skills and expertise with Big Data technologies. The candidate will be extensively involved in hands-on activities including POCs, design, documentation, development, and test of new functionality. The candidate must be agile and flexible with changing priorities based on the team’s needs.   Responsibilities   Design & Architecture:  You help to design and implement an optimal data pipeline architecture for the analytics system. Identify, design, and implement improvements to automate manual processes, optimize speed and efficiency of data delivery, architecting and designing for high availability, scaling, and reliability. Architect and design infrastructure to facilitate data extraction, transformation, export, and query of data from a variety of data sources, both internal and external, both small and large.  Massive data : You will source/examine, analyze, engineer data pipelines for gigabytes/terabytes of structured and unstructured data with our platform to create value for customers. You will also be working with Enterprise data.  Pushing the limits : This role will be on the cutting edge of our Data / Machine Learning platform. As we push to solve more of our customer challenges, you will be prototyping new features, tools, and ideas. Innovate at a very fast pace to maintain our competitive edge.  Distributed Processing Engine:  You will be masterfully working on the data platform which involves the processing of both unbounded and bounded data sources, perform in-memory computation & transformation.  Production deployment : You will be responsible for the integration and deployment of the Data Ingestion & machine learning pipelines into production where your ideas can come to life.  Work with stakeholders including the Data Science teams, Business Systems Analysts, and Architecture teams to assist with data platform technical and organizational issues and support the company’s data and analytics needs.  Educate, train, and mentor members of the Data Engineering and Analytics teams in the design, implementation, and usage of modern data systems.   Qualifications for Data Platform Engineer   IT / CS fundamentals : You have earned at least a Bachelor’s / Master’s in Information Technology / Computer Science, or related degree AND you have a strong ethos of continuous learning.  Commercial software engineering : You have 11+ years of professional software development experience in multiple programming languages, including modern virtual-machine languages such as  Java , as well as common scripting and glue languages such as Python and version control (git), with good analytical & debugging skills. Experience performing  root-cause analysis on bugs and performance problems  in distributed systems, including network and source-level debugging.  Big data : You have extensive experience with data analytics and working knowledge of big data infrastructure such as Google Cloud, Big Query, Data Flow, Hadoop Eco System, HDFS, Apache Storm, Apache Spark. You've routinely built data pipelines with gigabytes/terabytes of data and understand the challenges of manipulating such large datasets.  Cloud Exposure:  Strong experience implementing systems and applications using distributed and cloud infrastructure . GCP is preferred , but AWS or Azure are also okay.  Data Modeling : Flair for data, schema, data model, PL/SQL, Star & snowflake schema, how to bring efficiency in data modelling for efficient querying data for analysis, understands criticality TDD and develops data validation techniques. Working knowledge of distributed relational and tabular data stores, message queues, stream processing facilities, and other scalable big-data platform technologies.  Real-Time Systems : Understands evolution of databases for in-memory, NoSQL & indexing technologies along with experience in real-time & stream processing systems like Google pub/sub, GCP technologies, Kafka, Storm, Spark Streaming.  Strong design skills : with a proven track record of success on large/highly complex projects preferably in Enterprise Apps and Integration. Advanced, hands-on knowledge of design, implementation, and optimization of big data architectures, pipelines, and data sets.  Project management : Professional experience in a modern software development life cycle, including requirements gathering, system design, unit and integration testing, continuous integration, and deployment. You demonstrate excellent project and time management skills, exposure to scrum or other agile practices in JIRA.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills : Must be able to effectively communicate & work with fellow team members and other functional team members to coordinate & meet deliverables. job_description: Job Description  Technology Transformation is the leading practice within public and private-sector organizations around the world. In the age of rapidly evolving technology systems and standards, utilizing technology as a business advantage is more critical than ever, but the multitude of options add complexity to business decisions around technology investments. At KPMG, the Technology Transformation team is at the core of innovation to deliver the most technically challenging and cutting-edge solutions to help our clients lead transformation in their business.  Together with the Technology Transformation team, you will work with cross-functional teams of experts to help customers design, plan, implement, and govern enterprise architecture based on client’s business requirements.   The role includes:   Lead and drive the delivery of transformation projects with our clients  Develop KPMG’s transformation proposition and capabilities to take to market  Build new market entry strategies and drive transformative changes in our clients  Work with C-suite at our clients to define and implement a comprehensive, agile blueprint to transform the enterprise architecture that underpins the digital IT strategy, and execute the infrastructure and security strategy to minimize risk  Play a crucial role in the team, shaping and contributing to KPMG’s strategy and thought leadership for clients around large-scale IT transformation and next generation technologies   The ideal candidate should possess:   Tertiary Qualification in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Business Finance, Business Management or equivalent  Minimum of 5 years of experience in consulting, banking or fintech environment and focuses on delivering transformation projects in process re-design, operational efficiency, branch transformation, etc  Take the lead in the strategy, plan, and design of IT enterprises roadmap & solutions to support business and operations across the enterprise/organization.  Lead in initiatives to identify relevant cloud (or hybrid) technologies that are secure, scalable, reliable, trusted, and effective for adoption across the organization  Professional certifications such as AWS Solution Architect or other relevant qualifications (Google Professional Cloud Architect, Azure solutions architect)  Develop productivity tools and training for other Sales / Pre-Sales Consultants, Solution Engineers and Solution Architects.  Strong client and project management abilities coupled with excellent communication, written, analytical, organisational and problem-solving skills  Strong understanding of DevOps and Agile Methodologies  Experience in Government Commercial Cloud (GCC) or Government Private Cloud (GPC) will be an added advantage   Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team, personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.   At KPMG in Singapore we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. job_title: SEA&I/PACIFIC PLANNING – IT BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST (BSA)
company: NIKE GLOBAL TRADING B.V. SINGAPORE BRANCH
job_description: Job Description  NIKE is a technology company. From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to developing products, managing big data and providing leading edge engineering and systems support, our teams at NIKE Global Technology exist to revolutionize the future at the confluence of tech and sport. We invest and develop advances in technology and employ the most creative people in the world, and then give them the support to constantly innovate, iterate and serve consumers more directly and personally. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.   WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:  Asia-Pacific Latin-America (APLA) is a multi-cultural, growth Geography that is seeking a leader with the functional and technical expertise that can lead a team of technical business systems analysts and the delivery and support of corporate functions, and planning technology solutions into the SEA&I/Pacific marketplace.  As IT Business Systems Analyst (BSA), you will become the expert of your local market and business needs and be able to translate those insights into technical requirements for both local and global technology solutions working closely with the Geo Technical Product and Engineering organizations. Core to this role is the understanding of the global technology platform strategy and the criticality of aligning to the principles of customizing / extending global platforms into territories and/ or providing alternative technology solutions aligned with geo and global platform owners strategy.  Actively participating in managing the application catalog for local and legacy technology solutions and environments as well as managing vendor relationships is a critical component of this role and working to drive towards global platforms and capabilities as well as proper operational management will be keys to you and your team’s success.  Critical to this role is understanding the end-to-end Lifecyle of the products, obsessing how products are performing in production and working closely with our Technical Operations organization as well as product owners to obsess incident and problem trends impacting our consumers and athletes.  Lastly, in this role, you will manage the intake of new ideas and asks from our business partners in territory, helping to assess them against strategic objectives, priorities, and resource capacity. In addition, as we delivery technology solutions you and your team will be critical to assessing and determining the delivery and transition approach as well as last mile technical implementation approach’s for your market   WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?  KEY COMPETENCIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES * Leadership: Be the subject matter expert in the corporate functions technology domain and provide technical leadership in any solution design and implementation.  * Product strategy, roadmap and requirement planning: ability to take business outcomes and customer research data and convert them into functional and non-functional requirements  * Stakeholder Management:  - Collaborate with stakeholders to define system functional requirements and translate them into technical requirements for development.- Provide technical support and guidance to stakeholder to ensure smooth business operations.- Define, develop and deliver solutions for process automation to improve stakeholder business process efficiency.  * Project Management and Change Management:  - Lead and manage small to medium project to ensure that the project is delivered and met to the project objectives.- Collaborate with various project team members and business stakeholders to ensure smooth execution and transition of the project.  * Product Management:  - Perform regular system maintenance and monitoring to ensure that system integrity, performance, security and compliance are meeting the Nike standard.- For global solutions, work with Geo Technical Product and engineering organization to infuse market specific nuances into solution requirements  * Functional Depth:  - Knowledge and experience in demand and supply management- Knowledge of other technologies used within a supply chain such as SAP, system integration technologies (i.e., Fusion and/or Informatica, EDI, Amazon Web Services (AWS)- Understand the needs and requirements of stakeholder in order to provide solutions to meet the business goals   WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH: * Cross functional Business stakeholder within the planning functions across multiple locations within SEA&I and Pacific. * SEA&I and Pacific as well as APLA technical and functional technology teams for requirement assessments, solution development and implementations.   WHAT YOU BRING TO NIKE - * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent. * 5+ years of planning technology experience * Experience and thorough understanding of Demand and Supply Management processes * Good business acumen with the ability to analyze and understand complex data structure * Experience in big data and ability to process large dataset is advantageous * Technical product and/or business system analyst (BSA) experience * Understanding of and experience in Agile project methodology * Excellent analytical skills and ability to translate business functionality and opportunities into technical solutions. * Ability to work with distributed workforce / teams, and communicate using virtual communication tools (phone, conferencing, online meeting). * Good communication and interpersonal skills * Relationship building with key stakeholders * Ability to deal with ambiguity and work in a dynamic, multicultural, and result-oriented matrixed environment * Self-motivated, with a high sense of accountability, urgency, and drive    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Sr. Data Platform Engineer   Job Description:  In the role of Sr. Data Platform Engineer, you will be responsible for the end-to-end development of Data Analytics Platform and AI/ML Ops use cases to take our data engineering and analytics team and system into the future. The role must be hands-on.  The role is for a self-motivated individual with software engineering skills and expertise with Big Data technologies. The candidate will be extensively involved in hands-on activities including POCs, design, documentation, development, and test of new functionality. The candidate must be agile and flexible with changing priorities based on the team’s needs.   Responsibilities   Design & Architecture:  You help to design and implement an optimal data pipeline architecture for the analytics system. Identify, design, and implement improvements to automate manual processes, optimize speed and efficiency of data delivery, architecting and designing for high availability, scaling, and reliability. Architect and design infrastructure to facilitate data extraction, transformation, export, and query of data from a variety of data sources, both internal and external, both small and large.  Massive data : You will source/examine, analyze, engineer data pipelines for gigabytes/terabytes of structured and unstructured data with our platform to create value for customers. You will also be working with Enterprise data.  Pushing the limits : This role will be on the cutting edge of our Data / Machine Learning platform. As we push to solve more of our customer challenges, you will be prototyping new features, tools, and ideas. Innovate at a very fast pace to maintain our competitive edge.  Distributed Processing Engine:  You will be masterfully working on the data platform which involves the processing of both unbounded and bounded data sources, perform in-memory computation & transformation.  Production deployment : You will be responsible for the integration and deployment of the Data Ingestion & machine learning pipelines into production where your ideas can come to life.  · Work with stakeholders including the Data Science teams, Business Systems Analysts, and Architecture teams to assist with data platform technical and organizational issues and support the company’s data and analytics needs.  · Educate, train, and mentor members of the Data Engineering and Analytics teams in the design, implementation, and usage of modern data systems.   Qualifications for Data Platform Engineer   IT / CS fundamentals : You have earned at least a Bachelor’s / Master’s in Information Technology / Computer Science, or related degree AND you have a strong ethos of continuous learning.  Commercial software engineering : You have 11+ years of professional software development experience in multiple programming languages, including modern virtual-machine languages such as  Java , as well as common scripting and glue languages such as Python and version control (git), with good analytical & debugging skills. Experience performing  root-cause analysis on bugs and performance problems  in distributed systems, including network and source-level debugging.  Big data : You have extensive experience with data analytics and working knowledge of big data infrastructure such as Google Cloud, Big Query, Data Flow, Hadoop Eco System, HDFS, Apache Storm, Apache Spark. You've routinely built data pipelines with gigabytes/terabytes of data and understand the challenges of manipulating such large datasets.  Cloud Exposure:  Strong experience implementing systems and applications using distributed and cloud infrastructure . GCP is preferred , but AWS or Azure are also okay.  Data Modeling : Flair for data, schema, data model, PL/SQL, Star & snowflake schema, how to bring efficiency in data modelling for efficient querying data for analysis, understands criticality TDD and develops data validation techniques. Working knowledge of distributed relational and tabular data stores, message queues, stream processing facilities, and other scalable big-data platform technologies.  Real-Time Systems : Understands evolution of databases for in-memory, NoSQL & indexing technologies along with experience in real-time & stream processing systems like Google pub/sub, GCP technologies, Kafka, Storm, Spark Streaming.  Strong design skills : with a proven track record of success on large/highly complex projects preferably in Enterprise Apps and Integration. Advanced, hands-on knowledge of design, implementation, and optimization of big data architectures, pipelines, and data sets.  Project management : Professional experience in a modern software development life cycle, including requirements gathering, system design, unit and integration testing, continuous integration, and deployment. You demonstrate excellent project and time management skills, exposure to scrum or other agile practices in JIRA.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills : Must be able to effectively communicate & work with fellow team members and other functional team members to coordinate & meet deliverables. Job Description  Responsibilities:  Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin, Toutiao, Helo and Resso, ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.   Our team protects users on our platform by promoting privacy by design; we design architectures that treats user data respectfully, with transparency, and in line with reasonable practices. Data privacy engineering is a new technological territory that hasn't been well defined in our industry; by joining the team, you will have chance to refine the data privacy framework, use advanced privacy technology, and make a big impact across all our platforms and our community.    As a Software Engineer on our team, you will:   - Design, build, and maintain systems that enhance privacy across ByteDance's platforms such as TikTok.   - Work with engineering and product teams to ensure what we build is compliant with privacy laws and regulations from a technical perspective.   - Respond to privacy incidents, if they occur, including collecting information on scope and root cause as well as managing remediation.   Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications:  - BS/MS Degree in Computer Science or related major, with 2 years of working experience.   - Experienced in building backend services for large-scale consumer-facing applications.   - Proficiency in at least one of following languages: Java, Go, C++, Python, Java.   - Deep understanding of computer architectures, data structures and algorithms.   - Good team communication and collaboration skills. Preferred Qualifications:   - 2+ years of industry experience developing and implementing privacy features and solutions.   - Comfortable with communicating across disciplines (e.g. engineering, legal, policy). company: DELAWARE CONSULTING ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
job_description: Job Description  What will you be doing as an Industry Lead FOOD Manufacturing?  An Industry Lead is a Solutioneer who engages customers regarding their business transformation, leads assessments and piloting projects for a specific industry. By leveraging talent and coordinating the efforts of team members, a plan is visualized on how & where benefits can be gained in the customer processes & what expected outcomes can be.  The Lead is responsible for shaping and defining the vision & conveying this to customers, exciting them with the envisioned outcomes while managing expectations and emphasizing digitization is a journey, not a single goal post.  Do you have what it takes?   The skills, knowledge and abilities of a proven, consistently successful Solutioneer  (see end).  Highly developed analytical and conceptual skills in developing efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems.  Having true operational business experience is essential, as is experience with automation of business processes through a variety of means.  Be flexible and focused on the client’s best interest while assuring to recommend a scalable & sustainable change that companies can continue to build on .  Highly effective verbal and written communication skills and means to explain business concepts and technical information to clients, vendors, senior management and staff are must-haves to succeed.   RESPONSIBILITIES   Understand your client’s missions, business needs and challenges as well as the business processes that support them  The Lead is mainly responsible for creating the vision together with the customer, understanding their requirements, needs and expectations and based on that recommend an approach or roadmap  Moderate the solution creation process, coordinate agile development of the solution and liaise between solution team and Solution Facilitator  Define and evolve system concepts and technically feasible software solutions that answer the client’s analysis challenges.  Research, understand, and document client challenges in order to develop the best solution concept  Partner with the Solution Facilitator to conduct client Assessments. You also will work with Solutioneers to select the right software tools, technologies and approaches to address analysis requirements.  Manage the solution team to design, develop and implement solutions  Additionally, you will be responsible for creating budgets, time boxes, resource allocation, and approach and to document, track and plan the solution’s development.   At delaware, we...  care more about how you engage a situation & how you deal with people (Customers, team members, partners) than if you have every single hard competence but lack the soft skills. Aptitude, openness to learn, team spirit, care, commitment, entrepreneurship and respect are considered of critical value. None of our positions require strict qualifications, but below we've outlined what we expect you to be able to do with your acquired skills, knowledge and abilities.   As a Solution Lead Journeyman, you are able to   Engage customers in a meaningful way, bridging business process & technology & making technology insightful to customers  Have deep business process discussions, making intelligent and applicable referral to industry best practices and standards and linking these to technology solutions  Conduct independent client engagements as requested   As a Senior Solution Lead, you are able to   Define, architect, evolve and independently execute or assign tasks  Execute sophisticated and complex self-determined tasks  Engage with clients on own or with others  Mentor, train and/or supervise others   As a Solutioneer…  You work closely with clients and other stakeholders to perform assessments, harness, develop and/or integrate solution components into operational pilots and solutions satisfying these users’ critical decision analytic needs.  You have highly developed analytical and conceptual skills in developing efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems. You have built a strong foundation in software development languages and processes. Your effective verbal and written communication skills and means to explain technical information to clients, vendors, senior management and staff are essential. You are proficient in technical building blocks from which solutions will be crafted and integrated into client operations. You have a proven ability to work with rapidly changing requirements and short deadlines.   Responsibilities:   Envision, define and shape innovative concepts and system solutions as part of a team or individually  Harness, develop and/or integrate solution components into operational pilots and solutions that meet your client’s critical decision analytic needs using various functional and technical building blocks from the SAP space.  Understand the client’s missions, business needs and requirements and the business processes that support them  Exercise quality assurance, configuration management, reliability and maintainability of control design and production and perform testing of complete solutions and produce technical documentation  Contribute to the development of the Solution Concept by working with the Solution Lead and other Solutioneers to design, develop and implement solutions.  Work in teams to document, track and manage assigned portion of solution  Identify, assess, evaluate and recommend tools, technologies, capabilities and methodologies to support or enhance the solution and/or future client needs  Identify data access and integration requirements and create capabilities to appropriately access, integrate and prepare available data for analysis     Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Our Company  For more than a century, our Company has been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, it continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.   Our Singapore IT Hub  Established in 2015, our Singapore IT Hub aims to harness digital solutions for better business outcomes. One of its key focuses is in using analytics and data science to guide better ecision-making.  Home to more than 300 employees with over 20 nationalities, the Singapore IT Hub is part of a global network, with sister hubs located in the United States and Czech Republic. In Singapore, the hub houses a wide span of IT capabilities teams ranging from Data Science, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity & Risk Management to Enterprise Platforms and many more. Across Japan, China and the Asia Pacific region, the hub works closely with colleagues from all divisions of the company to drive our core business.   This position is part of the  Company Led Training (CLT) programme  which is a structured development programme jointly developed by the our Singapore IT Hub and the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) that aims to enable fresh and mid-level professionals to acquire specialist expertise for jobs in demand by the industry, especially those that support Smart Nation projects. More details  here.   As a Cloud Specialist, you will be tasked to continue the growth, evolution, and scalability of our existing cloud technology. You will demonstrate technical depth, strong interpersonal skills and a passion to solve complex business problems.   As part of our Cloud Services team you will work in a dynamic environment across several departments or teams applying your expertise and knowledge to solve problems faced by our cloud users. You will need to work in an Agile way and exhibit a mindset of a Product Owner to collaborate effectively with application developers, data science analysts, architects, infrastructure engineers, and cloud providers in troubleshooting and development of cloud solutions needed to meet company’s business requirements.  Your activities and responsibilities are the following   Provide 1st line technical support to our cloud users  Manage access to cloud computing services to ensure compliance to security and company policies  Develop and implement automation solutions to reduce or eliminate recurring operational tasks  Assist cloud architect/engineers in design and implementation of secure cloud architectures  Conduct POC on the latest cloud technology that contribute to future state capabilities  Participate in Daily Scrum as a Developer or as facilitator of the meeting  Participate in building a Product Catalog that is align to the business requirements  Manage updates and revisions of operational manuals  Host learning programs to educate users on cloud technology best practices   Requirements   BS in Information Technology, Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience.  Between 0 - 3 years of working experience in relevant area  Excellent analytical and communication skills are essential for this role, as well as passion for problem solving, a desire to learn, and the ability to work in a team environment   Who we are  Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.  We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.   What we look for  In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.   We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.   *NOTE:  “Only shortlisted candidates will be notified”. This role is supported under IMDA’s TeSA Company-Led Training Programme (CLT). By applying to the job posting, it is deemed that the applicant agrees to share their data with IMDA for the purpose of programme administration and verification purpose. Job applicants must be Singaporeans.   Please submit your application together with your resume directly via link -  https://msd.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/SearchJobs/job/SGP---Singapore---MYP-Centre-WeWork/Cloud-Specialist-IMDA-CLT_R141304   #TeSA #CLT    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  A career at Arup offers you the chance to make a positive difference in the world. Independently owned and independently minded, we attract a diverse mix of people to work on ground-breaking global projects. We have an ambitious commitment to be the digital leader in the built environment and have digital teams and experts all over the world, who collaborate on world-leading software, data and technology projects and products. Being a global team means we value people with diverse experiences, backgrounds, specialisms and skills.   The Role  We’re looking for an IT support analyst to be the front-door to technology services to the rest of the organisation. You will help to increase business productivity by taking a customer-focused, proactive and collaborative approach to anticipating and resolving technology issues. You will provide support and technical expertise to a range of issues relating to hardware, software, peripherals and projects.  Working under the guidance of the local service lead, you will be part of a larger team that provides customer-focused digital services to Arup globally. This is a full time, level 2 support role in a typical IT support infrastructure, with a business-focused mindset.  We provide opportunities for all our people to develop their skills, along with challenging and innovative work in an environment that allows individuals to flourish. We believe in continuous learning; providing a culture that is naturally curious and always stimulating. One that promotes self-discovery and allows people time to be creative.   “I enjoy the variety of my role - no two days are the same. One day I might be reassuring a nervous presenter minutes before they present to hundreds of colleagues via a live stream. The next day I might be trying to fix a laptop remotely with a colleague who has a looming deadline or showing them how to get the most out of the latest digital tools.” Caitlin, Brisbane   You should apply if:   You are passionate about helping people get the most out of technology  You are excited by the opportunity to learn new things  You value career progression and are open to new opportunities   Responsibilities of the role include   Acting as client liaison for all Digital Technology-related requests from staff, being first line of engagement to understand and address issues and needs around desktop (Windows, O365 etc.) and infrastructure (compute, storage, network, cloud services, enterprise systems, cybersecurity, etc.), engaging and escalating to other Digital Technology teams as needed  Providing value added services to the business, working together with the leadership team to drive technology and help transform business activities  Configuring, deploying, maintaining, troubleshooting and supporting workstations, laptops, printers, mobile devices, phones and other computer and telecoms equipment  Solving complex problems associated with hardware (PCs, Macs, mobile, etc.), software, and services (video conferencing, remote access, etc.) determining the source of problems and classifying their level, priority and nature. When appropriate, escalating or routing them to the appropriate team  Helping with a range of office-based technology needs – installations, moves, changes, etc. that involve staff requirements and infrastructure needs, working collaboratively with other DT service teams  Responding to, documenting and resolving service tickets in a timely manner according to an agreed service level  Documenting procedures, standards, best practices configurations, settings, installation sequences and back-out instructions  Following ITIL/Service Management policies and procedures  Helping the software asset management team to maintain applications (license management and version control)  Helping with communications and training around technical change  Playing an active part in our team: helping to build an inclusive environment, sharing your knowledge and promoting best technology practices with colleagues   Some of the technology you could expect to support includes:   Personal computing (HP, Mac, etc.)  Mobile computing (iPhone, iPad, Samsung etc. depending on office or regional policy)  Microsoft Windows Operating System, Mac OSx (limited)  Microsoft 365 and associated services (i.e. OneDrive for Business, MS Teams, etc.)  Cloud based solutions (Azure, AWS, etc.)  Video conferencing hardware/software based on global standards  Office printers and copiers (these vary depending on office or regional policy)   Requirements and skills  Essential skills and knowledge:   Some experience working in a regional or global organisation providing desktop support services in a Microsoft environment  Strong technical aptitude and a desire to learn, you should have a proven track record of developing your technical knowledge and applying new skills in a high paced environment  Good analytical skills, with ability to solve complex problems and openness in sharing your knowledge and thinking with others  Experience of ServiceNow or similar IT Service Management systems  Some experience working in a professional services organisation   Desirable:   Familiarity with MS Teams and O365  Familiarity with technical software solutions from Autodesk, Bentley, Trimble, etc  Familiarity with software solutions from Adobe, Bluebeam, Cisco, Symantec, etc   Required behaviours:   Collaborative, consultative and effective in a consensus-based decision-making culture  High energy, motivated, open-minded and willing to embrace innovation and new technology  Excellent written and verbal communication skills; communicating to all levels within an organization  Self-starter who takes initiative to work and develop holistic solutions  Continually exercises critical thought and judgment to determine the most appropriate action  Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to develop and maintain relationships with representatives from various organisational offices and levels  Strong attention to detail   Please don’t be discouraged if you don’t meet every point above – if you meet most, and are strongly motivated by the role, and willing to learn, we are still interested in hearing from you.   Education   Technical certification in Information Technology is desirable   About Arup  The people at Arup are driven to find a better way and to deliver better solutions for our clients.  We welcome applications from a diverse group of people, including those who are seeking flexible working, have accessibility needs, want to bring their whole selves to work, and can enrich our workforce with cultural diversity.  We offer a competitive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience to the right candidate including a global profit share scheme, excellent staff benefits and long-term career development opportunities.  We’ve always been a purpose-led organisation. we are here to support each other, to do our best work possible and make our own special contribution. We’re here to shape a better world, and for us ‘better’ is all about creating a more sustainable future for the world.   If you are interested in helping us shape a better world, please click  “Apply Now”  to submit your online application.   Stay safe online - Arup will never ask for payment or your bank details as part of our recruitment process.    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_description: Job Description  With the global business expansion, SMBC is looking to further strengthening our IT initiatives such as digitalization, system standardization, security enhancement and cost-efficient day-to-day system operations with strict IT governance. We are seeking to recruit a Senior Vice President, Group Head of IT Steering Group (ISG) in Planning Department of Asia Pacific Division (PDAPD) where the incumbent will work closely with the technology team in planning and steering IT projects in the APAC region. The successful candidate will report to the Joint General Manager of PDAPD and has IT Representatives in the APAC region reporting into the position.   Job Responsibilities   Lead the ISG team and stakeholders managment, support the communication and implement long and short-term IT strategies in APAC region based on the bank global wide IT strategy.  Act as liaison between Tokyo HQ, APAC offices and local entity to implement IT strategies.  Drive and control IT investment, expense budget and tax management in Singapore and APAC countries.  Review the performance of IT systems to determine operating costs, productivity levels and upgrade requirements.  Support the Project Management Office and ensure progress control are set and in place.  Support the deployment of technology, infrastructure, software applications across APAC region based on the bank global wide IT strategy.  Oversee and ensure compliance to IT governance standards.  Identify trends and emerging issues that impact strategies and, where necessary, make recommendations on alternative courses of action.   Job Requirements   Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information System or a related field with min. 10 years of work experience in the banking/FI sector.  Min. 8 years’ work experience in a strategic planning position in a large organization.  Strong leadership, planning and organizational skills.  Strong analytical skill with ability to collate and present complex data and information.  Strong stakeholder management skill.  High level of flexibility with a positive attitude to innovate and change.  Meticulous and attention to details.  Excellent communication interpersonal and presentation skills.  A good team player who can work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.  Proficiency in both English and Japanese is highly preferred as this role needs to prepare reports in Japanese for reporting to Head Office in Japan. This role also needs to present and communicate with senior stakeholders who mainly communicate in Japanese.      Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  The Company  Singapore E-Business Ptd Ltd (SGeBiz) is a Singapore-headquartered FinTech company with an overseas presence in markets like Malaysia, India and Philippines. We are driven by our belief in wanting to help businesses accelerate their growth in the digital economy through innovative solutions in integrated payments, financing and value-added services.  SGeBiz was incorporated in 2014 with a focus on providing a one-stop procure-to- pay business solution for the F&B industry through our proprietary  EzyProcure . This one stop Procure-to-Pay B2B cloud-based platform has helped to strengthen the relationships between buyers and suppliers, and improve their productivity. This is enabled by automation in the procurement, payments and reconciliation journey of buyers and suppliers. EzyProcure also uses data analytics to inform businesses of key patterns in their procure-to-pay journey, enabling more timely and informed decisions.  Building on the successes of  EzyProcure  in the F&B industry ,  SGeBiz has ventured into the hospitality, retail and education industries, adapting our solution to help improve productivity of these businesses in the procure-to-pay journey. We have also expanded our suite of business solutions to include e-payments and other value added services like e-inventory and e-sourcing under the product names of  EzyPayment ,  EzyInventory  and  EzySource  respectively.  EzyPayment is  our specialised B2B payment solution which helps solve the biggest pain points of businesses by optimising cash flows for buyers and facilitating cash collection for suppliers.  EzyPayment  provides buyers up to 60 days’ of interest free credit for payments to suppliers, while suppliers can receive payments within 2 to 5 days. SGeBiz seeks to continually innovate and improve our solutions. In the coming months, we will roll out new and exciting business solutions to make the user journey more seamless and efficient for integrated payments, financing and value-added services like procurement and inventory management.  THE ROLE  This  I T Business Analyst   position will report to the Head of the Information Technology (IT) business unit.   Roles & Responsibilities:  · Drive detailed analyses of business requirements and propose solutions.  · Liaise with the relevant stakeholders to ensure adherence to project plan and deliverables meet the prescribed specifications and are of high quality.  · Evaluate potential solutions and make recommendations to resolve business problems.  · Manage each phase of the development life cycle and ensure that all objectives in each phase are met.  · Prepare detailed documentation for SOW, BRD, Process Flows & Technical Documents.  · Assist testing team in preparing the Test Cases based on the requirement and deliverables.  · Lead teams in the planning & conduct of User Acceptance Testing (UAT).  · Coordinate training for internal stakeholders and address any concerns.  · Maintain constant awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance and emerging technologies.   Requirements:  Suitable candidate who possesses strong analytical and communication skills, and the ability to work in teams as both a team leader and team player. In addition, you will also have:  · Bachelor’s Degree or higher in computer science or relevant field.  · 3 + years of experience as an IT Business Analyst or similar role.  · Knowledge in System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) & Methodologies.  · Ability to elicit business requirements from internal and external stakeholders  · Familiar with agile methodologies.  · Experience in FinTech domain is highly advantageous. job_title: Senior Information Security Consultant (Governance, Risk & Compliance)
job_description: Job Description  Job Summary and Mission  This position contributes to the success of wizlynx group by performing the following:   Responsible for development and operational activities across the entire scope of our clients Security Governance, Risk and Compliance programs.The job encompasses leading and participating in the assessment of security, risks, and control effectiveness for applications, infrastructure, and technology projects. The Specialist will identify, classify, and document control issues in our clients computing environment by documenting assessment results, recommending corrective action, tracking remediation, evaluating policy and control standard exceptions, and regularly reporting to our clients IT management.  Serve as the primary contact point for issue escalation  Manage service support requirements and ensure that quality plan, KPIs/SLAs are met  Draft support SOP and documentation  Models and acts in accordance with wizlynx group guiding principles   With this position, you will also have the opportunity to get introduced to different areas of information and cyber security such as Offensive Security & Penetration Testing  Summary of Key Responsibilities.   Leads IT control assessments for our clients to ensure effective IT controls are in place to meeting operational and compliance requirements.  Works with our clients IT, Internal Audit, Compliance and other key stakeholders to create an IT GRC strategy that complies with professional standards and addresses the IT risks inherent in our client’s operations and industry.  Develops Vendor Risk Management policies and supports client’s risk profile assessment for vendor on-boarding process and conducts annual review of critical vendors.  Performs ongoing logical access reviews and recommends updates to access control privileges to ensure proper Segregation of Duties based on user access reviews.  Effectively reports and communicates testing results to client’s IT management for corrective action, where required.  Conducts information security awareness training.  Performs evidence collection and project management assistance of our clients annual compliance (e.g. CREST, PCI DSS) certification program.  Track and monitor risk exceptions to ensure control deviations are identified and mitigating controls are in place.  Assist our clients with drafting and maintaining information security policies  Provides mentoring for other team members.  Demonstrates excellent project management skills, inspires teamwork and responsibility with engagement team members, and uses current technology/tools to enhance the effectiveness of deliverables and services.  Facilitates the performance and testing of our client’s annual disaster recovery tests and business continuity plans.   Summary of Ideal Experience, Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities  Ideal Experience   A minimum of five years of experience in information security audit or in a technology-related audit or compliance field, and strong knowledge base in operations, enterprise networking, system evaluation/architecture and consulting experience preferred  Strong understanding of and ability to provide security configuration and testing of networking and operating systems including TCP/IP, WAN/LAN routing, VLAN architecture, and a wide array of large-scale environments including various major web application servers  Strong understanding of information security principles such as ISO 27001, PCI-DSS, and PDPA.   Language Skills   Fluent technical English (speech and writing)  Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing, in local language   Soft Skills   Excellent team leadership, team oriented and team player who takes ownership  Flexible attitude, reliable, action oriented  Customer friendly approach and appearance  Willingness to travel  Innovative to push new ideas, dynamic and forward looking with clear management principle towards the team  Able to work independently, critical thinking and be able to communicate effectively with the support team and customers  Enjoys working in global team with different cultures   Technical Skills and Abilities   Microsoft OS and Office knowledge  Technical document writing  Experience in Project Management in IT  Knowledge in perimeter firewall infrastructure and VPN remote access   Summary of Education  Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university in an appropriate field  Certifications / Training   CISM, CISA, CRISC, CISSP certified  ITSM or ITIL certified  Functional certification such as MCSE, CCNA, CNE preferred   KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS / MEASURES OF SUCCESS   Achieve agreed targets/SLA/KPI in terms of quality, time and cost  Lead team members to achieve team/organizational goals  Improve and retain high customer satisfaction   POTENTIAL CAREER DEVELOPMENT  Advance to higher business development tiers or geographic reach    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_title: Cyber Fusion Center Analyst IMDA CLT - Part-Time
job_description: Job Description  Our Company  For more than a century, our Company has been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, it continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.   Our Singapore IT Hub  Established in 2015, our Singapore IT Hub aims to harness digital solutions for better business outcomes. One of its key focuses is in using analytics and data science to guide better decision-making.   Home to more than 300 employees with over 20 nationalities, the Singapore IT Hub is part of a global network, with sister hubs located in the United States and Czech Republic. In Singapore, the hub houses a wide span of IT capabilities teams ranging from Data Science, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity & Risk Management to Enterprise Platforms and many more. Across Japan, China and the Asia Pacific region, the hub works closely with colleagues from all divisions of the company to drive our core business.   This position is part of the  Company Led Training (CLT) programme  which is a structured development programme jointly developed by the our Singapore IT Hub and the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) that aims to enable fresh and mid-level professionals to acquire specialist expertise for jobs in demand by the industry, especially those that support Smart Nation projects. More details  here.   Responsibilities  · Analyze, contain, and assist in remediation of escalated security incidents from Managed Security Services Partner (MSSP).  · Ability to use log management tools, packet captures reports, data visualization, and pattern analysis to enhance on cyber security incident investigation.  · Perform root cause analysis on high severity security incidents.  · Create, modify and review various reports and dashboards from our security solutions such as internet proxies, network behavioral analysis tools, intrusion detection and endpoint security tools such as antivirus and firewalls.  · Respond to cyber security incidents that occur on regulated environments such as SOX, PCI, GxP and shop floor systems.  · Participate and present when required in weekly threat management meetings to report on security incidents that have occurred.  · Make recommendations to strengthen the cyber security posture of our computing environment as well as recommend process improvements and tooling to ensure timely response to future security incidents.  · Maintain ongoing collaboration with other MSD organizations and departments acting in a consultative capacity promoting information security awareness, compliance and supporting IT Risk Management & Security policies.   Requirements  · BS in Information Security, Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience.  · Between 0 - 3 years of working experience in information security.  · Excellent analytical and communication skills are essential for this role, as well as passion for problem solving, a desire to learn, and the ability to work in a team environment  · Various general technical skills including knowledge of networking (i.e. TCP/IP) and security product experience.  · Strong written and verbal communication skills.  · Experience or familiarity with web content filtering solutions, anti-malware solutions, intrusion detection and response systems.  · The candidate must be able to adapt and rapidly learn new technologies and have some background in an information security related discipline.   Who we are  Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.  We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.   What we look for  In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.   *NOTE:  “Only shortlisted candidates will be notified”. job_title: Research Assistant (Department of Architecture)_Geospatial Engineer/Data Scientist
job_description: Job Description  Duties and responsibilities  The Urban Analytics Lab at the National University of Singapore (NUS) is seeking a research assistant to join the research group and assist with research in the geospatial & data science domain – 3D city models / BIM, data integration (focusing on crowdsourced and dynamic geospatial data) and use cases, under the umbrella of digital twins.  The successful applicant will be engaged on novel research lines in the context of digital twins, namely: integration of nascent data sources, initiating new means of benchmarking and quality assessment of data and workflows, and developing new use cases pertaining to building/urban/geospatial data infrastructure in the frame of smart cities.  Candidates should have a computational affinity and a degree in computer science, geographical information science, geomatics, mechanical engineering, or another relevant field of study, with a demonstrated track record (in terms of working experience and/or publications/impact and/or other forms of output such as development of tools).  Qualifications & Skills Requirement  Required qualifications You should demonstrate that you possess:  • A degree in a related discipline from a reputable university. Current students are eligible to apply as well, provided that they are in the final stage of their studies and that their degree will be completed before the start of the appointment. • An ability to conduct research semi-independently. • A publication record is not required, but candidates with demonstrated impact, writing skills, and a strong affinity to publish are welcome to emphasise these in their application. • Proficiency in one or more of the following areas: GIS, computer science, game engines, Geomatics, 3D city modelling, computer vision / AI / ML, urban planning, and/or urban simulations. • Good communication skills in English, and an ability to present research in both academic and non-academic venues. • Experience with programming. We will prioritise applicants who can demonstrate these qualities through a Github profile or similar evidence. • Curiosity and passion to explore new concepts, methods and technologies, and capability of identifying and quickly learning the most suitable tools for the research on the go. • A positive and proactive stance on open science, preferably with demonstrated activities such as using and developing open-source software, releasing data as open data, and promoting reproducible research.  Our offer • You will be working on compelling research activities at the forefront of geographical information science and urban data science in a new research group that is gaining a strong momentum in Singapore and overseas. • You will advance your research and transferable skills required for the next stage of your career. You will be welcome to explore and learn new tools and technologies, and expand your current skillset. • You will work in a research and educational environment where you may not only contribute to your own development, but also to others, e.g. by supervising master theses that may arise as part of the research. • Opportunity to make impactful contributions in the field, on a globally relevant and growing topic. • Visibility and exposure of your work. • Potential contact with industrial and governmental partners, both locally and internationally. • A diverse, inclusive, friendly, and flexible working environment. • Exploring new ideas and an opportunity to experiment with the state of the art. • The remuneration will be determined according to the university’s salary range depending on the degree and experience.  Please note that this is not a PhD position. This is a full-time research job.  Application  Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at our  NUS Career Portal . We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  The full text of this ad and the list of required materials is available on the Lab’s website ( https://ual.sg ). job_title: Global Business Applications Sales Executive, Energy OR Telecommunications
job_description: Job Description  At a time of profound change in every industry, we are entering the predictive era ushering out of a decades-long reactive past, with Customers accelerating their digital journeys to become more agile, resilient and positioned for continued growth in 2021 and beyond. Customers across all Industries are asking Microsoft to help them reinvent their business, innovate, and digitally transform to today’s new realities.  Microsoft is looking to expand our sales team by adding an experienced Business Applications Sales Executive focused on the Energy OR Telecommunications industry. The successful candidate will be a senior sales executive with 7-10 years of value and outcome-based sales experience who possesses excellent organizational, communication and selling skills. Responsibilities will include managing, leading and closing strategic Microsoft opportunities in Asia. The Business Applications Sales Executive will also engage with complementary Microsoft Account teams across solution areas to identify, drive and unlock value within our largest customers.  Responsibilities  As a Business Applications Industry Senior Sales Executive – you will be a strongly industry-aligned and outcome-driven business process transformation enabler within the Microsoft Business Applications Global Sales organization, working with our most important Customers across the Energy OR Telecommunication industries in Asia, with the objective to help your Customers with their end-to-end business transformation needs by envisioning solutions and mapping capabilities with associated business value to business decision maker persona pains/needs. You will execute with excellence the entire sales process by owning and orchestrating an articulated and multi-stakeholder pursuit team of industry and technically intense experts to provide Customers with solutions aligned to their end-to-end business transformation needs using Microsoft Business Applications’ portfolio of offerings. You will use the Microsoft Catalyst sales methodology to enable customers’ digital transformation journey focusing on the business value and outcomes from Microsoft Business Applications solutions. The ideal candidate would be a deep business process / industry expert with real hands-on experience and a transformational mindset, able to pull the strings of global and complex deals.  He/she must also engage with partners in the strategy, solution, proof and closing stages of a given sales cycle. Candidates with the ability to succeed in this role will display the following attributes: Industry experience, excellent sales, communication, negotiation, problem solving and organizational skills; understanding of Microsoft’s strategic direction; ability to develop successful compete strategies, deliver effective presentations; ability to engage with a wide range of audiences from end user to senior management, and a thorough understanding of a solution selling sales cycle.  Qualifications  Qualifications:   Experience selling CRM/ERP/Low code solution into Energy sector: Oil & Gas, Utilities, or into the Telecommunications sector.  7+ years of experienceBusiness application sales (Experience in selling end to end solution from lead to cash a plus) Selling software-as-a-service or cloud-based business applications to enterprise customers Identifying unique and complex business challenges and solutions Driving and leading sales processes across account planning, opportunity planning, deal negotiation, customer decision frameworks, evaluation plans and engaging in sophisticated business case discussions. Carrying and exceeding sales quotas by driving and closing enterprise opportunities. Demonstrated passion and commitment for customer success. Sales Experience with Oracle, SAP, SalesForce or other enterprise Platforms    Additional Experience:   Bachelor’s degree required - MBA preferred  Very strong customer relationship and presentation skills including experience in C-level presentations, facilitating envisioning workshops and engaging in business value discussions.  Ability to influence and coach other selling professionals and account teams; working through others to drive success.  Strong analytical skills to support business decisions and priorities.  Self-starter with strong time management skills – able to maintain a high level of productivity, manage multiple competing priorities, and work effectively under the pressure of time constraints in a fast-paced, complex, collaborative, and team-oriented environment.  Experience with Dynamics 365 solutions is a plus.  Experience working within the Partner Ecosystem for Dynamics is a plus  Design Thinking and Solution Envisioning is a plus   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Assisting in assuming initial ownership for the coordination, investigation and documentation of customer and system incidents.   Assisting in the initial level of diagnosis of problems and incidents and helping in resolving them when appropriate.   Assisting in interpreting problems or errors at a basic level and helping in the assessment of risks of events and escalating appropriately to protect client services.   Helping ensure proper documentation for all problems, incidents and requests.   Helping follow up on incidents to ensure customer satisfaction.   Helping monitor issues until they are closed.  Demonstrating a good understanding of the customer’s business needs and applying them to the management of system events & incidents.   Working with other teams (e.g. technical team, service desk) to ensure the coordinated management of incidents   Sharing information required for the team to be successful.   Seeking opportunities to improve knowledge, skills, and performance and is receptive to constructive feedback.  Improve operational processes to enable operations staff to operate effectively.   Job Requirements:   Must possess Diploma, and preferably a Cisco Certified Advanced Network (CCNA) or its equivalent. CCNP or VoIP certification.   Desire to work in an information systems environment • Good oral and written communication skills   Knowledge of windows applications software skills like MS Words, Excel, Power point, etc.  Must be customer focus  Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment to improve customer service. company: AVALOQ SOURCING ASIA PACIFIC (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
job_description: Job Description  Writing the future. Together.   Avaloq is a value driven, fast-paced financial technology and services company and we are committed to developing the banking solutions of tomorrow.   By joining Avaloq, you’ll become a key part of our effort to power the digital transformation of the financial services industry. Our ambition is big and bold – to provide full end-to-end digital solutions by combining our leading efficiency with a flexible, responsible digital user experience. Headquartered in Zurich, Avaloq has over 2,000 employees globally. More information is available at  www.avaloq.com .  Interested Applicants, please visit https://www.avaloq.com/en/job-openings to apply directly.  Your Team   You will be joining our Technical Consulting practice in the Engineering department. The team is focused on consulting deployed Avaloq prospects and customers review, implement and troubleshoot the technical components of Avaloq products and the dependent 3rd party technologies.   Join us in our journey and we make sure to offer you the chance to thrive in a complex, yet exciting working environment, with high exposure to innovative tools and technologies.   We are looking for people who are driven and ambitious, who can lead from the front and deliver on objectives. You will be working in a fast-paced environment and will have the opportunity to influence and contribute to the ongoing success of Avaloq.   Your Mission   Deploy and troubleshoot Avaloq software components including Avaloq core, Avaloq standalone products, and Avaloq adaptors with underlying software partner technologies of Oracle, Red Hat, Amazon Web Services and others  Implement Unix/Windows scripting to optimize installation & operation  Investigate / assist / resolve technical infrastructure setup issues e.g. network problems for inter-component communication, Operating Systems (Solaris, Linux, Windows & etc.) issues, Storage System errors.  Work under project timeline pressure & onsite with customers, focus on delivery results  Provide pre-sales, sales & project support for technical architecture definition, infrastructure requirements and setup, technical landscape shaping, effort estimations and infrastructure sizing recommendations, based on Avaloq product recommendations   What you need   Relevant working experience in at least 2 of the following areas:    Infrastructure: Red Hat Openshift (preferably 4.x), Prometheus, Grafana, EFK, Red Hat AMQ Streams and AMQ Broker  Backend: Oracle Database (v18c, v19c)/PostgreSQL, Kafka, Istio, Spring Boor microservices  Operating Systems: UNIX and Windows (8.1, 10)  DevOps  Storage technologies    Consultancy/project delivery experience, with client facing background  Customer obsession  Excellent relationship building, engagement and stakeholder management skills required for interfacing with the Avaloq customers and prospects, as well as 3rd parties and internal stakeholders  Flexibility to travel internationally and/or nationally and work from the customer premises  Team player, with proven ability to deliver as well independently   You will get extra points for the following   Understanding of Cloud Computing and Infrastructure integration  Prior experience in the banking industry  Avaloq know-how   Now let's talk about perks and compensation   We offer high flexibility regarding working models (e.g. part time and home office models are possible depending on business requirements). Our base salaries are competitive and if you prove to be a superstar, you might even be entitled to an extraordinary achievement reward. Avaloq aims to share its success with all its employees by paying out “Success Share Units” depending on its performance each year.   At Avaloq we embrace diversity, we embrace difference. We are whole-heartedly committed to equal employment opportunities and we foster an inclusive culture where everyone’s' contributions are valued, and their voices are listened to. We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other fascinating characteristics that make us different. Please note that our job descriptions are intended to be written in an inclusive and gender-neutral language.   Don’t be shy – apply! Please only apply online, preferably with pdf documents.   Note to Agencies:  All unsolicited résumés will be considered direct applicants and no referral fee will be acknowledged.    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_title: Junior / Senior Business Analyst - Financial Services
job_description: Job Description  Job Description   You are responsible to gather, analyze and formalize user’s business requirements and processes, evaluate the feasibility of implementation and manage the scope of projects. You will also help to manage and implement quality IT projects that are within the scope and ensure timely deliverables that conform to processes and standards.    Your main responsibilities are as follows:   • Communicate with system owners, business users and project stakeholders to understand user requirements and business objectives.  • Be the bridge between business users and IT team during all phases of SDLC.  • Document user requirement specifications including Data Workflows, Mockup UI, Use Cases, Database Schema Design, etc.  • Document Test Plans and User Guides that meet business requirements.  • Conduct System Demos and provide Training and Testing Supports.  • Coordinate & assist in System Integration Testing (SIT), User Acceptance Test (UAT) & IT Implementation Activities.  • Identify and implement process improvements.  • Identify and propose suitable IT solutions to business requirements.  • Provide level 1 technical support to clients.  • Track project progression and provide updates to the project manager.   Requirements:   • Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.  • A recognized professional qualification in Project Management, Business Analysis or Information Systems will be advantageous.  • Strong analytical, problem-solving and report writing skills.  • Excellent communication skills, fluent in English both oral and written.  • A good team player with good interpersonal and communication skills.  • Knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL Programming such as MSSQL/MySQL.  • An aggressive learner with open mind and can-do attitude. Able to adapt to fast-pace environment.  • Possess working knowledge of SDLC project methodology (Agile & Waterfall) with at least one full cycle implementation preferred.  • Able to work independently and multi-task effectively, managing several projects concurrently  • Knowledge of Equity Trading will be advantageous.
