job_title: BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST - CONSUMER & MARKETPLACE AND MARKETING TECHNOLOGY
company: NIKE GLOBAL TRADING B.V. SINGAPORE BRANCH
job_description: Job Description  NIKE is a technology company. From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to developing products, managing big data and providing leading edge engineering and systems support, our teams at NIKE Global Technology exist to revolutionize the future at the confluence of tech and sport. We invest and develop advances in technology and employ the most creative people in the world, and then give them the support to constantly innovate, iterate and serve consumers more directly and personally. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.   WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:  Asia-Pacific Latin-America (APLA) is a multi-cultural, growth Geography (Geo) that is seeking a leader with the functional and technical expertise that can execute the delivery and support of Retail Commerce and Athlete tools into Nike Southeast Asia, India and Pacific territories.  As a member in the Consumer & Marketplace and Marketing Technology function, you will provide technical expertise, driving retail and athlete solutions to Nike retail doors. You will gather and translate business insights and requirements into technical requirements for both local and global technology solutions working closely with the Geo Technical Product and Engineering organizations. Core to this role is the understanding of the global technology platform strategy and the criticality of aligning to the principles of customizing / extending global platforms into territories and/ or providing alternative technology solutions aligned with geo and global platform owners strategy.  Assisting in the management of the retail and athlete application catalog for local and legacy technology solutions and environments as well as managing vendor relationships is a critical component of this role and working to drive towards global platforms and capabilities as well as proper operational management will be keys to the success of this role.  Critical to this role is understanding the end to end Lifecyle of the retail technology products, obsessing how products are performing in production and working closely with our Technical Operations organization as well as product owners to obsess incident and problem trends impacting our consumers and athletes.  Lastly, in this role, you will actively participate in the intake of new ideas and asks from our business partners in territory, helping to assess them against strategic objectives, priorities, and resource capacity. In addition, as retail technology solutions are delivered, you will be assessing and determining the delivery and transition approach as well as last mile technical implementation to the respective market/s till the successful handover to business and support teams.   WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?  KEY COMPETENCIES:  * Leadership: Provide technical expertise, responsible for delivering retail and athlete solutions to the retail doors.  * Accountability. Comfortable with ambiguity, change and the ability to provide ongoing thought leadership  * Functional planning: Capable to support the development key strategic initiatives, functional alignment and planning, and technical asks, as well as ability to translate them to be communicated to different critical audiences  * Product strategy, roadmap and requirement planning: ability to take business outcomes and customer research data and convert them into functional and non-functional requirements  * Product Management; Business System Analyst / Product Analysis: - For local and legacy solutions the ability to oversee E2E product lifecycles for a product grouping, from strategy (innovate, generate ideas, justify investments) to launch (execution, integration, sequencing), operating in-life (track performance, fix issues), managing end-of-life and measurement including integration, sequencing, and stitching across all levels. Technology solutioning: ability to drive technical solutioning in partnership with engineering. - For global solutions, you must be able to work with Geo Technical Product and engineering organization to infuse market specific nuances into solution requirements  * Cross-functional and stakeholder management: Ability to develop cross-functional knowledge to influence and communicate with stakeholders across functions. Collaborate with stakeholders to define system functional requirements and translate them into technical requirements for development. Manage effective communication and stakeholder expectations  * Project and Change Management - Ability to lead/co-lead and manage projects to ensure that the project KPIs are effectively tracked and delivered and met to the project objectives.- Close collaboration across technical and business teams to efficiently deliver the activation and transition of technologies in territories.  * Functional depth: - Retail Commerce solutions and experience dealing with country specific fiscal, legal, and other compliance related requirements including: - Retail point of sale platforms- Athletes Tools- Sales, inventory, traffic, downstream management and reporting- Connected inventory tools and solutions- Digital and athlete tools activation in retail environment- Online to Offline activation in retail environment  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:  You will have the following key competencies and oversee a team, leading them to excel in following competencies * Lead Consumer & Marketplace (C&M) - Retail Commerce work for the territory, delivering and operationalizing best in class consumer and member capabilities in partnership technical product, engineering, program and tech ops teams * A proven track record of successfully collaborating with technical and support teams and effectively interfacing with cross functional business teams * Proactively participate in the engagement within territory retail marketplace teams * Elevate the Territory requirements to the Geo Team * Provide effective communications to inform and manage stakeholder’s expectation * Partner closely with technology operations team(s) in the prioritization, escalation, and resolution of incident trends and problems. Partner and collaborate working relationship with L1, L2 global / local service desk, frontline support and application operation center. * Ability to analyze data and produce reports on issues and recommend resolutions. * Contribute in regular meetings to communicate project/operational statuses, identify any potential bottlenecks, and continuously manage expectations * Ensure Territory to Geo alignment on strategy, in sync execution of priorities, and accountability to manage change * Serve as a point of contact back to Geography technical product team(s) * Ensure products in territory have established expected outcomes, KPI’s and the ability to be measured * Partner Technical Product, Portfolio and program teammates in territory and geography to create relevant budget/financial commitments during planning cycles, budget preparation and review and calculating returns on investment  WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH:  You will partner with peers as well as senior level business internal partners on retail technology related scope and execution across the Nike Direct stores and cross-functions. You will have close partnership with the Technical Product Management Office, Digital Transformation Program Office and Technology Operations functions of Global Technology on strategy and in-sync execution of priorities to efficiently deliver and operationalize technology solutions in territories.   WHAT YOU BRING TO NIKE:  * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or other relevant subject area. * Minimum of 5+ years of experience in Digital / Information technology leading and supporting retail and digital commerce technologies. * Experience supporting eCommerce systems and integration both front-end and back-end * Demonstrated understanding of retail and commerce systems, processes and reporting. * Strong knowledge of incident / problem / knowledge management skillset. * Strategic and analytic focus using tools to measure against customer service metrics * Technical product and/or business system analyst (BSA) experience * Understanding of and experience in Agile project methodology * Able to listen and lead conversations of varying audiences, engineering, product support and business * Understanding of software development processes, including continuous delivery, DevOps, Scrum, Agile, Capabilities organization models, and Kanban * Self-motivated, with a high sense of accountability, urgency, and drive * Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and experience leading discussions and presenting to leadership * Ability to deal with ambiguity and work in a dynamic, results-oriented matrixed environment * Experience in delivering Portfolio reporting that provides insights and holds team members accountable for delivering results * Self-motivated, with a high sense of accountability, urgency, and drive    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_title: Head of Advanced Technology Group and CTO APAC
job_description: Job Description  Job Summary   Ericsson is the leader in 5G and is now driving the definition of the next generation as well. We are an unquestioned powerhouse when it comes to radio networks and overall mobile infrastructure.Group Function Technology, has a company-wide responsibility to drive long-term technology strategy and alignment inside and outside of the company. Within Asia Pacific, covering NE Asia, SE Asia, Australia and Oceania, and India, the CTO APAC manages, on behalf of the CTO, the activities.   To further strengthen the presence of Group Function Technology in APAC, we are establishing an Advanced Technology Group (ATG) APAC to proactively participate in initiatives setting industry direction and frameworks in Asia Pacific. The group is to drive advanced technology and architectural developments in cooperation with mobile operators, government bodies, industry organizations and ecosystem parties. The purpose is to strengthen Ericsson’s position as a leading and trusted player in the community and to support the definition of the future mobile platform, while ensuring maximum leverage of global scalable technologies and established frameworks.   The group will consist of proven industry and technology leaders that can lead initiatives and discussions across all key technology areas, e.g. AI/ML, Security, Cloud, IP, radio communication and 5G/6G in the context of a scalable industry and a trusted national and regional infrastructure.Considering the activities in countries such as China, Japan, South Korea and India, the unit will need to cover multiple interest groups and companies over many vital countries. Therefore, the unit will interact locally with the Ericsson regional market areas (MNEA and MOAI) as well as ATG’s in North America and Europe and units in Ericsson’s headquarter organization.   Role and responsibilities   The CTO APAC and Head of Advanced Technology Group APAC will lead the formation and implementation of Ericsson’s Technology Strategy within the geographical area. A dedicated group is to be established and built that acts in the region and with the group headquarters. The unit shall ensure that customers and other key stakeholders are given insights and understanding of the evolution of our mobile networks and their impact on the surrounding society. The group shall work with private industry and public organizations ensuring a wide acceptance. The group shall as well drive communication through public addresses and media appearances. An important task is to ensure regional aspects are adequately considered as part of the internal alignment activities.   The ATG APAC unit shall engage in the latest technology development, ensuring a base for the evolution of 5G and formation of 6G standard and its applicability to consumers and enterprises. In doing so, it will need to build long-term relation with leading research facilities in academia and industry. To drive the establishment of an ecosystem, the unit shall engage with stakeholders both in terms providing end-user applications & equipment or vital parts thereof as well as industry entities who will apply the technology as part of their operations.   The CTO APAC and Head of the ATG APAC is expected to directly interface with senior representatives in relevant bodies as a spokesperson for the company. The candidate needs to have a proven record of communication skills, being able to express thought leadership from a technology and business point-of-view to audiences with very different backgrounds. It is further expected by the role, to ensure that regional insights are incorporated in the company-wide strategy activities. Well-established relations with key stakeholders in headquarters are therefore a vital experience as are relationships with industry representatives. The role also includes the support of local market organizations, whereby the candidate will provide guidance and support on the company strategy and product decisions.   The candidate is expected to have held senior positions in the industry, including research, product development, sales and product & technology strategy over a sustained time. Long professional experience from standardization, product definition and market introduction as well as eco-system creation are desirable credentials. Proven managerial and organizational skills are expected. Post-graduate degree is a strong merit.   The Head of Advanced Technology Group and CTO APAC reports to the CTO of Ericsson.   Competence requirements and candidate profile   The candidate we are looking for must be a recognized technology leader with very strong understanding of Ericsson technology and architecture, as well as understanding the business foundations.    20+ years of experience from research and advanced technology in radio networks Experience from product definition, design and market introduction  A solid track record of earlier results, internally within Ericsson as well as externally. This can be exemplified with publications and research deliverables.  Recognized achievements in establishing international thought leadership organizations  Long experience from senior customer engagements with recognized results from C-level and board engagements  Experience from at least two generations of 3GPP systems with deep understanding on what it takes to industrialize each generation, from spectrum and early research to specifications in standards and to commercial roll out including devices.  Experience of engaging with academic and research institutions, leading labs and teams Strong ability to understand and engage with policy setting groups for long-term communications research and market creation  A good network with key individuals in the industry, agencies and academia and a capability of establishing new trustful relationships on senior levels  Very good analytical skills to be able to synthesize the essence of industry information as obtained in reports, business press and on-line sources  A very strong drive and working capacity  Strong leadership and interpersonal skills  Post-graduate degree      Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  About the job  The IT Engineering team is responsible to design, deploy, and manage the infrastructure, endpoints and applications our end users use in their everyday life. This position reports to the IT Engineering Lead who is based in Singapore, and the candidate can be based out of Singapore, Hong Kong, Poznan or London offices. Our IT infrastructure roughly looks like this:   Identity by Okta for 150+ SAAS services  Google Workspace, Slack, Atlassian Suite, Github  Workstations include Mac, Linux, Windows, Chromebooks, and VDI instances  Very little on-premise infrastructure. We’re cloud-based as much as possible  Workstations run device-management and endpoint protection clients  SIEM monitors events from endpoint-protection, SAAS services, and networks   Senior Infrastructure Engineer  Responsibilities  As an individual contributor on our IT Engineering team, you’ll have a broad set of responsibilities including:   Designing, planning, implementing and managing Network, Systems, SaaS, Infrastructure, Virtualization and Cloud environments in accordance with IT guidelines and standards (the mix will depend on your career path, interests, and past experience)  Resolving a diverse range of problems that spans across multiple technology domains  Researching new solutions for business and operational requirements, converting requirements to technical and functional indicators, identifying vendors in the market, performing evaluations and proof of concepts, and drafting business proposals  Driving technical projects with efficiency, quality, and impact  Seeking areas of improvement for processes, technologies, and tools that provides business outcomes in terms of better security, higher productivity, or cost effectiveness  Monitoring infrastructure health, providing escalation support for issues that require engineering support by troubleshooting and fixing infrastructure and application issues  Applying security best practices in current processes to address identified issues in threat models, and keeping systems and applications updated with latest software patch  Implementing change management by authoring change request documents that achieve a high standard for clarity  Understanding and driving prioritized tasks based on department and company goals  Drafting IT guidelines and policies for managing the infrastructure and cloud environments  Educating company teams on the use of cloud applications and services   Required Skills   Experience implementing and managing one or more cloud/SaaS services such as Okta, 1Password, Google Workspace, Confluence, AWS, and Jira, or equivalent experience in similar cloud or SaaS services  Experience with deploying and configuring VMware Workspace ONE, Google MDM, or similar endpoint management solutions  Experience with network and firewall appliances from vendors such as Juniper, Cisco, Unifi, and Palo Alto, or equivalent experience in similar network and firewall technologies  Experience with VMWare vSphere, vCenter, and ESX design, integration and deployment.  Advanced knowledge of networking and internet protocols, including TCP/IP, ARP, DNS, SMTP, DHCP, HTTP/HTTPS, and distributed networks.   Preferred Skills   Advanced knowledge of network authentication protocols and Network Access Control (NAC) technologies  Experience in automating your daily tasks by writing scripts (or making use of existing scripts) and tools in Python, bash, terraform, powershell  Experience in Linux or similar systems/server management   What we offer   Challenging work in a fun and collaborative environment  Attractive compensation and time-off benefits  Spacious open-concept and centrally located offices  Full-time employment with flexible working hours  Fully stocked pantry with fresh fruit and snacks  Team lunches and company events every quarter  Multicultural teams represented by 30+ nationalities   Note: Please upload your resume as a PDF and do not include any salary or compensation information in it. Job Description  The successful candidate will be working closely with the Technology Enterprise Architect under the Regional Enterprise Architecture team. He/She will liaise closely with other teams to design and implement highly available and resilient systems. He/She will mainly (but not limited to) work on middleware infrastructure and platforms, as well as Operating System alignment with business/application requirements. He/She must have prior experience in successfully architecting, designing, and implementing hardware, operating systems and middleware to form optimized solutions. He/She will focus on coherent distributed middleware design, including sizing, optimized configuration, considering proper process/program location, as well as linkage with software components and applications. In addition, he/she is required to work on advanced, complex technology projects. He/She is also expected to work with business issues requiring technology solutions, using emerging technologies to deliver on the business requirement. Job Description  Company Overview  Quadrant is a global leader in location data and technology. Our newest product, Geolancer, is set to revolutionize how companies collect and verify accurate data from the real-world to drive their products and services. Having up-to-date point of interest data, as well as additional metadata, with accurate latitude and longitude information can make or break a business. This role is a critical role to the success of Geolancer and our client’s business.   Position Summary:  A Quadrant’s Data Quality Assurance Engineer assists Quadrant’s client stakeholders in driving project performance, by providing task support focused on reviewing content, improving data quality, managing database quality, identifying trends, and escalating issues to project stakeholders and engineers. Excellent communication skills, demonstrated flexibility, agility and adaptability to constant changing program needs are essential in this role. This role is full-time position. All our team operates remote.  Goals and Purpose of the Content Review Specialist position:   Ensuring the data collected by our Geolancers matches project quality requirements  Helping create scalable systems for data quality assurance.  Supporting project stakeholders by reviewing and annotating data with excellent attention to detail.  Improving overall program quality and delivery by communicating effectively with product and project stakeholders, engineers, and vendors as needed.  Help test hypotheses and generate high quality feedback.   Position Responsibilities :   This position is expected to be subject matter experts at all program guidelines.  Deliver consistent high-quality content review.  Review and annotate data with excellent attention to detail.  Identify and communicate data trends, based on project guidelines.  Assist project stakeholders by creating, editing and reviewing project guidelines.  Assist in creating or compiling examples for training sets or guidelines.  Basic tool testing. Summarize findings for external departments, assist with resolving issues as needed.  Hypothesis testing - review samples within an undefined task and extract information based on common sense. Provide feedback and provide insights into data.  Review accuracy of weekly roster quizzes and other clarification materials to ensure alignment with guidelines.  Provide information and feedback about specific nuances due to differences in languages.  Support other teams with hypothesis testing, as needed; help define certain labels and definitions that they are trying to test and provide the ground truth.  Attend meetings as scheduled.   Position Requirements:   Familiarity and regular use of SQL/NoSQL databases like DynamoDB  1-2 years of experience as a QA, data annotator, judge, rater, content reviewer or similar field.  Demonstrated organizational and time-management skills and attention to detail; be able to perform tasks in defined timeframes, accurately.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Very strong attention to detail  Excellent technical skills.  Desired: Bilingual fluency in Indonesian, Vietnamese, Tamil, or Malay.    Note: We are currently all remote across 6 countries. You have the option from working from a shared office, but it is only optional. This position can be 100% remote, work from home. job_title: Azure Customer Engineer (FastTrack for Azure - Apps)
job_description: Job Description  Are you an engineer or architect who is passionate about cloud application engineering & architecture? Do you enjoy building, designing scalable solutions and enabling customers / partners to build and deploy them? Are you intrigued by new technologies and how can they be applied to solve for real-world problems our customers and partners? If the answer is yes, we are looking for Apps Engineers like you to work with us in FastTrack for Azure, a part of Azure Customer Experiences Team in Microsoft.  Azure Customer Experience (CXP) team is a growing Engineering team of customer obsessed & passionate individuals that drive positive customer outcomes and experiences. FastTrack for Azure (FTA) is a customer success service to help customers confidently onboard to Azure and getting them on the right track to “build it right, architect it right, the first time”. FTA takes a solution-centric approach and provides customers with Engineering resources, best practices, tools, and resources that drive Azure usage.  Are you interested in working for one of the most exciting products in Microsoft, passionate about exceeding customer expectations and advancing Microsoft’s cloud first strategy? Are you interested in a start-up like environment, passionate about cloud computing technology and driving growth in one of Microsoft’s core businesses? If so, then look no further than the Azure Customer Experience Team! Microsoft Azure provides customers with on-demand and infinitely scalable infrastructure and platform for customers to build, host, and scale service applications on the Internet through Microsoft’s global data centers.  Responsibilities  As a customer engineer, you will primarily be working with customers in providing guidance & sharing best practices to ensure reliable, scalable, secured and cost optimized deployment of their applications on Microsoft Azure. Some of the key responsibilities will include:   You MUST be a lifelong learner capable of continuously learning new technologies.  Directly engage with customers and partners to validate newly designed Solution and existing Solutions for migration & modernisation, partner with other Customer Engineers to provide end to end guidance  Accelerate the customer projects to production  Partner with FTA Program Managers in helping them scope pre-qualified complex projects  Provide knowledge and insight to build the customers' confidence.  Identify common patterns from your engagements and work with a thriving FTA community of Engineers to share best practices & learnings at scale  Drive product improvement by capturing product-related feedback that the relevant Product teams can triage  Contribute to documentation through sample scripts, blogs, architecture best practices.  Be a leader for junior engineers across Asia  Contribute to the broader FTA team across Asia   Qualifications  Skills listed below can help in being successful in this role, we don’t expect you to have all of them and we seek individuals who are excited about this role and love to learn what’s required.  Technical Experience   Overall cloud fundamentals such as governance, monitoring & security with respect to App Technologies  Design & deploy high level solution architectures including basics of infrastructure & applications on cloud or an understanding how application components fits into the overall solution  Experience with and ability to lead customers with  two or more  of the following:Application modernisation using Azure technologies such as (App Service, Storage, ASE, CDN) Containers on Azure (AKS, ACI, ACR) Integration using Azure Integration services (APIM, Functions, Service Bus, Logic Aps, Event Grid etc) Application specific usage of data services (SQL, CosmosDB, Table Storage, Redis) Application Security on Azure (WAF, FrontDoor, Private Networking, Sentinel) OSS on Azure   Familiar with one of the modern programming languages such as C#, Go, Java, or JavaScript etc.  Familiar with the DevOps practices and experience with the tooling such as Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, ARM templates or Terraform etc.   Customer Facing Experience   Creating & validating requirements and guiding architectural decision making with customers  Effectively driving recommendations and land priorities across customers, partners, senior executives across organizational boundaries  Leading projects, consulting and/or delivery experience  Leading technical conversations, bringing in & leveraging relevant technical expertise from other teams  Working with enterprise customers on cloud specific data solutions, application development & deployment   Highly Regarded but not essential   Singapore G50 or above security clearance   Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:  Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.  The successful candidate must be able to legally work in Singapore.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the  Accommodation request form .  #AzCXP  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. job_description: Job Description  Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. We believe a great career is a journey of discovery and exploration. So, we ask, where will your journey take you?   JOB SUMMARY   This position sits within Asia Pacific (APAC) iT PMO team and provides comprehensive analysis and business intelligence support for the APAC iT Asia Pacific team. The Data Coordinator will help the iT PMO team develop regular dashboard and performance reviews (weekly/ monthly/ quarterly/ annually) on the APAC iT performance at continent, area and property level against goals.   CANDIDATE PROFILE  Education and Experience   · Bachelor’s degree in statistics/ mathematics/ computer science/ economics or a related field.  · Strong coursework in quantitative disciplines, including statistics, economics, or operations research, etc.  · 3+ years of relevant work experience as a quantitative data analyst.  · Experience working with a data visualization package, including Tableau and PowerBI  Skills and Competencies  · Strong computer skills required.  · Advanced Excel skills preferred, including Visual Basic Programming (Macros), Statistical Analysis and Database Management.  · Ability to organize large volumes of data to create a synthesized, meaningful analysis.  · Strong communication skills. Ability to present analytical results in manner appropriate for leadership team decision-making, esp. in ppt  · Excellent interpersonal skills. Ability to work with and communicate effectively with all levels of management.  · Self-starter with strong tendency toward pro-active process improvement.  · Exceptional organizational skills. Job Description  Primary Objectives:   Custodian and system expert who can advise, analyze, plan, implement, maintain, support (and retire/refresh where required) all locally hosted (On premise, Cloud) business applications and platforms required to run Singapore operations:   • Maintain and ensure business application running in production are kept running and supported in a healthy state;  • Analyze and recommend new application and platform acquisitions to meet evolving Singapore Operation’s needs based on capturing and documenting business requirements elicited from business stakeholders  • Where the business application is in-house developed do the required coding and development, otherwise engage with 3rd party vendor to get enhancements developed and then deploy into test and prod when ready  • Ensure IT is operated in a manner that complies with Bank Policies and frameworks, standards, circulars, guidelines and MAS regulated act, notices, circulars, and guidelines applicable to technology (Compliance, Audit, Risk Adherence). – Application and Platforms  • Ensure IT assets are protected and secure – Applications and Platforms  • Assist in annual budgeting – Applications and Platforms  • Be a key stakeholder and technology partner on the bank Digital journey.  • Foster and champion bank PRIDE values within the technology department and imbue the department with a culture of teamwork, innovation, discipline, resiliency and dedication to how work is approached.  • Where vendor based solution approach adopted and/or outsourced approach, arrange due diligence and assessment from technology perspective on behalf of users.  • Provide day-to-day support to business users on any application system issues or constraints  • Ensure assigned application deployments running on bank managed environments are properly QA and meet conditions.  • Co-ordinate the setup and manage test environments to ensure business can do their enhancements and new projects testing for assign applications.  Specific to Senior System Analyst  Senior System Analysts are assigned to specialize in one of the following groupings of business applications and platforms:  • Core Systems: Back-office systems such as core banking systems (Customer, Statements, Loans/Limits, Deposit, GL, Branch Banking, Trade, Asset Based Financing) and In-house Systems (loans related, bank notes system, Safe deposit box, excel based).  Digital and Payments: Digital, Payments and Channel systems such as Mobile Banking (MBK), SOA / API and Messaging platforms, UAS/E2EE/MFA customer token platform, Digital onboarding, ATMs, SWIFT/MEPS+, G3 Fast and Bulk Payments, Cheque processing system, Enterprise workflow system, document share system, RPA   Key Responsibilities:  Strategy, Planning, Mgmt. Reporting  • Provide expert advice and support to technology management in the area of expertise  • Contribute in the formulation a comprehensive Branch IT strategy covering IT policies and procedures, security, architecture, business solutions and operational functional requirements  • Keep abreast of developments and innovations in the FI IT landscape  • Provide mentorship, support and guidance to colleagues, share information and facilitate problem solving  • Contribute in the yearly budgeting for IT expenditures and investments.  IT Operations  • Ensure business applications running in production are healthy and functioning per expected.  • Ensure prompt and efficient provision of IT support based on assigned area of expertise (includes request from Data center operations team)  • Oversee contingency plans and ensure their adequacy  • Ensure IT assets are protected and secure  • Maintain and ensure timely renewal of digital certificates and proper lodgment with IT security team.  • Ensure IT operations run in a manner consistent with high score from audit, risk, compliance assessments. The following to be operationalized as standard procedure against all IT asset components:  – Administrative Accounts – All admin accounts lodged into PAM solution per group IT Security guidelines and MAS notice 655 point 4.1  – Patching – Patch notification process established with vendors and patch calendar updated, upon patch release assessment and implementation as needed Per patching guidelines and MAS notice 655 point 4.2  – Hardening - Per component definition and enforcement against SG security standard and Group IT Security guidelines and SG addendum/s and MAS notice 655 point 4.3  – Network Perimeter Defense – Network traffic and segments, firewalls, proxies, dns, vpn access setup in secure manner per group IT security guidelines and MAS notice 655 4.4  – Malware – IT Security consulted and all required IT security protections installed on IT assets per MAS notice 655 point 4.5  – Multi-factor Authentication – MFA, where applicable implement MFA of administrative and internet accounts with access to customer information using PAM per MAS notice 655 point 4.6  – Logging and Monitoring – Security, Capacity, Downtime, Audit  – Capacity Mgmt. – Pre-emptive monitoring (via monitoring), planning and execution of capacity upgrades as needed  – EOL/EOS Upgrades – Per group guidelines. Track and execute upgrades and/or do risk assessment and deviation approval.  – Housekeeping – scripted clean-ups and truncations of logs and temp files after necessary archives executed  – Backups – Required backup strategy per backup guidelines operationalized to central Backup Platform. Recurring scheduled backup validation activities scheduled and performed ongoing to ensure backups working per need.  • Work with system stakeholders to ensure proper classification of system criticality and ensure design and architecture can meet the assessed criticality needs:  – MAS 644 defined Critical system – Ensure DR setup and working and can achieve RTO within 4 hours, RPO within 2 hours and maximum unplanned downtime of not more than 4 hours per rolling 12 months;  – MAS 644 defined non-critical system – Ensure HA/DR per stakeholder requirement.  • BCM related activity planning and execution  • Review and Approve/Reject production change requests as part of TCAB committee  • Raise CAB CR as necessary  • Cutover related planning and execution  • Ensure and maintain adequate test environments in good working order to support enhancements and new projects;  • Adhere to SDLC for both in-house and 3rd party solution platforms.  • Take BAU day 2 operational ownership in terms of maintenance, support and minor enhancement ownership of new systems and/or major enhancements delivered by the Digital Delivery and DevOps team  • Track IT related spend against budget.  • Write Memos to authorize procurements  • Write Memos to get deviation approvals where required.  Application and Systems Development / New Platform Acquisition  • Lead in the requirements gathering and documentation, design and where in-house the coding, test support and implementation of new systems or enhancements of existing systems:  – Analyze, design, document and develop technical solutions according to business requirements (or in case of off the shelf, co-ordinate with 3rdparty vendor)  – Provide accurate, complete and up to date system documentation  – Provide training to users to ensure correct usage and proper adoption upon rollout  – Oversee the QA of software implementation  • Oversee the deployment and implementation of applications to run on Cloud for existing systems based on end-user needs and business rationale.  • Assist team lead to write and table committee papers as required to get new systems and/or platforms, or major refreshes approved.  • Write Memos to authorize procurements  • Write Memos to get deviation approvals where required  • Work together with Digital Delivery and DevOps team to support digital and cloud initiatives in terms of initial advisory and then follow-on necessary analysis and co-ordination/implementation related to integration requirements and enhancement required to existing business applications to enable the digital initiative.  • Work with Digital Delivery and DevOps team to support migration of workloads running on-premises to Cloud.  Regulatory and Procedural Expertise  • Keep up to date and refreshed on required reading related to guiding how IT must be run in a regulated Financial institution. Minimum read list:  – MAS Technology Risk Management Guidelines (TRMG)  – MAS Notice 644 – Technology Risk Management.  – MAS Notice 655 – Cyber Hygiene  – MAS Outsourcing Guidelines  – RHB Group IT Security Guidelines and SG addendum/s  – SG Patching Guidelines  – SG Backup Guidelines  – SG Technology Department Operational Manual (OM)  – SG IT Standard Operational Procedures (SOP), and System Manuals (SM)  – SG Procurement Operational Manual (OM)  Other Responsibilities  • Participate in Monthly Technology Department meetings.  • Participate in regular Team meeting.  • Use Department issue and work tracking platform.  • Maintain and keep up to date team knowledge base and assist in updating team document assets such as system manual / standard operating procedures (SOP), and operations manuals   Requirements:   Bachelor Degree/Masters Qualification  Minimum 5 years of experience documenting requirements, designing solutions, and coding or configuring off the shelf software as part of technology department in a financial institution  Minimum 3 years of experience in providing level 3 IT operations support in a financial institution  Experience managing vendors  Working knowledge of bank operations and products  Experience in supporting and configuring core banking systems  Experience in agile based SDLC methodologies  JavaScript / Node.js | .Net | Java | SQL | Python | Shell Scripting development skills     Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  The  Finance Manager (FP&A)  is responsible for effectively planning, reporting, and communicating our corporate financial results and plans. The manager provides leadership over the finance team and effectively manages direct reports. This position is responsible for completion of the company financial budget and financial forecasts. The individual has the ability to draw conclusions and provide insight from complex financial data sets. The manager participates in driving execution of the corporate financial strategy.   What You'll Do   Manages the annual budget planning process providing assistance to operating groups as needed to ensure timely development of an accurate budget that supports corporate goals and strategies  Manages and leads direct reports in the area of finance  Participates in driving solutions to key analytical, strategic and business challenges  Drives process improvements related to forecasting, reporting, modeling and analysis  Works with operations to forecast, report and analyze financial performance  Responsible for reports to internal stakeholders, including headcount, compensation, and assigned cost-center reports  Delivers key analysis of financial and operational performance on a weekly and monthly basis  Prepares executive level financial presentations utilized by senior management   What You'll Need   Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills  Ability to set priorities, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, changing environment  Extremely detail oriented and organized  Ability to work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision  Time management  Ability to multi-task with multiple projects simultaneously  Ability to interact effectively with co-workers across all levels and areas of the company  Ability to deliver results under tight deadlines  Excellent analytical, technical, financial modeling and presentation skills  Ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions and develop actionable recommendations  Effectively lead and develop direct reports  8+ Years of experience in finance, business analytics or planning experience required  BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related field required  Ability to travel up to 25% of the time  Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office.   Where You’ll Work  Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created.   Customer Success: Always delight our customers.  Trust: Rely on each other.  Integrity: Do the right thing, every time.  Collaboration: Share resources and work together.  Innovation: Keep creating solutions and finding better ways.  Inclusion: Support a diverse community where we all belong.  Accountability: Be responsible for your success and failure.   We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.  At Workiva, You’ll Enjoy   Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.  Involvement: Ability to participate in Employee Resource Groups, (Women in Tech, Women in Sales, Ethnic Diversity, Veterans, Rainbow (LGBTQ), Remote Employees, Caregiving) Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and more  Work-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.   Learn more:  http://https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/workiva-life-and-careers/ Workiva is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Job Description  Responsibilities  Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. Job Description  About the Department  Account Executives, Channel Account Managers, Business Development Representatives, Solution Engineers, Customer Success, and Sales Operations - all working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences. The sales team at Cloudflare helps customers solve real, technical problems while creating the revenue streams that help the company provide free service to millions in our community.  Based in Singapore, you will drive sales into enterprise and mid-market accounts across India for Cloudflare’s solutions. Your strategic selling activities will include "hunter" type activities to proactively penetrate target named accounts, detailed account planning, focused relationship building and leading effective sales campaigns to successful closure.  The ideal candidate will possess both a major account sales background in technology solutions, primarily software based, that enables them to drive engagement with senior level decision makers within Cloudflare’s target customers. Industry experience selling into Finance, Retail, Manufacturing and other Enterprise verticals along with Service Provider is desired in this role.  As an Account Executive, you'll be responsible for developing and executing against a Sales strategy/plan for assigned vertical or accounts, as well as driving large account sales into India markets to achieve revenue targets. Therefore, you must have a strong network of contacts with decision makers in enterprise accounts across the region, and have experience selling complex solutions to these accounts. You will have an intuitive understanding and experience with the key business and technical needs of these and large accounts and will create and deliver compelling value propositions to them for Cloudflare solutions.  Additional responsibilities will include   Manage contract negotiations  Maintain a robust sales pipeline  Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts  < 50% travel   Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience   Bachelor's degree required  Fluent in English  Relevant direct experience, track record, and relationships within largest corporate enterprise accounts in India market  3 years of direct B2B selling experience, preferably managing internet accounts  Direct experience selling network security and/or CDN solutions and services preferred  Prior experience being part of an early sales team helping drive traction in India market for a US-based SaaS company highly preferred  Experience managing longer, complex sales cycles  Basic understanding of computer networking and “how the internet works”  Aptitude for learning technical concepts/terms (Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus)  Strong interpersonal communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills  Self-motivated; entrepreneurial spirit  Comfortable working in a fast paced dynamic environment   What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released  1.1.1.1  to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our  privacy commitment  and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. Job Description  LeadIQ makes sales teams more efficient in collecting and enriching leads by using automation and intelligence to cut out tedious prospecting steps. We are looking for Test Engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality and reliability. By joining our team, you will take part in various projects, assessing software quality by designing and implementing software testing processes. You will take ownership of code quality through exploratory and automated tests. You will hunt bugs, identify issues, report them, and see that they’re dealt with.      The Role   Work closely with the software development team in the development of new features and/or enhancements for the product  Create software testing documents containing, but not limited to, detailed test scenarios, expected and actual results, and other feature-related information. Documents may include test plans, test suites, test cases, and automation-related manuals  Conduct automated tests on features and/or bug fixes on a testing environment to ensure that such items meet the requirements prior to release  Create maintainable automated tests to lessen the amount of time spent on conducting manual tests  Collaborate with the Software Quality Assurance team on improving internal processes and ensuring the reliability of automated processes   The Person   Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or any related field  +5 years of work experience in creating automated test scripts using Java and Selenium WebDriver (or similar)  +3 years of work experience in integrating automated tests into CI platforms such as Gitlab, Jenkins, or similar  Knowledge of various software testing methods (e.g. Regression, Sanity, Smoke, etc.)  Prior experience working in an Agile environment  Good verbal, written, communication, and interpersonal skills  Highly motivated, team-oriented, goal-driven, and with keen attention to detail   Plus Factors   Experience with an automation tool like Gherkin (Cucumber)  Experience in creating automated test scripts for chrome extensions  Experience in conducting API testing for GraphQL  Familiarity with project management tools such as JIRA   Attributes we’re after  Aside from technical skills, we want team members with attributes like:   a team player who is comfortable in a collaborative environment  experience working in geographically distributed teams with good communication & problem-solving skills  autonomous: someone who can be reliable in taking charge of, and own features    About Us  LeadIQ  is a sales enablement startup backed by Draper Associates, Jason Calacanis, Fresco Capital, and Eight Roads. With offices in SF Bay Area, New Hampshire, and Singapore, we are building a world-class company culture that is reinventing how companies find their best customers with sales intelligence, productivity, insights, and resources for success. Some of our customers include MuleSoft, AppDyanmics, WalkMe, Gainsight, and many more. We take pride in building a company and product that materially improves people’s lives, whether they’re an employee or a customer. Plus, we have fun doing it!    Great place to work!!  We offer our team members a unique culture, including flexibility, trust and independence. Our team is diverse, friendly and welcoming with experienced engineers you can learn a lot from, plus an upbeat culture in Singapore interested in cutting edge technologies and embracing innovation.    If you are  a team player who is comfortable in a collaborative environment, experienced working across teams with great communication & problem-solving skills, we want you! Jump on this opportunity to design, take charge of, and own product features like you never did before.   LeadIQ is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status. Job Description  Director, Solution Engineering, Asia Sales & Business Development | Singapore   Our agreement with employees DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.   The team Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.   This position The Director of Solution Engineering is responsible for managing a team of Solution Engineers (individual contributors) who support our Sales team across Asia. Key markets include Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines across all customer segments - from SMB through to Enterprise.   This SE team discovers and understands customer business challenges, complex processes, and architectural landscapes in order to build world-class integrated solutions leveraging DocuSign’s platform and suite of products. Through engaging stories and custom-built demonstrations, SEs illustrate the value and benefits of modernizing a prospect’s System of Agreement through DocuSign’s Agreement Cloud offerings. The Director is accountable for coaching and developing these individual contributors, helping them to drive adoption/usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem.   This position reports to the Senior Director of Solution Engineering for Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) and is designated flex.    Responsibilities  ● Daily management of the Solution Engineering team  ● Scale team by attracting and mentoring extraordinary solution engineers with various levels of experience and diversity to grow a well-balanced, high performing team Identify and create opportunities for training and professional development of team  ● Provide individual coaching to help develop and refine core technical, selling, and presentation skills to help team grow and excel  ● Drive collaboration with sales team to aid in cultivating and securing net-new business  ● Communicate and prioritize product and business needs from the field to appropriate internal teams including Product Development, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement, Support, Professional Services, and others  ● Ensure team effectively operates in accordance with team policies and procedures  ● Continually assess team operations and make adjustments or policy recommendations to drive team collaboration, efficiency, and effectiveness  ● Maintain and protect DocuSign core values by hiring culturally aligned team members and leading by example   Basic Qualifications  ● 5-10+ years of experience in a technical pre-sales role  ● 5+ years of experience leading technical pre-sales teams  ● BS/BA degree or equivalent in relevant work experience   Preferred Qualifications  ● Track record of building, coaching and enabling a rapidly growing Solution Engineering teams  ● Hire and retain top talent in the market, providing career growth opportunities and effective succession planning  ● An inspiring, innovative leader with the ability to deal with high volume transactional business and enterprise sales models  ● Experience selling into customers across Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines  ● Focus on innovation - ensure the team is constantly improving their approach to solution and value based selling  ● Prioritize and qualify where to invest the pre sales resources to get maximum impact of every investment  ● Masterful in delivering software demonstrations, both in-person or remotely  ● Proven experience with cloud software configuration and integration  ● Experience with technical business documentation including process flows, architectural diagrams, proposals, RFPs and RFIs, etc.  ● Proven experience working with employees at all levels of an organization  ● Familiarity with system integration methods such as web services including SOAP & REST APIs  ● Familiarity with HTML, XML, and structured data  ● Familiarity with Enterprise-class software systems such as ERP, CRM, and ECM.  ● Familiarity with electronic signature and/or CLM concepts a plus  ● Strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail  ● Embody DocuSign’s values  ● Willingness to travel 25% or more as needed (post pandemic)   About Us DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that’s a good thing.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the business and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category. Job Description  About the Role  Are you excited by the opportunity to revolutionize the way the global financial industry uses and interacts with data? Do you want to reach millions of people and help them achieve their financial goals? Do you enjoy innovative and fast-paced environments?  InvestCloud (formerly Finantix) is looking for a talented, full-time   UI/UX Designer  to work closely with project managers, business analysts, developers, internal stakeholders and InvestCloud clients to create beautiful, intuitive, innovative, and engaging UI/UX designs. Excellent skills in Sketch, Abstract, InVision and Adobe CC Suite  Exceptional design portfolio (mandatory)  A passion for problem-solving, design and UI/UX  An eye for design and a passion for the creative process  Knowledge of private banking/wealth management is preferred  Basic understanding of HTML and CSS  Excellent communication skills(written and spoken)  Independent person, creative problem solver and comfortable working as part of a virtual team  Self-starter with excellent communication, collaboration and interpersonal skills  Ability to complete multiple projects simultaneously within tight deadlines  Must be flexible with ability to grow and adapt  Must be flexible to work across international time-zones   About InvestCloud  InvestCloud is a global company specializing in digital platforms that enable the development of financial solutions, pre-integrated into the Cloud. The company offers on-demand client experiences and intuitive operations solutions using an ever-expanding library of modular apps, resulting in powerful products. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community. The Enablement team aims to be the strategic partner of the T&S team., driving collaboration, optimization, and synergy for Trust & Safety (T&S) global functioning, whereas other T&S functions fight at the frontline for content integrity and community safety. We facilitate the application of smooth cross-functional/cross-region/cross-culture corporations, support, and training, and drive change initiatives for leadership within the organization so that they fight with maximum efficiency and sustainability. As our international organization expands rapidly and becomes more complex, the Enablement team identifies strategic priorities, opportunities, pain points, provides insights and revolutionary solutions; so that we build better efficiency and consistency into the organization and promote global synergy under localized decision making. As the head of compliance, you will be responsible for data access and storage security, workflow and process integrity, and compliance related to employee procedures, including violations of key business, information leakage, bribery, power abuse and conflict of interests.    What will I be doing? -   You'll lead a team of compliance to coordinate between T&S internal team and company level compliance stakeholders to help establish T&S data management principles that not only comply with the company' principles but also fits T&S's needs. - You'll set up a system to track and monitor the access given, whether the people guaranteed have left the company/ no longer needs the access and to clear the redundant access in a timely matter. - You'll establish a function or system to better separate and store the data according to sharing needs, avoiding oversharing or leak of information. - You'll take an insider to detailed analyze in close cooperation with our team members to better understand and prepare us for proactive risk mitigation work particularly regarding workflow compliance. The team should work closely with function/hub leaders to help them to evaluate the workflow and set up a compliant yet still efficient process for key workflow. The team should also examine closely how to hold the compliance process set effective. - You'll need well-designed employee behavior programs to help our team members better understand the sensitivity of our work and also the code of conduct to guide our employee action.   What should I bring with me? -   7+ years' prior experience in Compliance, Audit, or Risk Management and working with data analytics, business Intelligence, or software development teams. Experience in people management of compliance teams is a must. - You preferably have master's degree or above in a Compliance-related field (Legal Studies, Criminal Justice, Law Enforcement, Finance, etc) - Strong project management and organizational skills and ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously; - You are a self-driven team player with a strong sense of ownership and are able to adapt to flexible working hours; - You have a deep understanding of cultural differences and strong cross-cultural communication; capabilities; sensitivity to cultural nuances. - Comfortable working in a company experiencing rapid growth and evolution and that is the subject of intense public scrutiny; Preferred Ideally, this person needs to have a mix of information security, internal audits background. and - Excellent communication skills - Able to adjust to complex environments in a global company. - At least three years in managing or building compliance team in a multi-national firm with a size of over 5,000 people. - Information security background to understand the nature of our data protection needs and engage team if needed. - Internal Audits background to better work with the internal audits term and also handle investigations within T&S.    TikTok is committed to the wellbeing of all our employees. Our promise is to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach. Job Description  About this role  Are you user-obsessed and eager to shape the future of mobility and play a key role in delivering the GetGo experience?   GetGo is building the #1 carsharing platform in APAC that enables everyone with the freedom to drive, without the burden of ownership. In doing so, we seek to create a mobility ecosystem that's shared and sustainable for all.   We are looking for an experienced, technically talented, and highly motivated team player and leader to transform ideas into product features.   Our ideal candidate has a strong background in managing teams involved with software support, technical applications usage, technical troubleshooting, technical documentation, and strives to be a technology-driven thought leader.   Key responsibilities  As the Technical Project Manager, you will be working closely with the CTO and the Engineering teams internationally to develop and execute our product roadmap. Your key responsibilities include:   Lead engineering initiatives for GetGo’s main consumer mobile application and work closely with diverse teams across the organization and around world  Facilitating the end-to-end delivery of GetGo’s main customer mobile application and ensuring they are shipped against the target deadlines and standards.  Manage cross-functional software engineering programs in a matrix organisation covering a range of areas  Identify and break down complex business problems into solvable pieces that can be shipped iteratively  Balance the business needs with technical constraints by building deep subject matter expertise for your area of work  Proactively identify inefficiencies that are holding the team back, and drive better, more efficient workflows  Interface with engineering teams and product managers for defining requirements and scope  Establishing trust with a variety of internal and external stakeholders, eliminating non-value-add activity and blockers, and finding creative ways to accelerate project delivery  Providing progress updates and reports to the various department heads, and also feeding relevant information back to the teams  Capturing feedback from various teams and continuously improving the team’s agile approach  Facilitating daily stand-ups, meetings, demos, retrospectives and various decision-making processes in order.   Why you should join us   Be part of the fastest-growing and largest carsharing technology company in Singapore  Achieve meaningful objectives and make an impact on users at scale as part of a mission-driven and values-based organization  Enjoy tremendous opportunities for growth  Be empowered. You will report directly to our CTO and work closely with the rest of the GetGo core team (CEO, CMO, COO, Head of Product) to shape the next phase of our product development   Who are we looking for   You are a highly experienced leader of leaders, with proven success in the role.  You have a strong background in managing teams involved with software support, technical applications usage, technical troubleshooting, technical documentation, and consider yourself a technology-driven thought leader.  You are an innovator who has a proven track record of implementing fresh ideas into established models.  You thrive in an innovative culture where autonomy is necessary and strong communication is paramount.  You have proven mentorship skills, with demonstrated ability to listen, identify root causes, creatively problem-solve, and positively impact individual and team performance.  You have strong communication skills to partner with technical and non-technical stakeholders in a global and diverse environment.  You love to document and define new support solutions, offer highly effective solutions to their problems, cut out complexity, and maximize team productivity.  You are motivated to be a consistently high performer by taking the initiative to uncover areas of opportunity and identify innovative ways to improve overall team performance.  You have experience working with software support tools such as Jira, Asana, Slack and Confluence spaces.  You have strong personal alignment with our GetGo Values:    Get it going!  Stay curious and humble  Innovate constantly  Keep it simple  Collaborate for success  Enjoy the ride     Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Job Summary  The Regional Sales Director - Japan is responsible for obtaining new business from Executive level buyers and influencers in either private or publicly traded companies. Successful candidates will build relationships and identify Workiva products and services that meet customer needs to drive customer acquisition within a specific geography or industry. Sales growth is attained through new customer subscriptions, professional services, and set up and training.  What You Will Do  Sales Responsibilities   Prospects new business by conducting research to identify key decision makers and influencers within target accounts  Works with Sales Development Representatives to generate initial customer interest to secure an introductory meeting  Presents to Customers: Uses the facts found in the needs analysis phase to present a compelling demonstration of the Workiva suite of products and create a customer belief that they must have Workiva products  Handles Objections: Skillfully probes for objections and removes obstacles or eliminates barriers to gain commitment; understands the difference between a stall and an objection  Closes Sales: Naturally leads the sales process to a close by demonstrating Workiva superior value proposition  Negotiates the Sale: Facilitates successful outcomes to optimize profits   Individual Responsibilities   Reports Customer Contacts: Updates customer relationship management tools regularly and timely  Forecasts Sales: Provides consistent and accurate forward-looking information though pipeline analysis  Plans Sales Strategy: Plans and executes sales strategy with purposeful action to complete the sale  Optimizes Internal Resources: Gathers internal support to pursue an account  Prioritizes selling activities and follows through in a timely fashion  Maintains a strong knowledge of Workiva products through a commitment to ongoing training   What You Will Need  Skills   Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills in Japanese and English  Understanding of the Software as a Service business model  Ability to demonstrate various software applications  Executive presence; ability to communicate at the most senior level  Ability to identify and understand the power of influencers versus buyers and how to navigate the nuances of each during sales cycle.  Ability to manage multiple transactions at one time  Ability to manage multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously  Ability to negotiate pricing with a focus on retaining value   Experience   At least 7 years of solution selling to Executives - Software as a Service model preferred   Education   Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field   Working Conditions & Physical Requirements   Depending on assigned work location, walking outdoors between company campus facilities in a variety of weather conditions may be necessary to perform responsibilities of this position  Works virtually, residing in the territory  30% travel for regular customer meetings and sales calls  Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office.    Where You’ll Work   Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created. Innovation:  Keep creating solutions and finding better ways.  Inclusion:  Support a diverse community where we all belong.  Accountability:  Be responsible for your success and failure. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground.
