Job Description  About the Department  Account Executives, Channel Account Managers, Business Development Representatives, Solution Engineers, Solution Specialists, Customer Success, and Sales Operations - all working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences. The sales team at Cloudflare helps customers solve real, technical problems while creating the revenue streams that help the company provide free service to millions in our community.  What you'll do  As a Secure Access Secure Edge (SASE) Specialist you will be responsible for driving opportunities and revenue from Cloudflare One (CF1), Cloudflare’s SASE offering, from prospects in ASEAN. In this role, you will serve as the “go-to” resource on SASE for customers and the account teams working with those customers. The ideal candidate will possess both a hunter mindset and technical background, to drive engagement with decision-makers and influencers within security, networking, IT and operations.  Responsibilities   Present to customers as an expert of our SASE platform with a focus on secure remote access, network security, zero trust network access and SDP solutions  Present a compelling business case at all levels in the customer hierarchy, from security professionals to CXOs planning to address transformational events such as cloud migration, remote worker shift, business continuity and the adoption of zero trust security architectures  Develop a sales plan that is based on regional planning and pipeline focusing on Cloudflare’s SASE platform - Cloudflare One  Foster growth and track the Cloudflare One sales pipeline by engaging with internal account teams, existing customers, net new prospects and key partners  Prepare and give regular business reviews to the management team highlighting attainment progress and challenges to closing business   The SASE Specialist Role is an overlay sales excellence role that directly supports sales delivery of carried quota. In order to be successful, you will need to become a thought leader, trusted advisor, and spokesperson for Cloudflare One - Cloudflare’s SASE platform.  Requirements   5+ years of experience selling or supporting the sales of cyber security, networking, identity management, cloud or SaaS solutions.  Experience building territory plans, prospecting and bringing in new logos in a competitive market.  Subject matter expert in areas such as enterprise networking, network security, IT security and zero trust network access (while not a technical solution engineering role, a background in and/or understanding of the technology underlying SASE is important).  Knowledge of key market players/competitors in the software defined networking, zero trust and cybersecurity solution spaces.  Demonstrated ability to think strategically and develop/execute corresponding objectives.  Strong verbal and written communications, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.  Excellent presentation and public speaking skills.  University Degree or equivalent  30 %- 40% travel when it is safe   What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released  1.1.1.1  to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our  privacy commitment  and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at  [email protected]  or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107. Job Description  Job Description  Working in cybersecurity takes passion for technology, speed, a desire to learn, and vigilance in order to keep every asset safe. You’ll be on the front lines of innovation, working with a highly motivated team focused on analyzing, designing, developing and delivering solutions built to stop adversaries and strengthen our operations. Your research and work will ensure stability, capacity and resiliency of our products. Working with your internal team, as well as technologists and innovators across our global network, your ability to identify threats, provide intelligent analysis and positive actions will stop crimes and strengthen our data.  As a member of the Attack Analysis team, you will fit into a global team providing 24/7 monitoring and Incident Response, acting as the frontline for attacks against the firms’ infrastructure. As a shift analyst, your role will include monitoring alerts triggered from in-house bespoke signatures in a SIEM, start to finish case investigation, threat hunting, file analysis, as well as getting involved in projects that aim to improve the capability of the team. You’ll have opportunities to attend training and conferences that benefit the skillset of the team and your own. You’ll be encouraged to conduct your own hunting investigations and create rule logic to fill the gaps in monitoring that you identify or alert on upcoming threats you think may be targeted at the firm. The work you’ll do is vital, as it will protect over $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits every day.  This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:   BS/BA degree or equivalent qualification  Minimum 2 years of technology experience  Good level of knowledge in network fundamentals, for example; OSI Stack, TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP(S), SMTP  Good level of understanding in the approach threat actors take to attacking a network; phishing, port scanning, web application attacks, DDoS, lateral movement  Good level of knowledge in Windows and/or Linux operating systems, how to investigate them for signs of compromise  Experience in log analysis and PCAP analysis  Good level of understanding of file analysis; extracting indicators, providing a report, implementing mitigations  Ability to demonstrate a structured, analytical approach to investigating alerts and/or indicators and documenting your findings in a manner that both peer and executive level colleagues can understand  Experience in collaboration with the wider roles of interconnecting Cyber Security teams (i.e. Forensics / Threat Intelligence / Penetration Testing / Vulnerability Management / “Purple Teaming” etc.)  Willing to work a shift pattern that includes weekend work   Highly Desired:   Basic understanding of Cloud architectures, how to secure these environments and how an adversary might attack these environments  Scripting knowledge (e.g., Python) including its application to cybersecurity use cases  Financial sector experience   About Us  J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.  About the Team  The Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm’s cybersecurity, access management, controls and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group’s number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable and resilient.  High Risk Roles (HRR) are sensitive roles within the technology organization that require high assurance of the integrity of staff by virtue of 1) sensitive cybersecurity and technology functions they perform within systems or 2) information they receive regarding sensitive cybersecurity or technology matters. Users in these roles are subject to enhanced pre-hire screening which includes both criminal and credit background checks (as allowed by law). The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment.    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_title: Cloud Architect (Financial Services) Senior Consultant, Technology Consulting
job_description: Job Description  At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.   We are the only professional services organization who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated advisory, assurance, tax, and transaction services   EY’s Performance Improvement Advisory professionals bring a wealth of experience in working with major financial institutions to align their operating model and infrastructure to their business’ strategic objectives. We assemble the right multi-disciplinary teams, use consistent and proven global methodologies and tools, and draw on the full breadth of EY’s global network, to deliver value and trusted advice to the clients. The key service offerings cover finance function transformation, customer and distribution effectiveness, operations, shared services / outsourcing support, performance management, program advisory, enterprise intelligence, risk management and regulatory change.   Your Key Responsibilities  You will enable, drive and lead initiatives focusing on establishing and embedding cloud architecture & design governance across the organization. Key functions include:   Lead initiatives for setting up cloud architecture & technology strategies, standards, governance and best practices for the whole organization.  Lead the initiatives to identify right set of cloud technologies to be used for specific type of solutions and drive the effort to templatize and automate those technologies to be used at scale in all products and applications across organization.  Architect & Design solutions for cloud (e.g. AWS, Azure) which are optimal, secure, efficient, scalable, resilient and reliable, and at the same time. are compliant with EY cloud standards and policies.  Architect & Design solutions for Hybrid cloud, which are multi-tenant and geo distributed and meet EY’s data protection standards.  Design strategies and tools to deploy, monitor, and administer Cloud applications and the underlying services for Cloud (e.g. Azure, AWS, private cloud)  Architect and implement DevSecOps processes and CI/CD pipelines using tools like VSTS, Jira, Ansible, Jenkins, Chef.  Collaborate with technology teams across EY Service Lines and vendor product teams helping them implement a productized strategy, consuming existing components while also greatly enhancing velocity of products through reuse.  Work with engineering teams for designing, building & productionizing components that will grow in capability while being multi-tenant, global, scalable & highly available.  Scout the technology landscape for emerging technologies, patterns and solutions that can benefit EY Technology & our customers (existing and new).  Build quick POCs and write some code for exploring new technology solutions.  Keep up to date with market trends and competitive insights. Evaluate technology and tools to enable the product ecosystem in E&Y.  Evaluate and enhance ROI through experiments and bets on technologies and components.   Skills and Attributes for Success   Deep understanding of cloud computing and data technologies, business drivers, emerging computing trends, and deployment options (preferably in Microsoft Azure and AWS).  Expert in defining, designing and developing distributed and scalable products and services, including reusable domain-specific microservices on multi-platform/hybrid clouds (such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Rackspace, VMware, or OpenStack).  Deep understanding of Application, Infrastructure and security architecture and non-functional aspects like Performance, Scalability, Reliability, Availability etc.  Deep experience in IAAS (with good fundamentals in network and security) as well as PAAS. Good understanding of all Azure services and ability to choose the right service for a workload among multiple Azure services preferred.  Strategic business acumen and understanding of organizational strategy and ability to design information systems to deliver that strategy.Strong expertise in DevOps, Agile methodologies, containers, CI/CD and tools like VSTS, Jira.  Experience with software and product development lifecycle (incl. coding, coding standards and reviews, source control, testing, debugging, build, deployment and operations).  Strong understanding of one or more development platform .Net technologies (C#), Java / JavaScript.  Familiarity in the following areas, but not limited to:  Front end / UI technologies including frameworks such as React/Angular.js  REST / Webservices (with high performance, multi-tenancy, global, scalable elements)  SQL, XML, JSON, Linux, ELK stack, Splunk, Solr, GIT, Ant/Maven, Jenkins  Familiarity with Data Ingestion, Analytics, AI technologies   To Qualify for the role, you must have   At least 3 years of deep technology experience at very large enterprises or web scale product companies.  At least a year of architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications (i.e. having an architectural sense for ensuring availability, reliability, etc.) on cloud.  Experience in consulting preferred.  Experience in presenting ideas, papers, patents to varied audiences.  Certificates requirements: Microsoft Azure related certifications, Other cloud providers like AWS and Google Cloud are accepted   Ideally, you’ll also have   Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities   Demonstrate strong analytical and technical problem-solving skills by leveraging the latest trends in technologies such as cloud, AI, and big data.  Handle ambiguity and able to move forward with imperfect information and get things done in a rapidly changing environment.  Must be comfortable working in an environment where ideas are challenged.  Should possess good product instinct and excellent project management skills to push projects over the finish line with sound planning and persistent execution.  Astute in aligning effort & resources to achieve desired results.   What we look for  Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What we offer   Continuous learning:  You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.  Success as defined by you:  We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way  Transformative leadership:  We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.  Diverse and inclusive culture:  You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.   If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.  Apply now. Job Description  YouTrip is Southeast Asia’s 1st and leading multi-currency wallet. As a regional financial technology startup, YouTrip is dedicated to creating the best mobile financial services by simplifying foreign currency payments and offering the best exchange rates. Launched in 2018, YouTrip has been voted the #1 multi-currency account in Singapore with the largest user base in the region following its successful launch in Thailand in partnership with Karsikornbank in 2019.   YouTrip is a Major Payment Institution licensed under the Monetary Authority of Singapore and awarded the Top FinTech Leaders 2020 by the Singapore FinTech Association, and ASEAN’s Best Fintech Startup 2019 by the Rice Bowl Startup Awards.   Our culture is entrepreneurial, open & inclusive, and teamwork-oriented. We are looking for talents with the aspiration to thrive in a rapidly growing business in the exciting FinTech space. Manage the group audit process, cashflow, statutory and tax filings. Lead the growing team and process improvement projects to streamline workflows and identify key cost drivers to ensure operational efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Highly self-motivated, adaptable, and responsible.  Detailed-oriented, proven ability to work independently and lead the team under pressure. Job Description  To give people the power to build community on our platforms, we need to make sure they have the best and most secure experiences possible. People on the BI Business Reporting and Analytics team empower Facebook’s Business Integrity Operations organization to be self-sufficient in tactical decision-making and drive operations strategy through objective analysis. Our key partners are GO Central Analytics, problem owners and teams within BI, and Data Engineering/Data Science on the Product side. We are responsible for providing accurate, reliable and accessible business metrics as well as contextualizing them in operational performance with research and advanced analysis.  We are looking for Analysts who share our passion for helping make Facebook a safe place for people and businesses to connect across the world. The right candidate will be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, excited to collaborate and focused on positively impacting the experience of a large scale global workforce and the entire Facebook Community. They possess strong quantitative analytical skills, statistical knowledge, data visualization skills, and the ability to build strong partnerships to drive impact across the organization.  RESPONSIBILITIES   Apply quantitative skills to and incorporate qualitative insights to inform and influence strategy for Global Operations  Partner with Operations, Data Science, Data Engineering, Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities  Analyze data, conduct research and synthesize feedback into plans, processes and playbooks  Build/maintain data infrastructure (data pipelines, aggregated data sets, reports, dashboards) to monitor the performance of our operations and drive business understanding.  Drive broad adoption and alignment of the team’s initiatives through strong XFN collaboration and understanding of the organization’s strategic data infra and analysis needs.   MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS   B.A. or B.S. degree with a quantitative focus in Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, Operations Research, or equivalent training  Proficiency in querying and manipulating complex raw datasets for analysis using SQL, Python, or R, exposure to ETL  2+ years of experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker)  Experience with statistical analysis (e.g., hypothesis testing, probability, prevalence measurement, regressions, experimentation logic and biases, data modeling techniques, time series analysis)  Experience explaining technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to varied audiences and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses   PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS   Advanced degree with a quantitative focus (Economics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Math, Statistics)  Experience thinking strategically, structurally solving product problems, and driving execution  Experience with distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)  Experience developing data pipelines via SQL and Python-based ETL framework  Experience releasing code into production  Experience writing testable code     Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  We're looking for operations engineers!  We’re looking for passionate engineers that are keen for an opportunity to operate a worldwide deployment of systems and servers that support all products and services we offer! You’ll be working in a growing operational environment where we face and solve unique challenges that we’re confident you won’t face in most other industries. From getting the latest streaming service working to ensuring our customers are being geo-located properly, and everything in between, your days will be filled with exciting puzzles looking for special solutions.  We’re looking for people with experience with  network and border routing protocols, packet/flow analysis, Linux systems administration , and  data center engineering . If solving interesting problems and improving our users’ experience through solid operations sounds like a perfect fit, then drop us a line and come join us!  Staff Datacenter Engineer  Responsibilities  As a Staff Datacenter Engineer in our Operations Engineering team, you will be responsible for:   Providing escalations support to our operations service desk for issues they have trouble solving independently  Providing engineering support such as advice, technical reviews, architecture analysis, and more to other operational teams  Being the resident expert in one or more core service provided in order to provide in-depth analysis, escalation support, and insights into service operations and issues  Being the conduit for requirements for new operational tooling from other operational teams and translating those requirements into technical requirements our development teams can understand/execute on  Analyzing and troubleshooting various problems operating surrounding operations, such as streaming issues, content unblocking, speed and quality issues, and more  Having an in-depth understanding of the operational technologies and metrics that help us measure quality, speed, user experience, and more, and making solid recommendations when we’re missing those metics  Creating or proposing systems, tools, and scripts that give operations greater control to adjust operational settings and configurations to improve our customer experience  Understanding, analyzing, and explaining the way data flows through our operational systems from customer to destination  Building and maintaining a solid monitoring capability for operational metrics and alerting  Leading project teams to execute specific operational changes or deployments  Mentoring and coaching junior engineers and engineers/analysts from other operational departments  Writing and driving OKRs that improve the capabilities of our operational systems and control  Generating presentations and reports that provide valuable insights to the rest of the business   To succeed in this role, you should have experience in your area of specialization in Datacenter Engineering, such as:   Advanced level knowledge:  ISPs and datacenter Internet connectivity  ISP peering, especially between data centers  Datacenter networks and technologies  Physical connectivity/architectures for servers and switches  Managing server events and alerts including ensuring that agents and services in the servers are running properly.  Top of rack switching  Datacenter interconnections  Architecting data center designs/rack layouts  Troubleshooting  Escalation Engineering  Monitoring/Analysis tools  Creating/Documenting IT Architectures  Systems Architectures and Design  Creating dashboard using time-series-databases  Responding to incident    Ability to explain issues and technologies  Good verbal communications in English  Good writing/documentation skills in English   Additional experience in any of these areas will also be useful:   Experience with VPNs, streaming services, anonymous proxies, or similar technologies  Python or similar scripting language  Grafana, Influxdb, and related technologies  IPs and geo-location knowledge  SQL and other queries  Defining requirements and use-cases  Certifications in your specialization   What We Offer   Challenging work in a fun and collaborative environment  Attractive compensation and time-off benefits  Spacious open-concept and centrally located offices  Full-time employment with flexible working hours  Fully stocked pantry with fresh fruit and snacks  Team lunches and company events every quarter  Multicultural teams represented by 30+ nationalities   Note: Please upload your resume as a PDF and do not include any salary or compensation information in it. Job Description  We're looking for operations test engineers!  Do you love tinkering and testing things out to see how they really work? Are you fascinated by technology and trying to figure out how it behaves in different scenarios? We’re looking for a  Staff TechOps Test Engineer  to help us test our service quality, performance, and availability to ensure our customers are getting the best experience possible. Our customers use our product to watch content online, avoid censors, and enhance their privacy. You’ll help ensure that the service is working at peak performance by emulating and recreating environments and scenarios with potential issues reported to us by our other operations and support teams. You’ll also ensure our product remains competitive by evaluating us against our competitors. If that sounds exciting to you, check us out and apply today!  Staff TechOps Test Engineer  Responsibilities  As a Staff TechOps Test Engineer in our Operations Test & Evaluation team, you will be responsible for:   Being the go-to expert for creating and operating our testing infrastructure, methods, and tooling  Creating, documenting, and socializing processes, procedures, and standards for testing and related activities  Executing tests to determine the effectiveness and performance of operational capabilities that have been delivered to production for services such as streaming, VPN privacy, VPN speed, geo-unblocking, and more  Scoping and defining the questions to be answered through testing and evaluations with the operation owner  Conducting competitive analysis and testing to determine the quality and performance of our services compared to our competitors  Operating testing suites and tooling that delivers repeatable results and tuning those tools to ensure high-quality output and results  Taking input from other operational teams that discover service anomalies and issues, then recreating those customer environments to test our services in support of root cause analysis or fix validation  Working with development teams to validate engineering hypotheses and support engineering tests  Analyzing test results and providing accurate and insightful analysis and reporting on the results  Designing test strategies and methodologies that provide insightful results for the questions we’re trying to answer  Finding repeatable tasks related to testing, and proposing or creating automation so we don’t have to manually background in one or more of the following areas:  IT Systems Administration  Linux Administration/Operations  Network administration/Engineering  Quality Assurance    Advanced to Expert-level Job Description  We're looking for a Lead for our Ops Test Engineering team!  We’re forming a talented team of network test engineers to test our services in production environments and help us track down production bugs and anomalies. Are you ready to build and lead that team?  Unlike running a service in a controlled enterprise environment, our service runs on the wide open Internet, or on customer devices that we don’t control. That creates the potential for many variances in the way our customers experience our service, both good and bad. Your job will be to develop ways that we can  detect, test, analyze, and pinpoint potential production issues  with the quality and effectiveness of our service.  Your team will take information from many sources, use that data to pinpoint possible problems, and hunt for ways to isolate and reproduce those bugs. Our service is multi-faceted and complex, which makes this an opportunity to constantly work on evolving technologies and interesting problems. If that sounds cool, don’t wait— apply today!  Operations Test & Evaluation Lead  Responsibilities  As a Lead of our Operations Test & Evaluation team, you will be responsible for:   Managing a group of 4-6 test engineers with backgrounds in networking, linux, and quality assurance engineering. You’ll be accountable for their velocity and quality, and will provide valuable management and mentoring.  Supporting your team in providing test engineering services such as determining the effectiveness and performance of operational capabilities that have been delivered to production for services such as streaming, VPN privacy, VPN speed, geo-unblocking, and more.  Leading project teams to execute specific tests related to operational changes or deployments.  Generating presentations and reports that provide valuable insights to the rest of the business.  Mentoring, teaching, and coaching test engineers on your team to ensure they have the right tools and knowledge.  Being the resident expert for creating and operating our testing infrastructure, methods, and tooling.  Advocating and offering test engineering services to internal customers—like development teams—to validate their engineering hypotheses and support engineering tests.  Scoping and defining the questions to be answered through testing and evaluations with the operation owner.  Operating testing suites and tooling that delivers repeatable results and tuning those tools to ensure high-quality output and results.  Seeking input from other operational teams that discover service anomalies and issues, then support recreating those customer environments to recreate or test our services in support of root cause analysis or fix validation.  Designing test strategies and methodologies that provide insightful results for the questions we’re trying to answer.   To succeed in this role, we’d love for you to have experience in some or all of the following:   You’ve managed a team of at least two to three people with a responsibility for things like performance reviews, 1:1s, mentoring, career plans, etc.  A technical background in one or more of the following areas:  IT Systems Administration  Linux Administration/Operations  Network administration/Engineering  Quality Assurance    Advanced-to-Expert-level knowledge of:  Testing methodologies & processes  Analyzing test results and providing insights  Reporting and data organization  TCP/IP  OSI model  Network/System protocols  Desktops/Endpoint computing    An understanding of data flows and technical process touchpoints  Understanding how data flows through various systems such as networking equipment, servers, etc  An aptitude for metrics and reports  Strong analytical skills  Documenting processes and following procedures  Good verbal communication in English  Strong English writing/documentation skills   Any additional experience in one of these areas will be useful   Experience with VPNs, streaming services, anonymous proxies, or similar technologies  Python or similar scripting language  IPs and geo-location knowledge   What We Offer   Full-time employment with flexible working hours  Challenging work in a fun and collaborative environment  Attractive compensation and time-off benefits  Spacious open-concept and centrally located offices  Fully stocked pantry with fresh fruit and snacks  Team lunches and company events every quarter  Multicultural teams represented by 30+ nationalities   Note: Please upload your resume as a PDF and do not include any salary or compensation information in it.    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Role Profile   LSEG Security Operations is a central function employing people, process and technology to continuously monitor and respond to cyber security incidents. Security Operations spans multiple domains including cyber threat intelligence, cyber threat detection, data loss prevention and cyber incident response.   This role is responsible for research, design and implementation of SIEM detection rules, and supporting log transportation infrastructure.   Responsibilities  • Support and maintain the SIEM, data analytics and supporting logging infrastructure. • Build and enhance the detection capabilities of Security Operations through the design, implementation and ongoing tuning of detection rules within the SIEM (e.g. Splunk/QRadar/LogRhythm). • Leverage knowledge of cyber threat TTPs to inform the design of detection rules. • Design, build and maintain Cyber Threat Detection tooling. • Train and support junior members of the Cyber Threat Detection team. • Manage the intake of log sources into the SIEM and data analytics solutions. • Use online resources for researching and collecting threat intelligence to enhance the SOC’s abilities to detect cyber-attacks. • Creates and maintains operational documentation to support the SIEM and data analytics platforms. • Provide technical, hands-on incident support to the GSOC. • Build and maintain dashboards and reporting to demonstrate platform performance. • Support SIEM and data analytics operation from use case engineering through to log source management. • Produce dashboards and reports that demonstrate SIEM/data analytics platform health, performance and future capacity requirements.   Experience  • Experience with administration of a SIEM (e.g. Splunk/QRadar/LogRhythm). • Knowledge of common logging formats and methods of transporting logs across a network. • Experience managing logging infrastructure from operating systems through to application. • Knowledge of cloud technologies including AWS and Azure. • Strong working knowledge of networks including the TCP/IP stack, typical organisation architectures, and common protocols abused by malware. • Knowledge of information security protection, detection and authentication systems (firewalls, IDS, IPS, Anti-Virus, Active Directory etc). • Understanding of tools, techniques and procedures that attackers use to compromise organisations, ideally from direct experience. • Experience with one or more programming or scripting languages such as Java, C#, Python, PowerShell, C, C++. • Ability to build relationships and communicate across all levels within an organisation. • Ability to work with a sense of urgency while remaining calm under pressure. • Strong verbal and written communication and collaboration skills. • Adapts messaging and presentation styles to the needs of a different audiences. Job Description  Allen & Overy   Allen & Overy is a leading global law firm operating in over thirty countries. Embracing new trends and harnessing decades of experience, we’ve earned our place at the forefront of the legal industry. Our partners are recognised as leaders in their field and our deals and cases often make headline business news. As a result, we’ve developed a reputation for delivering excellence, in all that we do. Today, we’re continuing to break new ground. By embracing new ways of thinking and integrating technology into our everyday work, we’ve been named as the Most Innovative Law Firm in Europe by the Financial Times five times.  Join our team and you’ll be part of a flexible, inclusive culture underpinned by openness and acceptance. We’re driven by the belief that, to perform, people need support and space to collaborate. By combining those values with an ambitious outlook, we can give you the opportunity to thrive.   Department purpose   This role sits within the Global Information Security team within Allen & Overy. Information Security is charged with the ongoing protection of the valuable information the firm holds and processes. This includes responsibility for cyber security, the protection of digital services and support to various internal stakeholders requiring information to manage our client relationship.   Role purpose  The key purpose of the InfoSec Compliance Specialist role is to support the client engagement and compliance teams who require detailed information relating to the firm’s policies and processes that secure our client data. This role provides a link between client engagement and compliance and the IT function.   Many of the key clients of the firm regularly seek assurance from Allen & Overy regarding the controls in place to protect and secure their information. This role includes responsibility for the following:   Timely completion of client compliance questionnaires relating to information security  Information security aspects of client and regulatory (i.e., annual external) audits  Collation of evidence to support on-site audits  Ensuring all client facing information security documentation is accurate and up-to-date  Drafting of new policies and/or amendments to existing policies  Working with technical specialists in IT to develop responses and solutions to new questions  Review of client terms of engagement and/or outside counsel guidelines  Provision of information to support panel reviews and pitches  Maintaining the Information Security Audit Remediation Tracker  Provision of advice to internal stakeholders on client engagement terms and/or outside counsel guidelines  Supporting senior members of the information security team with remediation work  Supporting external security certification and surveillance audits including ISO27001:2013  Supporting the review of suppliers and 3rd parties in relation to their information security controls  Supporting senior members of the information security team with ad-hoc project work   Key Relationships   Client engagement and audit teams.  Members of the Information Security team.  In-house legal team.  Business acceptance team.  Other IT functions as required (for example networks team, email team).  Client Relationship managers.  Business Development managers.  Client Relationship partners.  Panel managers.  Pitch and proposal managers  External auditors.  Suppliers who handle/process A&O data.  Other functional experts across A&O.   Key Requirements   Articulate / fluent written / spoken English.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate technical issues in a clear and simple manner.  Comfortable dealing with different levels of seniority across the firm and its clients.  Capable of reviewing large volumes of data in order to pick out the salient points and identify issues.  Ability to multi-task and juggle changing priorities.  Ability to manage conflicting priorities.  Comfortable dealing with ambiguity.  Familiarity with the ISO27001 Standard and industry best-practice security controls.  High levels of accuracy and attention to detail.  Commercially minded.  5+ years’ experience working in Information Security/ IT Audit roles.  At least 1 year’s experience in a similar role.  Willingness to travel (especially to London).   Desirable Qualifications   Computer Science degree, CISSP / CISA desired but not essential.  Previous experience of legal or professional services. job_description: Job Description  Job Purpose:  Primary responsibility for this role is to project manage the deliverables of RMO for the contract workstream for GCB Divestiture and support the review of existing contracts across APAC and EMEA to identify and document a range of specific contract terms/clauses as well as compliance to regulations. This role will support the subsequent actual contract work required to support the transfer of business for the divestiture.   Job Background:  To support global review of contracts in-scope for businesses/operations/systems impacted by divestiture of Global Consumer Banking in APAC/EMEA. This role will review our existing contracts to identify and document a range of specific contract terms/clauses as well as compliance to regulations. This role will support the subsequent actual contract work required to support the transfer of business for the divestiture such as obtaining supplier consent letter and executing contract amendment, termination, novation and Transition Service Agreement, etc. This role will also support the Sourcing Leads in the increased BAU sourcing activities where review, re-negotiation or bidding and entering of new or amendment of contracts are required for the continuity of other operations using the contracts.   Key Responsibilities:  • Project manager the RMO Contract Workstream supporting GCB Divestiture. Responsible for tracking and consolidating entries/updates of contract information and status from various contributors across APAC and EMEA. Create reporting and presentation where required.  • Perform contract review to identify specific contract terms/clauses as well as compliance to regulations and maintain the contract database.  • Work with country sourcing team across APAC/EMEA to identify in-country compliance and regulatory requirements for the contract work required.  • Draft and/or complete contract template and negotiate the contract terms/clauses for new and/or amendment of contracts and other legal documents such as Supplier Consent Letter, Termination Letter, Transition Service Agreement etc.  • Work with various business stakeholders to identify, jointly develop sourcing strategies and drive initiatives to bid or re-negotiation deals/contracts to support their overall business objectives including mitigating impact of GCB divestiture, cost reduction, supplier consolidation, service delivery standardization/improvements, process efficiencies, risk mitigation and compliance to regulations and company policies and requirements.  Knowledge/Experience:  • Experience in sourcing, project management with a large, multi-national organization, preferably financial institution.  • Experience in sourcing of banking products and services including outsourcing and offshoring services. Experience in sourcing of technology related categories is a plus.  • Experience with negotiation of commercial and legal terms and conditions and execution of legal/contractual documentation.  • High commercial awareness with track record in negotiation/execution of deals with significant achievements.  • Experience in working with remote partners and leading cross functional teams in complex activities that across departmental, geographic and business entities.  Skills: (technical skills)   • Experience with computer skills with a focus on Microsoft Word and Excel  • Experience with procurement tools/applications (Oracle, SAP, GEP is a plus)  Qualifications: (degree/certifications)  • Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent certification.  • Certified Procurement Professional such as CPM or CIPS is a plus.  • Para-legal certification is a plus.  • At least 10 - 15 years of sourcing and category management experience.  Competencies:  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Able to interact confidently with all levels of Management.  • Self-motivated, takes initiative and has the ability to effectively organize, multi-task and prioritize a wide array of initiatives.  • Strong business writing and analytical/reporting skills.  • Take ownership and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Job Description  Agile Coach / Scrum Master    Job Summary:   A key component within the Project Management Office (PMO) team, the candidate would be tasked to transform the teams to adopt Agile practices and to improve SPHTech’s Agile maturity.  A team player who can guide, lead and influence the teams to understand the Agile concepts and ease the transformation of the team’s practices.   Job Description:   Guide, coach and lead the product, technical and business teams with the goal of adopting Agile (Scrum and Kanban) practices in their daily work, assessing team agile maturity and coaching teams toward higher agile maturity that is sustainable and comfortable for the team and organisation.  Co-Creating and working alongside teams in experiments, feedback collection, and eventually adoptions of new practices to create a Learning Environment.  An active participant in the implementation of Agile based Framework with a goal of moving the team forward in the Agile journey.  Collaborate with senior business stakeholders and technology heads to define the transformation strategy and roadmap to improve the way we design, develop and implement solutions for our customers;  Support SPHTech digital transformation journey which will cover aspects of Agile software delivery: team & workforce strategy, culture, planning, design, implementation, refactoring, testing, automation, cloud services, integration, release, governance, monitoring and troubleshooting;  Support the business in developing, driving and aligning an integrated business and technology strategy to transition into agile;  Facilitate communication(retrospectives, refinement sessions, discussion, decision making and conflicts resolution) and foster effective communication among the scrum masters, product owners, and team leaders;  Facilitate brainstorm session for new product development by adopting design thinking methodology;  Work with various leadership teams to adopt consistent and disciplined Agile delivery and BAU capabilities;  Develop Agile Methodology and Dashboard and align to the broader SPH Project Management framework  Coach development team in self-organisation  Conduct Agile Process and Tools Training to Business and Tech teams   Job requirements:   Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems.  Certified Scrum Master or Agile Coach.  Minimum 4-5 years of experience as Scrum Master or Product Owner or in a similar role. Experience in the Media industry would be useful.  Deep understanding of a variety of agile methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, Scrumban, etc.) and practices.  Past experience with scaling agile will be useful.  Strong knowledge and hands-on experience on Agile project Management tools (JIRA/Confluence).  Hands-on experience in designing user stories, CI/CD, BDD & Test Automation is a plus.  Ability to effectively manage key stakeholders.  Good understanding of user experience and design thinking methodology and experience working with teams through the process of investigation, ideation and implementation;  Excellent communication, leadership, and people development skills. Strong sense of accountability.  Able to communicate well with all levels of the organization from Scrum team members to executives.  Able to facilitate, lead and demonstrate value-add principles to a team.  Must have an attitude of empowerment to be able to lead a team to self-organization.  Must be a quick learner, able to quickly gain a high level understanding of the technical and business domains.  Desired Agile Certifications: Certified Scrum Master (CSM), Certified Scrum Professional (CSP) or Certified Product Owner (CSO); PMI-ACP, ICP-ACC, SAFe-SPC, LeSS Practitioner. Job Description  Serving tens of millions of customers each year, Changi Airport Group (CAG) aims to create memorable experiences for our all customers. Whether it is growing Singapore’s air connectivity to the world, enhancing experience at the various touchpoints, or curating personalised retail offerings, we are continually striving to better serve everyone who uses Changi Airport. The talent and commitment of our people makes the dreams that we are chasing a reality.  We are looking for a strong Digital Tech Lead with a proven track record in championing and spearheading digital transformation. Working closely with our senior management, you will formulate, drive and execute digital strategies that will drive revenue, deepen our customer engagement, optimise operations and create new business value through the smart use of modern technologies such as cloud, mobile and big data as well as the internet of things, augmented and virtual reality, and Artificial Intelligence.  As the digital tech leader, you will have the skills to influence at every level, imparting your digital knowledge and skills in a constructive, empowering, and collaborative way. With a strong customer-centric mindset and drive for innovation and transformation, you should have the ability to harness current capabilities and play a formative role as well as shape the digital future for CAG.   Responsibilities  · As a Digital Lead and Champion within CAG, you will:  o Embrace innovation, and identify new and emerging technologies that can support CAG’s vision to deepen engagement and service offerings to our customers.  o Provide strategic counsel and enterprise-wide direction on the use of digital technologies.  o Develop and execute a clearly-defined and compelling digital strategy for CAG. This includes defining a product road map, technology stack, digital and technology strategy and operating plan to support the organisation’s strategic focus and business needs.  o Drive and manage the planning and implementation of enterprise technology solutions and define the digital architecture for various digital initiatives to improve cost effectiveness, customer experience, operations and business development.  o Lead the adoption of a flexible architecture and platform, allowing the organisation to seamlessly add and integrate new digital and technical capabilities, improve the product development process and significantly grow volumes.  o Oversee and manage strategic relationships between internal digital resources and external stakeholders, including government, vendors, and partner organisations.  · Internal Engagement: As an Enterprise leader within CAG, you will:  o Work closely with internal stakeholders to build and shape a digital and agile culture in CAG.  o Partner business teams to manage, streamline and optimise the development of digital products and services.  o Work closely with Corporate IT to build and scale back-end services  · Collaborate with People Team to develop and retain digital talents, and to build digital capabilities across the organisation. Responsible for hiring, mentoring and development of CAG’s team of engineers/tech developers to grow a high-performance engineering team.  · As a leader of a team of engineers/tech developers, you will:  o Participate in the complete software engineering cycle - Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software  o Engage in technical design - Build reusable codes/ frameworks that are efficient, scalable, and stable  o Create technical documentation and validate code that enables customer and business goals - Evaluate and optimize code to maximize performance  Requirements  · Extensive experience in:  o A senior position to lead successful digital transformation projects and to drive new product, digital and ecommerce initiatives.  o Guiding a team of software engineers / tech developers to deploy large systems software design and web development.  o Building digital capabilities across the organisation and in developing and retaining digital talents.  · A Master’s Degree/Bachelor in the field of Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or any related field.  · More than 10 years of experience in large systems software design and web development. With at least 5 years Java/Scala experience or a polyglot engineer (Java, Scala, Python etc).  · Deep understanding of mobile, web & cloud technology stacks (TCP/IP, HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, JSON, XML, Restful API).  · Good knowledge of Amazon Serverless architecture and microservices architecture and optimization.  · Experienced in using AWS Services (i.e., EC2 instances, S3, ElasticCache, PostgresQL, Redshift) and Cloud, preferably AWS certified.  · Experienced in working with the Adobe suite of products (Adobe Analytics, Target, Audience Manager).  · Experienced in deploying software / applications using DevOps tools (e.g Confluence, Jenkins, Nexus IQ, BitBucket) and processes.  · A strong Product Development/Software Engineering background with work experience in the below areas is preferred:  o Extensive product management experience  o Experience in Omnichannel platforms and strategies, strong experience in mobile apps as well as web platforms  o Strong customer experience and UI/UX experience  o Ecommerce systems and solutions  o A strong understanding of payment gateways  o Rewards & Loyalty Programmes  · Possess an innovative and disruptive mindset, constantly looking forward and willing to experiment with new technologies and ideas in the digital space.  · Deep expertise in agile methodologies engaging and managing stakeholders.  · Detail-oriented and thrives working in a fast-paced environment.  · Passionate about learning new techniques and to mentor other team members. Job Description  We're looking for a Lead for our Ops Infrastructure Team!  We operate thousands of servers in 160 VPN locations in 94 countries; can you help us grow that number? We’re looking for an experienced infrastructure professional to not only build, grow, and train a team of capacity planners, vendor managers, and pricing specialists, but also develop a vision for the next version of our infrastructure in order to deliver an even faster and more reliable experience to our global customers.  You’ll work on global deals to secure bandwidth allocations, plan tech refreshes across the world, and provide infrastructure as a service to our internal customers spanning a wide range of infrastructure resources. If you’re a people manager and get excited by things like 10Gbps NICs, peering links, subsea cables, and IXPs, then we’ve got just the role for you!  Operations Infrastructure Lead  Responsibilities  As a Lead of our Operations Infrastructure team, you will be responsible for:   Managing, hiring and growing a group of 4-6 infrastructure specialists covering areas such as capacity planning, pricing management and data center/vendor management. You’ll be accountable for our spend on infrastructure and providing them with valuable management and mentoring.  Supporting your team in providing infrastructure as a service to internal customers by giving advice, delivering technical reviews, elaborating negotiations strategies, and more.  Leading project teams to execute specific operational changes and deployments.  Writing and driving OKRs that improve our infrastructure capabilities, reliability, and optimize our spend.  Generating presentations and reports that provide valuable insights to the rest of the business.  Mentoring and coaching infrastructure specialists to ensure they have the knowledge and tools to be successful.  Being the resident expert in one or more areas related to infrastructure in order to provide in-depth analysis, escalation support, and insights into infrastructure operations and issues.  Ensuring that we maintain optimum capacity levels to operate our services, and planning/executing to meet those requirements.  Managing and negotiating contracts with providers of data centers, hardware, IP addresses, ISP connections, peering links, payment gateways, and more.  Leveraging our purchasing power and economies of scale to get the best possible prices and drive down the total cost of ownership and operational costs.  Defining quality for all types of providers, evaluating providers against our definitions, and selecting the best providers that meet our standards.  Staying within acceptable risk levels as defined in our datacenter, infrastructure provider, and server security risk categorization system.  Being aware of and documenting the market players, pricing, and influences to ensure our services remain competitive with the best mix of quality and cost.  Managing positive and healthy vendor relationships to ensure vendors have a positive partnering experience.  Planning our annual spend by creating logical and realistic budgets based on capacity predictions and usage forecasts.   To succeed in this role, we’d love for you to have experience in some or all of the following:   You’ve managed a team of at least two to three people, with responsibility for things like performance reviews, 1:1s, mentoring, career plans, etc.  A background in one or more of the following areas:  Data center management, capacity planning, or capacity engineering  IT purchasing, contracts management, or similar    Advanced-to-Expert-level knowledge in:  Procurement of technical services and hardware  Contract negotiation  Vendor management  Planning, scheduling, and coordinating hardware upgrades, rollouts, and replacements  Data manipulation and basic data analysis  Project management    Background in or knowledge of the datacenter industry, especially when it comes to colocation and hardware leasing.  Experience with procurement of services like ISPs, ISP peering, bandwidth, AWS instances, payment gateways, and IP addresses.  An understanding of financial modelling, predictions, and similar methodologies  Good verbal communication in English  Solid English writing/documentation skills   Any additional experience in one of these areas will be useful   Financial modelling basics  Quantitative analysis  Qualitative analysis  Data center networking basics  ISP Peering Marketplace knowledge  IPs and geo-location knowledge   What We Offer   Full-time employment with flexible working hours  Challenging work in a fun and collaborative environment  Attractive compensation and time-off benefits  Spacious open-concept and centrally located offices  Fully stocked pantry with fresh fruit and snacks  Team lunches and company events every quarter  Multicultural teams represented by 30+ nationalities   Note: Please upload your resume as a PDF and do not include any salary or compensation information in it. Job Description   COMPANY DESCRIPTION   NE Digital is the digital, data and technology organization that serve as a center of excellence to drive digital transformation for our group of NTUC Social Enterprises to meet the critical social needs of Singapore's community. Delivering innovative products and solutions, we empower our people to lead a better and meaningful life through digital services in the area of daily essentials, health and community care, childcare and education as well as financial services.     The Team  We believe that diversity is key to driving an innovative, cohesive, productive and fun workplace! Hence, at NE Digital our people join us from all around the world. Be sure to be soaked in an environment with different ethnic groups driving innovation and injecting some creative juice as one!    Contributing to a social purpose through technology, our team of passionate and dedicated folks are spread into different social enterprises such as NTUC Fairprice Group, NTUC First Campus, NTUC Health and among others!   Creating technologies that impacts!      RESPONSIBILITIES   NTUC Enterprise (NE) Digital is currently hiring an Product Manager to join  the Digital Business of FairPrice Group.  At FairPrice, we are continuously improving the way people buy their groceries online. As a Product Manager under the Orders Fulfillment & Logistics team (a.k.a OMS team), you will bring your expertise and knowledge to help build and support the order fulfilment flow for our online groceries platform.  You will be reporting to the Product Lead of OMS. Your main goal is to be  able to manage different stakeholders from numerous backgrounds in order to build product solutions that focus on delivering best end user experience, optimised business results and high operational efficiency. You will be working  under a fast paced environment with agile development methodologies and there is no doubt that you will wear many hats!  Duties and Responsibilities  Work with different business and operational teams to understand requirement and write Product Requirements Documents (PRD)  Partner with our design & engineering team to understand possibilities,  technical feasibility and complexity to propose optimised solutions  Writing respective Jira tickets and follow up with engineers during the process of implementation, quality assurance and launching  Embark on data-driven approach of monitoring product performance by partnering with Data Engineering & Data Analytics team to build dashboard for key metrics  Contribute to the development of Product Management best practices; assist roadmap prioritization and project management process improvements   QUALIFICATIONS  1+ years experience in Product Management or in other position with transferable skills  Strong analytical acumen (i.e. ability to collect information  to make the right decisions at the right time)  Experience in engineering skills such as SQL or other programming languages is definitely a plus  Demonstrated experience working with diverse teams & managing  different stakeholders  Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - NE Digital    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Job Title: Solution Architect, 5G Enterprise Incubation  Job Description  We are looking for a Solution Architect for the Enterprise Business Group (EBG) to join the EBG 5G Enterprise & Collaboration product group to enable product incubation and help onboard new clients. The Solution Architect is the customer facing as part of our product development. He/she understands the business and technology goals of our customers and their desired outcomes, and supports GTM, Sales and implementations.  This is a great opportunity to join our mission to build new offerings on top of our world-class; secure and resilient 5G infrastructure that will accelerate customer transformation and be the backbone of Singapore’s digital economy. If what we do excites you, join us.  Main responsibilities   Work with customers to discover new, innovative ways to solve problems and deliver better customer outcomes.  Work alongside the Product Lead to come up with product ideas based on customer research and user needs.  Create the technology vision and roadmap to bring an idea from concept to product to market.  Assess and select the technology which achieves the customer’s outcome and solves the business need.  Design and document the product solution construct to make integration, implementation, and delivery easier.  Describe and iterate on the solution, characteristics, behaviour, and other aspects with engineers and developers.  Produce high-level product, functional and non-functional (e.g., reliability, scalability) requirements.  Conduct discovery, design and solutioning sessions with customers; conduct PoC and assessments.  Work with the lead 5G Solution & Delivery Architect & 5G Specialized Sales on customer pre-sale engagements.  Oversee and whenever needed support the delivery of the initial customer product implementations after launch.  Provide product technical training to pre-sales, implementation and operational teams as required.  Setup and maintain lab/demo environments; create demos for relevant use-cases in our 5G customer showcase.  Own the outcome. Drive product development to reach business outcomes and ambitious growth goals, including early sales success and successful initial customer implementations.   A few things about you   Can quickly identify problems, bottlenecks, and technical needs, and explain your rationale with examples.  Experience with interpreting requirements and developing a technology vision/solution framework.  Ability to bridge complex ideas and technology into simple concepts.  Independently and successfully managed customer projects, from pre-sales to implementation.  High degree of self-initiative, along with a "roll-up-your-sleeves can-do" attitude.   Qualifications   5-7 years of experience as technical presales or delivery architect, preferably at an SI, Consultant or Telco.  Experience in one of these fields: collaboration, robotics, machine vision, ML/AI, health tech, cybersecurity.  A working-level understanding of mobile (e.g., 5G, 4G/LTE) Enterprise solutions will be a plus.  An understanding of Agile principles and practices or a product development background will be a plus.  Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related fields.   *We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Job Description  Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.   We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with ByteDance.   Application deadline: November 30th, 2021   Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is firm and includes all TikTok/ByteDance jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.    About the eCommerce team   The e-commerce industry has seen tremendous growth in recent years and has become a hotly contested space amongst leading Internet companies, and its future growth cannot be underestimated.   With millions of loyal users globally, we are an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better e-commerce experience to our users. Our product engineering team is responsible for building an e-commerce ecosystem that is innovative, secure and intuitive for our users. We are looking for passionate and talented people to join us as we drive the future of e-commerce here.   Responsibilities   - Responsible for developing platforms, tools and quality engineering processes to ensure quality and security of e-commerce products;   - Responsible for entire testing lifecycle, including requirements analysis, design review, formulating test plans, designing and executing test cases, conducting defect tracking and software quality analysis, etc;   - Be involved in the development of automated testing tools/frameworks, design and execution of automated test cases, automatically building test environments, and continuous integration;   - Ensure the quality of the system under test, and strive to improve the quality and efficiency of R&D through test process and method innovation.   Qualifications  - Final year or recent graduate with a background in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems or a related technical discipline from a university;   - Familiar with software testing methodology, proficient in the usage of testing tools to debug and analyze software bugs and performance issues;   - Strong background in computer science and proficient in at least one programming language (Java/C/C++/Python etc);   - Good knowledge of Android and iOS hardware and OS features;   - Prior experience in software development testing, with demonstrable experience in manual and automated testing is a plus;   - Experience with data/web security testing and continuous integration/development is an advantage.   Preferred Qualifications   - Agile, quick self learner, highly self-motivated with strong sense of product ownership and creative problem solver;   - Deeply passionate about quality engineering and delivering great mobile and web applications;   - Good collaborator and team player, comfortable working in a fast moving, culturally diverse and globally distributed team environment;   - Strong product sense or understanding. Job Description  About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.  We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.  The Role Responsibilities  Strategy  · Establish business solution architecture and corresponding technology target state (“North Star”) for key business capabilities in Wealth Management domain in alignment with enterprise, business and technology direction  · Evangelise “North star” strategy and ensure that all related technology initiatives progressively contribute towards target state and lead to improved scalability and resiliency, while ensuring implementation efficiency  · Able to guide the conversation with our business and delivery teams from ideation through to deployment in order to ensure a rich, effective experience for our clients in alignment with agreed strategy  Business  · For the assigned domains, translate business strategy into an executable roadmap utilizing a traceable capability assessment framework. Perform architecture impact assessment during the concept ideation and business case development to ensure minimum architecture requirements are considered and included in business case.  · Being trusted advisor, providing guidance and direction on modern architecture and solutions.  · Innate ability to elicit requirements in a progressive manner and to be able to optimize business architecture so that technology systems can deliver expected outcomes in most efficient manner.  · Improve cost efficiency – drive efficiency by identifying opportunities to rationalise to a fewer best of tools which provides strategic capability and aggressively decommission redundant tools.  · Drive and enable cloud adoption and modernisation of technology landscape.  · Drive increased automation  · Partner and influence Tech delivery to ensure the strategy is realised.  Processes  · Contribute to development and management of architecture processes and practices including governance across all architecture disciplines.  · Increase Engineering efficiency by creating reusable architecture/design artefacts like patterns, templates etc.  Governance  · Support established architectural governance in a manner that involves conversation, feedback and interaction and promotes faster delivery and sustainable outcomes.  Regulatory & Business Conduct  · Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.  · Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.  Key Stakeholders  · Chief Architect, CPBB  · Business SMEs and POs  · Head(s) of Delivery, Wealth Management  · Head Technology Governance and Assurance  · Head of Architecture, API and Partnership CPBB  · Principal Architects – CPBB  · Head of Transformation & Strategy CPBB  Other Responsibilities  · Embed Here for good and Group’s brand and values in ACES Team  · Perform other responsibilities assigned under ACES Function  Our Ideal Candidate  · Proven Techno-Functional experience within a financial services institution, especially in shaping business solution strategy and influencing business and technology stakeholder to deliver world class platforms  · Innate ability to understand and collaborate with non-technical stakeholders to understand their expectations and to translate that into business solutions strategy  · Diverse business domain experience and proven capability to optimize business flows using automation  · Proven experience in partnering with technology stakeholders to delivery state strategy and business outcomes  · 8+ years of experience in any Senior Architecture roles; i.e. Business Solutions Architect, Enterprise Architect, Platform/Portfolio architect and/or large-scale transformation Program Architect roles  · Strategic outlook; Ability to connect-the-dots; excellent communication and influencing skills  · Master's degree preferred or equivalent professional qualification  · Cloud certification would be a plus  · Prior experience in Wealth management domain specifically with regards to trade flows (Equity, Bond, Funds, Structured Products) and associate system/technology architecture, is preferred  Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.  To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our  career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.
