job_title: Cloud Architect (Financial Services) Manager, Technology Consulting
job_description: Job Description  At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.   We are the only professional services organization who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated advisory, assurance, tax, and transaction services   EY’s Performance Improvement Advisory professionals bring a wealth of experience in working with major financial institutions to align their operating model and infrastructure to their business’ strategic objectives. We assemble the right multi-disciplinary teams, use consistent and proven global methodologies and tools, and draw on the full breadth of EY’s global network, to deliver value and trusted advice to the clients. The key service offerings cover finance function transformation, customer and distribution effectiveness, operations, shared services / outsourcing support, performance management, program advisory, enterprise intelligence, risk management and regulatory change.   Your Key Responsibilities  You will enable, drive and lead initiatives focusing on establishing and embedding cloud architecture & design governance across the organization. Key functions include:   Lead initiatives for setting up cloud architecture & technology strategies, standards, governance and best practices for the whole organization.  Lead the initiatives to identify right set of cloud technologies to be used for specific type of solutions and drive the effort to templatize and automate those technologies to be used at scale in all products and applications across organization.  Architect & Design solutions for cloud (e.g. AWS, Azure) which are optimal, secure, efficient, scalable, resilient and reliable, and at the same time. are compliant with EY cloud standards and policies.  Architect & Design solutions for Hybrid cloud, which are multi-tenant and geo distributed and meet EY’s data protection standards.  Design strategies and tools to deploy, monitor, and administer Cloud applications and the underlying services for Cloud (e.g. Azure, AWS, private cloud)  Architect and implement DevSecOps processes and CI/CD pipelines using tools like VSTS, Jira, Ansible, Jenkins, Chef.  Collaborate with technology teams across EY Service Lines and vendor product teams helping them implement a productized strategy, consuming existing components while also greatly enhancing velocity of products through reuse.  Work with engineering teams for designing, building & productionizing components that will grow in capability while being multi-tenant, global, scalable & highly available.  Scout the technology landscape for emerging technologies, patterns and solutions that can benefit EY Technology & our customers (existing and new).  Build quick POCs and write some code for exploring new technology solutions.  Keep up to date with market trends and competitive insights. Evaluate technology and tools to enable the product ecosystem in E&Y.  Evaluate and enhance ROI through experiments and bets on technologies and components.   Skills and Attributes for Success   Deep understanding of cloud computing and data technologies, business drivers, emerging computing trends, and deployment options (preferably in Microsoft Azure and AWS).  Expert in defining, designing and developing distributed and scalable products and services, including reusable domain-specific microservices on multi-platform/hybrid clouds (such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Rackspace, VMware, or OpenStack).  Deep understanding of Application, Infrastructure and security architecture and non-functional aspects like Performance, Scalability, Reliability, Availability etc.  Deep experience in IAAS (with good fundamentals in network and security) as well as PAAS. Good understanding of all Azure services and ability to choose the right service for a workload among multiple Azure services preferred.  Strategic business acumen and understanding of organizational strategy and ability to design information systems to deliver that strategy.  Strong expertise in DevOps, Agile methodologies, containers, CI/CD and tools like VSTS, Jira.  Experience with software and product development lifecycle (incl. coding, coding standards and reviews, source control, testing, debugging, build, deployment and operations).  Strong understanding of one or more development platform .Net technologies (C#), Java / JavaScript.  Familiarity in the following areas, but not limited to:  Front end / UI technologies including frameworks such as React/Angular.js  REST / Webservices (with high performance, multi-tenancy, global, scalable elements)  SQL, XML, JSON, Linux, ELK stack, Splunk, Solr, GIT, Ant/Maven, Jenkins  Familiarity with Data Ingestion, Analytics, AI technologies   To Qualify for the role, you must have   At least 6 years of deep technology experience at very large enterprises or web scale product companies.  At least 3 years of architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications (i.e. having an architectural sense for ensuring availability, reliability, etc.) on cloud.  Experience in consulting preferred.  Experience in presenting ideas, papers, patents to varied audiences.  Certificates requirements: Microsoft Azure related certifications, Other cloud providers like AWS and Google Cloud are accepted   Ideally, you’ll also have   Supervision Responsibilities   Candidate will need to work closely with and able to lead architecture design teams on projects to understand client requirements and landscape, develop designs and build architectural components, define processes for maintenance and enhancement of architectural components, as well as deploy these architectural components.  The candidate will need to demonstrate key skills to be able to influence without authority as he/she would interact with senior strategy and architecture leaders, product engineering teams, infrastructure and security architects.   Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities   Demonstrate strong analytical and technical problem-solving skills by leveraging the latest trends in technologies such as cloud, AI, and big data.  Handle ambiguity and able to move forward with imperfect information and get things done in a rapidly changing environment.  Must be comfortable working in an environment where ideas are challenged.  Should possess good product instinct and excellent project management skills to push projects over the finish line with sound planning and persistent execution.  Astute in aligning effort & resources to achieve desired results.   What we look for  Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What we offer   Continuous learning:  You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.  Success as defined by you:  We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way  Transformative leadership:  We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.  Diverse and inclusive culture:  You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.   If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.  Apply now. Job Description   COMPANY DESCRIPTION   As Singapore’s leading supermarket retail player and a household name close to all, we have grown with you over the years. It is now your turn to grow an exciting new career and fulfil your aspirations with us. Join us as we embark on a journey to make lives better for our customers, community, environment and employees.  At NTUC FairPrice, we offer you more than just a job. We are committed in giving our employees a rewarding career through comprehensive development opportunities. We promise a wonderful workplace culture with ample opportunities for growth at different levels of your career. Every of our 10,000 employees across Singapore is important.  If the prospect of working in an organization at the forefront of retail technology and innovation excites you, look no further.  Grow your career with us today and make a difference.  .   RESPONSIBILITIES   This position is responsible for representing business users as an SAP power user in areas of Sales and Distribution, Material Management , Vendor Invoice management (must have) and Finance & Control (good to have). The incumbent is also the Master Data Manager for all SAP master data maintained at the OBFS organization level. The incumbent will also work closely with cross functional department to assist in SAP system enhancement based on new business requirement and to assist and participate in User Acceptance Test. He/she will also be required to do the end user training and montior/follow up weekly report.   Job Requirement:  Bachelor's degree preferred but other qualifications with the relevant experience will be considered.  SAP expert user in Sales and/or Procurement (logistics) is a must.  SAP expert user in Finance & Control will be an added advantage  Prior SAP master data governance and logistic modules (SD and MM) processes is must   QUALIFICATIONS  Experience in the Supply Chain Management environment is an added advantage. Job Description  Our client is a leading technology agency that revolutionalises, provides innovative and integrates smart technologies for the healthcare sector.   Position Summary / Project Description  The Security Engineer (SO) will report to the Medical Device and Operation Technology (MDOT) lead. He/she will support the MDOT personnel in aligning IT security initiatives and ensure compliance with prevailing security policies and standards.   The SO will also track and provide regular reporting to management on MDOT security matters, including security incidents, non-compliance with security policies and standards, and results of internal audits or security tests.   Role and Responsibilities  • Provide guidance to the projects in ensuring that projects/ systems comply with security policies and the relevant legal and regulatory frameworks (such as PDPA or Cybersecurity Act) throughout the product lifecycle.  • Perform adequate risk management, including identification, assessment and provide treatment of security risks associated with systems handled by the Product Group. Risk assessment has to be performed in accordance with the organization’s cybersecurity risk management framework.  • Provide guidance related to vulnerability assessments, source code review and penetration tests so that remediation actions can be undertaken by Product Group within the agreed timelines.  • Provide security consulting and advisory to the relevant groups.  • Review RFP proposal compliance with RFP security requirements.  • Analyzing and assisting in the secure design and architecture developed by Architecture teams and MD&OT vendors.  • Review medical device and operational technology systems specifications for suitability to meet MDOT standards and policies within the environment.  • Perform cybersecurity assurance activities.  • Evaluate risks related to third-party vendor and products and identify mitigating measures.  • Perform independent assessments of the security controls implemented within the MD&OT systems to determine the overall effectiveness of the controls.  • Establish/Improve procedures and processes necessary to ensure compliance to enterprise wide IT and MDOT security policy and standards.  • Maintain an appropriate level of security awareness within the BME and OT community to keep them apprised of security threats and appropriate actions to be taken.  • Carrying out compliance checks for new MD&OT projects/systems and its impact to the risk profile of the Institutions.  • Recommend compensating controls for deviations from IT/MD&OT security policies and standards.  • Implement new solutions to address gaps or improve security posture for the organization, or to meet new compliance requirements.  • Monitor for emerging threats and advise stakeholders on appropriate courses of action.  • Provide IT security advisory and consulting services to project teams.   Requirements  • At least 5-8 years of IT security experience in the area of IT security infrastructure design and operations, and/or in an IT security compliance and assurance role.  • Working experience in medical devices OR operational technology, IOT and embedded systems.  • Strong interpersonal skills with ability to manage stakeholders.  • Candidates with CISA, CISM and/or CISSP certifications would have an advantage.  • Strong risk management and risk articulation skills.  • Professional security certification is preferable, such as CISSP, CISM, CISA or other similar security certifications.  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as a team member with minimal direction.  • Good written and communication skills.  • Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or equivalent.   If you possess the relevant skillsets, please apply now with your updated CV.   We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates would be contacted. job_title: Associate Contracts Manager, Technical Infrastructure - Singapore
job_description: Job Description  The area: Legal  20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for working with some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.  The role: Associate Contracts Manager, Technical Infrastructure - Singapore  With a company growing at such fast speeds, every day another agreement is made to keep Google running. As a member of the Legal Contracts team, you review and revise contracts -- often juggling several at a time. You develop practical and innovative ways to meet Google's needs and keep the company thriving, with the ability to affect Google's long-term goals.  Additional Role Description:  Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, Technical Infrastructure makes Google's product portfolio possible.  As part of the legal team supporting Technical Infrastructure, you will help the Engineers navigate the legal challenges associated with taking on some of technology's greatest challenges, helping build everything from machine learning accelerators, networks capable of delivering hours of Youtube videos a day, to energy and cost-efficient data centers.  You will work closely with our Technical Infrastructure legal group that manages legal review for issues and commercial transactions relating to Google’s global network acquisition, hardware platforms, and data center maintenance and operations. Technical Infrastructure builds the hardware and systems that power Google’s services, meaning that you'll be exposed to practically every department throughout Google. You'll advise our business clients on the various legal risks, business strategies and other issues related to commercial agreements, and you'll also assist with the continuous development of the commercial team and its processes.  Responsibilities:  - Create and manage procedures and structures to efficiently manage high volumes of inbound agreements, orders, and Statements of Work (SOWs).  - Review, draft, and negotiate commercial agreements, services agreements, licenses, and SOWs.  - Advise business clients on the legal issues and risks, complex agreement structures, approval processes, company policies and procedures and ensure compliance with Google’s policies and risk tolerance.  - Respond promptly to legal requests from business clients, summarizing and communicating legal concepts that business clients can use.  Minimum qualifications:  - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.  - 4 years of experience as a Paralegal or Legal Assistant at a law firm or in-house legal department.  - Experience in legal analysis and research.  Preferred qualifications:  - 5 years of experience in agreement drafting.  - Experience with legal operations, such as process, systems, and policies.  - Experience working as a Paralegal, Contracts Manager or Negotiator, or Legal Assistant.  - Ability to interpret legal documents, negotiate agreements, and work with attorneys to complete agreements.  - Ability to communicate and review agreements in Chinese, Japanese, or Korean. You'll be involved in the planning and design of the cloud infrastructure, as well as in troubleshooting any issues.   You will:   ● Work in tandem with our infrastructure team to identify and implement the most optimal cloud-based solutions for the company  ● Define and document best practices and strategies regarding application deployment and infrastructure maintenance  ● Provide guidance, thought leadership and mentorship to development teams to build cloud competencies  ● Ensure application performance, uptime, and scale, maintaining high standards of code quality and thoughtful design  ● Managing cloud environments in accordance with company security guidelines   Key Responsibilities   The scope of responsibilities includes the following  ● Develop and implement technical efforts to design, build, and deploy AWS applications  ● Automate the manual efforts in the provision of cloud resources  ● Troubleshoot incidents, identify root cause, fix and document problems, and implement preventive measures  ● Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud-based initiatives, providing associated training as required  ● Adopt best practices with regards to managing AWS cloud infrastructure  ● Employ exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they affect business productivity  ● Proactively monitor the performance of the Cloud resources  ● Manage costs of cloud infrastructure to ensure no wastage and takes full advantage of cost saving mechanisms.  ● Working as part of a cross functional team to identify, develop, and lead IT Infrastructure & Operation Transformation activities  ● Defining and executing on the technology migration strategy by engaging highly technical teams within SPHTech (other Solutions Architects, Technical Account Managers, professional services consultants and consulting/managed services partners) to define migration pathways.   Requirements:   ● Degree in Computer Science or equivalent  ● Minimum 5 years of experience in managing AWS environment is a must  ● Minimum 3 years of experience architecting, designing, developing, and implementing cloud solutions on AWS platforms  ● Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in using cloud formation or terraform to provision AWS resources for the application  ● Good cloud infrastructure technical knowledge including cloud formation and cost optimization  ● Well versed in cloud security baseline and management  ● Good knowledge of and ability to make use of most of the AWS resources such as EC2, RDS, ALB, Code Pipeline, ElasticCache, Auto-scaling Group, S3, VPC, EKS, ECS, Cloudfront, Route53, CloudWatch, Lambda  ● Good knowledge of JSON, YAML, Git, CI/CD tools eg Jenkins  ● Well verse in infrastructure security baseline and management  ● Knowledge of information technology infrastructure domains such as compute server platforms, storage server platforms, server components, network devices, technologies and architectures, IT service delivery principles and best practices  ● Familiarity with compliance & security standards across the enterprise IT landscape  ● Professional certifications:  o  AWS Solutions Architect - Associate  or  AWS SysOps - Associate  is a must  o IT Service Management (ITIL) best practices, Agile and Devops is an advantage  ● Effective communicator at all levels of the organisation and outside with third parties  ● Good communication skills – both written and verbal.  ● Problem solving and root cause identification skills. Strong analytic and decision-making abilities.  ● Must be a team player and able to work with and through others.  ● Ability to work in a multicultural environment  ● Integrity & Self Development (live up to commitments; seek feedback to enhance  performance; deal constructively with own mistakes).  ● Customer-Oriented    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family.   Information Technology  IT systems form the backbone of our operations. The Board’s IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems. job_title: Fresh Grad / Junior IT Project Manager
job_description: Job Description  Fresh Grad/Junior Enterprise Software Project Manager  The ASEAN subsidiary of a European Enterprise software firm is looking for a  Fresh Graduate or Junior Enterprise Software Project Manager .  It is important for the candidate to come from a background of Information Technology, whether by way of studies or as previous work experience, the candidate have to be able to pick up technical details of the project quickly.  We are specifically looking for an individual with moderate experiences in IT Project Management as the company plans to train the candidate on the job based on the highest standards of our internal project management principles, using innovative tools and methods. A sharp mind, an attitude for problem solving and proactivity, good communication skills are all essential, just as being a quick learner.  In this role, the candidate will be responsible for planning and implementing projects related to document capture and processing and enterprise migrations. The right candidate will also take part in the execution of technology-related tasks and initiatives for pre-sales and product development.  The candidate should excel at managing our team of IT professionals, keeping track of all project tasks, constantly communicate with all stakeholders to keep everyone up to date and manage external stakeholders.  DO NOT APPLY IF:   You don't have any expereience in IT (no degree, and no work experience)  You are better in executing given tasks then solving problems on your own.  You are rather reactive then proactive, and you prefer the tasks to find you insted of finding them yourself.  You have been doing project management for ages and already know everything there is to know.  You prefer a more stoic and singular environment of a big firm instead of the constant changes and divers responsibilities of a smaller consultancy.  Your written and spoken english are less then excellent.  You are not tech savy.  If you have a problem with being precise, conciencious and very thorough.   Responsibilities of the position:   Helping with presales project planning and the related presales material preparations in the sales cycle of the company  Develop project plans, charters and estimate budgets and ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget.  Coordinate project team members and third parties/vendors working in different continents and time zones for the flawless execution of projects.  Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques.  Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope, schedule and costs.  Report and escalate to management as needed.  Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.  Establish and maintain the relationship with the client, stakeholders, third parties/vendors, and possible clients.  Manage multiple projects at once placed within and outside of Singapore.  Self-development in his / her own field of expertise  University Master’s Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology / Business Informatics or in a relevant field.  Strong working knowledge in waterfall project management methodology.  Experience in agile project management.  Solid technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in software development (Java and SQL) and databases (IBM DB2, MySQL, MS SQL and Oracle).  Knowledge of document and form processing solutions is an advantage. Knowledge of the MPS IntelliVector or similar micro-tasking software solution is a big plus.  Working experience or basic understandings of enterprise capture platforms (IBM Datacap or similar) or enterprise content management solutions (IBM FileNet P8, IBM Content Manager OnDemand, IBM Case Manager, Alfresco, OTEX Captiva or similar) is an advantage.  Confident handling of day-to-day productivity tools: at least Microsoft Project, Microsoft Office, JIRA, Microsoft Dynamics, Sharepoint.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills.  Experience in organization and management of people with culturally divers backgrounds, in different continents and time zones.  Experience in efficient communication and working closely with a product development team is an advantage.  Willingness to travel within and outside of Singapore for both longer and shorter periods (overall 10-30% of the time).  Capable of scheduling work according to project deadlines and aligning with the time zones of team members.     Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Why join us?  Enjoy being involved in projects that make a real difference? Want to work on the latest location-aware technology in a fast-paced and engaging environment? Keen to play a vital part in changing the way people work, live, and experience information? Esri Singapore has the role for you.  Over the past 40 years, Esri Singapore has provided organisations with a wide variety of geospatial solutions. Its users span industries, from commercial and retail to national planning and public safety, and have driven the adoption of Esri’s world-leading ArcGIS platform as an integral part of their operations and processes, for better decision-making and business outcomes.  We are looking for a motivated individual – one who loves understanding and solving customer challenges through the application of GIS knowledge. Someone with a proven history of consistently delivering solutions with strong and positive client outcomes, to join Singapore’s largest pool of geospatial solution experts.  This role will appeal to you if you are GIS savvy and motivated to be part of a team that develops solutions for real-world scenarios. If you are naturally curious and inquisitive, good at creating and nurturing relationships, and enthusiastic about problem solving, this role will provide you with the vehicle to achieve these goals. You will get to work with a highly skilled and diverse team, the latest Esri technology, and interact with organisations across a wide range of industries that include transportation, public safety, government, utilities, insurance, the natural environment, and retail.  How will you benefit from this role?   Learn how spatial analysis can solve user’s challenges with geospatial insights and produce better decisions.  Augment your current skills with the training provided on Esri’s world-leading ArcGIS technology platform  Build knowledge and expertise in the fast‑growing field of enterprise geospatial technology, while delivering high-value, high-impact, and cutting-edge solutions  Design and develop digital solutions with your team to identify and solve complex challenges faced by our many clients  Receive training and certification in world-leading ArcGIS technologies as well as support on complementary tools, to further enhance your current skillset  Work within project teams that will design, develop, and deliver solutions and workflows that apply geospatial concepts and algorithms, to enable clients to achieve new levels of effectiveness   What does your role entail?   Apply critical thinking and geospatial analysis to help users overcome challenges.  Apply our technology on various type of data to uncover patterns, insights and visualize possible solutions.  Contribute to the technical specifications, architecture, processes, and interface design for the applications  Contribute to full SDLC including conducting requirements study, solutioning, development of requirements, system and design documentation, and application support and maintenance  Contribute to application development using enterprise software solution stacks and technologies  Design and implement enterprise geospatial solutions  Assist in customer engagement and ensure that the project meets all scope, time, budget, and quality expectations, through planning, controlling and managing enterprise projects  Contribute to marketing engagements with end-users such as workshops, training delivery, and incident support  Provide on-time project reporting and proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises and devise contingency plans  Build, develop, and grow any business relationships with stakeholders vital to the success of the project   What experience is required?   BA in computer science, information technology engineering, mathematics, GIS, or a related field  Experience in Esri’s ArcGIS product suite, including ArcGIS Pro / Desktop, ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Mobile Apps and/or ArcGIS Online and web technologies  Experience of enterprise GIS solution design and deployment and applying Geographical Information Systems to provide business/real-world solutions  Experience in scripting or developer languages such as JavaScript, REST and Python, or web design experience such as HTML, CSS etc., is desirable but not essential  Experience in working with geospatial datasets and data formats (such as DWG, DGN, BIM, 3D, and others) will be a strong advantage  Excellent communication skills to clearly articulate and explain design decisions  Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment with frequent releases and tight schedules     Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_title: AVP, Data Science Analyst, Consumer Banking Operations, Technology & Operations (WD24079)
job_description: Job Description  Business Function  Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.   Job Purpose  As a Data Science Analyst for Consumer Banking Operations, you will help to design and build scalable analytics solutions through data pipelines, and visualize datasets that empower consumer banking business with actionable analytics in our most strategic transformation. In this complex role, you are expected to be able to perform in multiple roles seamlessly as required viz. Business Analyst, Solution Designer, Developer and Data Scientist.   Responsibilities   Gather, document user requirements, perform exploratory data analysis to understand customer struggles in the journey and create actionable insights through journey analytics  Access and integrate data from multiple sources  Create analytical deep-dives using advanced statistical methods to understand the primary drivers behind customer struggles  Derive business relevant insights within a horizontal organization (working with multiple stakeholders)/Able to understand and solve the business problem by translating into a data model and building insights into an actionable outcome  Design, develop, test and deploy end to end analytics solutions and models (both data pipeline and visualization)  As for visualizations, be able to design user friendly and data efficient outputs in various forms (from operational reports to dashboards aimed at non-analytics users and senior management)  Support full lifecycle of experimentation (A/B testing) through journey analytics and machine learning driven insights/Analyze experiment results and identify opportunities for improving experiment uplift; propose new experiment iterations based on the insights from the data  Work with cross-functional teams and able to execute well in a fast-paced and agile environment  Be a self-starter and must exhibit full sense of ownership of the platform you work on    Requirements   Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information System, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science or related disciplines  Minimum 6 years of relevant work experience in a similar role  Excellent hands-on experience in - Python, Pyspark, Spark, SQL/mysql (including query optimization) - Hadoop eco-system (Hive, HDFS, Pig etc.) and relational databases - End to end data science workflow, starting from data extraction, wrangling, modelling and deployment in production environment - Software development, exposure to full development life cycle from requirements gathering to production support  Experience creating real time and rich data visualizations that involves large datasets  Experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis  A good understanding of machine learning, NLP concepts  Excellent problem solving skills, able to work independently with minimal guidance in a cross-functional context/Able to pick up new methods and techniques quickly and apply towards solving a problem at hand  Attracted to a fast paced, hypothesis and test driven, collaborative and iterative environment  Detail-oriented with strong organizational, analytical and communication skills, team player  Proven ability to roll up your sleeves and contribute quickly    Apply Now  We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements. job_title: Senior Analyst, Enterprise Information Systems, Pacific
job_description: Job Description  Our client, an  American kitchenware appliances  brand who is one of the Fortune 500 Company is seeking for Senior Analyst, Enterprise Information Systems, Pacific.   PURPOSE:  This role will reside in the Asia Pacific (APAC) primarily focused on supporting our Pacific clusters. The role will be based out of the Singapore office. The role will be part of the Global EIS organization and reporting to the Asia EIS leader.    KEY ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES :  The role will be responsible for working as a bridge between EIS and Business functions, understanding requirements, as well as responsible for the steady state delivery of IT services. The roles with this function range from incident resolution to problem management, from capacity and demand management to security and service continuity management.   Key responsibilities would include:   Provide a stable IT Platform environment for D2C  Provide an IT environment that meets the needs of the business – predictable, controllable, extensible services.  Transition projects from “Build” into “Run/Operate”  Design and implement short- and long-term strategic plans to ensure capacity meets existing and future requirements.  Represent the EIS team in Business leadership meetings.  Proficient in any of the cloud environments AWS/GCP.  Has hands-on experience in managing cloud infrastructure environments, has understanding of cloud cost management.  Practice network and PC asset management, including maintenance of component inventory, life cycle management and related documentation.  Manage service level agreements with vendors.  Provides ownership of problems through final resolution.  Plan, acquire, and coordinate installation of in-house and remote hardware and software across the organization’s network.  Lead, motivate, develop and appraise infrastructure team members so that their individual and collective performance is of the required standard and meets the current and future needs of the business  Ensure efficiency on the infrastructure team, and coach and mentor the staff (in house/contract) as needed or required  Conduct research and make recommendations on, services, protocols, and standards in support of keeping pace with new and emerging technology  Prepare RFPs, bid proposals, contracts, scope of work reports, and other documentation for IT projects and associated efforts.  Negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure products and services.  Assess, approve, and administer all equipment, hardware, and infrastructure upgrades through the IT Change Management process.  Maintain security and compliance profile as defined by corporate security and compliance teams  Manage the infrastructure budget to ensure spending is in line with budget and forecast.  Establish & maintain an appropriate Disaster Recovery Infrastructure that is in line with and supports the organization’s Business Continuity Plan  Manage the IT Procurement process for all IT Related hardware for the office.  Participate in the annual IT Budgeting process to align company goals with IT spend.   Dimensions :   This role will be face of IT to local leadership in Singapore representing GIS organization and acting as a conduit between multiple functions.  25-30% time is estimated for this role to work on providing necessary IT infrastructure support for Singapore & Pacific cluster markets.  70-75% of the role is expected to manage and support Cloud platforms for Asia.    REQUIREMENTS :  EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS & CERTIFICATIONS   Degree (or equivalent) in Computing/IT or a related field, or have equivalent IT industry experience  IT Service Management—ITIL  Cloud Experience -- AWS, GCP etc  Experience in Networks, servers (HPC, cluster computing etc) and Linux Administration  Experience in defining and delivering IT Infrastructure & Support strategies   EXPERIENCE/ PREFERRED INDUSTRY   Work experience 10-12 years. job_description: Job Description  AWS is one of Amazon’s fastest growing businesses, servicing customers in more than 190 countries, reshaping the way global enterprises consume information technology and powering the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. job_description: Job Description  AWS is one of Amazon’s fastest growing businesses, servicing customers in more than 190 countries, reshaping the way global enterprises consume information technology and powering the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. AWS customers include some of the most innovative startups like Netflix, Pinterest, Spotify, Airbnb, and Instagram as well as some of the largest global enterprises like Shell International, Unilever, Hitachi, Sharp, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Samsung. We help global and local enterprises to use cloud to remediate their legacy technology and build new innovative businesses.  As a solution manager in the APJ Enterprise Greenfield Team, you will have an exciting opportunity shape and deliver the programs, offerings and GTM approaches for customers who are just getting started with AWS. Your remit will be to define the “What” of the key 5 questions for the right customer subset. You will participate in engagements with business and technical executives to work backwards from their business goals to identify how AWS can help accelerate achievement of their goals with the use of AWS technology. You will also work with account teams to help them identify ways AWS can solve our customers’ biggest challenges. In addition, you will build ways to track customer impact, and use your experience to help improve our engagement model and scale the program worldwide.   In this role you will work with cross-functional teams as part of the program delivery and development. Typically cross-functional collaboration includes Worldwide & country Greenfield, Industry BDs, Solutions Architecture, Marketing, Partners, Professional services, Sales enablement, Sales operations and Sales strategy teams.   The right candidate will have experience interacting at the highest levels of companies and demonstrated experience in developing go-to-market programs. They will have a proven record of leading and driving multiple solutions-led programs to meet business objectives, excellent program and project management skills, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data and metrics bias, and a passion for helping companies get started using cloud to achieve business goals. They will have knowledge of product management, and strong experience in solution marketing and field enablement.   Basic qualifications   5+ years of experience in developing, creating or managing solutions, programs, products for Enterprises in B2B environment  Track record of managing complex sales & marketing programs while demonstrating exceptional judgement  3 years of experience in public or hybrid cloud platforms  Self-motivated and have the ability to network across a broad internal team.  Experience communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple teams.   Preferred qualifications   Knowledge of APJ cloud ecosystem - customer needs, partners, solutions  Entrepreneurial and self-sufficient: work with little oversight delivering high-quality results and driving own agenda  Understanding of cloud concepts in general and/or specific technologies, platforms and solutions  Strong verbal and written communication skills – one to one, one to many, executive-level presentations  Ability to adapt to fast-paced and changing environments   Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Job Description  A  systems integrator  is an engineer tasked with building computing systems for a client, working with software, hardware, and various storage products. As a systems integrator, you primarily combine subsystems into one integrated solution and perform job duties such as purchasing subsystems from different contracted vendors, assessing information technology (IT) system requirements, creating an integration plan or solution, and building a personalized application or architecture to meet client needs. Systems integrators need IT, software development, and problem-solving skills. Qualifications for this career include at least a bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, or a related field as well as experience with integrating technologies.   Reporting to the  Head of Finance and Operations , the Systems Integrator in HealthServe works towards analyzing new and existing systems and infrastructure to determine upgrade needs and integration possibilities.   Summary  We are seeking a talented, qualified individual to join our company as a Systems  Integrator. As part of our Finance and Operations department, you combine various and sometimes disparate subsystems into unified wholes, useful in accomplishing overall business objectives. You compare vendor and subcontractor bids to determine ideal subsystem prices, assess existing infrastructural capacity, and present to leadership and key stakeholders regarding needs and capabilities. Our ideal candidate has considerable professional experience in an IT-relevant role, in addition to experience with project management and vendor relationships. The person must be hands-on in the development of the program and directing of vendors and offer support to our Head of Finance and Operations to manage and improve the database security, as the Data Protection Officer.   Duties and Responsibilities  • Analyse existing systems and infrastructure to determine upgrade needs and  integration possibilities  • Combine subsystems into cohesive units to better support business objectives  • Communicate with vendors to determine ideal subsystem pricing and sourcing  • Understand system requirements of the various teams and work with  programmers to deliver the users’ needs  • Lead Data protection initiatives within HealthServe and ensure that we compile  with PDPA requirements  • Report to leadership and key stakeholders regarding infrastructure capabilities   Requirements and Qualifications  • At least five years of experience in an IT-related role, preferably with leadership  responsibilities  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science or a relevant field, or commensurate  experience  • Experience with project management and product and software development  • Proficiency with ZoHo Deluge, SQL, Azure, and cloud-based web services  preferred and highly desirable  • Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills with attention to  details  • Flexible and able to adapt to changing environment    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

job_description: Job Description  AWS is one of Amazon’s fastest growing businesses, servicing customers in more than 190 countries, reshaping the way global enterprises consume information technology and powering the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. Our business is growing at rapid rates and to support this growing demand for AWS Services across the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you have a passion for working in a fast paced, dynamic environment and provide exceptional customer service, we’d like to hear from you!   The ASEAN Sales Operations team is looking for a highly skilled Program Manager, Business Operations and Planning. The Program Manager will be responsible for programmatically managing processes critical to our Go-To-Market strategy like Annual Planning and Headcount Management, as well as rolling out sales transformation programs revenue forecasting on Anaplan and integration of Salesforce with Anaplan. The individual will leverage business planning cycles and collaborate with stakeholders from APJ and Global Commercial Sales organization.    The candidate should be able to create simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems, have excellent project-management skills, and must be able to communicate effectively and clearly with a wide range of stakeholders, both written and verbal. The ideal candidate needs to possess a keen business sense and exceptional analytical skills, is able to strategically and analytically think about business challenges and has experience in program management or planning for a B2B Sales organization. The candidate should be able to articulate and communicate clear value propositions across customers, partners, and within the AWS organization, and should be comfortable working across internal functions and geographies. The candidate will be a self-starter with a bias towards independent problem solving, a passion for identifying and eliminating bottlenecks, and has the foresight to anticipate business needs, make tradeoffs, and balance business dynamics despite constraints.   Basic qualifications   At least 8+ years’ experience in Program Management, Strategy, Finance, Business Operations in a mid-to-large scale company.  Demonstrated ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, clear written summaries, and region-wide communications.  Demonstrated ability to define, refine and implement sales strategy and planning processes, procedures and policies; and cross functional collaboration skills.  Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of presenting to senior management.  Proven experience with the systems/tools utilized for business planning and reporting. Expert level in Excel.  Strong prioritization skills, including driving multiple initiatives at the same time.  Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization, and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly.  Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field.    Preferred qualifications   MBA or other relevant advanced degree.  Experience with annual business planning process in a high-growth, technology company.  Hands on experience with planning tools like Anaplan etc.  Familiarity with cloud product and services, and sales cycles.  Highly organized with multi-tasking skills; efficient in ambiguous situations.  Demonstrated ability to work across organizational boundaries. What you’ll need. You are familiar with common computational data structures and algorithms.  You have some experience with databases, relational or noSQL as we use both types in our systems. Job Description  Principal Security Consultant (Singapore)  What’s your mission?  IronNet’s mission is simple: To deliver the power of collective cybersecurity to defend companies, sectors, and nations. For decades, companies have been defending against cyber attacks on their own while adversaries have been organizing themselves into sophisticated hacker networks … until now, with IronNet Collective Defense. In 2014, General (Ret) Keith Alexander, former Commander U.S. Cyber Command, launched IronNet to strengthen cybersecurity defense against highly sophisticated adversaries, across all borders and sectors.  In response to cyber adversaries who increasingly collaborate for collective offense, leading organizations in our critical infrastructure are using collective defense strategies and solutions to meet these powerful and ever-changing threats. We believe that collective defense is our collective responsibility and we are leading the charge.  The Opportunity  This key role will be accountable for the delivery of security engagements to include; risk assessments, compromise assessments, maturity assessments and table top exercises. This is a senior role with an expectation that the above activities can be delivered as an individual contributor from scoping to performing the activities to creating and delivering results to IronNet customers.  To be successful in this role, you must be able to . . .  ● Engage with enterprise customers to provide detailed guidance regarding deployment of IronNet solutions and services  ● Manage and deliver cyber security services including assessments  ● Demonstrate ability to understand the concepts of cloud and other emerging technologies, to propose appropriate controls and compliance guidance  ● Demonstrate outstanding skills in analyzing business processes and technical environments within large complex organizations  ● Develop a thorough understanding of the customer engagement (objectives, project scope, business and technical requirements)  ● Lead technical conversations to clarify and assess all aspects of an engagement  ● Play a driving role in scoping meetings and help developing statements of work based on accurate analysis of customer requirements  ● Perform project risk analysis based on technical elements and implement mitigations plans  ● Participate in design workshops with customers and/or partners and provides input as necessary  ● Assist customers through the rollout, migration or go-live phase for the deployed security solution and deliver knowledge transfer sessions  ● Easily translate technical language into business terms  ● Report and clearly communicate analysis  ● Collaborate with cross-functional teams and contribute to the overall mission  ● Work efficiently and effectively in a 100% remote/virtual environment  You may be the person we need if your background aligns with the following . . .  ● 8+ years of Cyber Security experience  ● Solid working knowledge of Risk Management, Information Security, Controls, and IT Audit practices or some combination thereof  ● Hands-on Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) solutions design and implementation experience  ● Demonstrate experience in cloud computing technologies (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, etc.), including software-, infrastructure, and platform-as-a-service, as well as public, private, and hybrid environments  ● Strong knowledge of SaaS services, architectures and solutions and their related security controls and requirements  ● Comprehensive working knowledge of industry standards (ISO, NIST, COBIT, COSO, ITIL)  ● Experience implementing and monitoring compliance with policies, standards, and procedures  ● Ability to manage through complexity and ambiguity  ● Self-motivated, directed, and detail-oriented  ● Ability to independently manage priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, virtual team environment  ● Excellent written and oral communications skills  ● Teammate with a high level of integrity  ● Organized and autonomous with the ability to deliver quality work within commitments and goals  ● Understanding and appreciation of emerging technology and modern security principles with solid knowledge of core infrastructure and systems  Preferred Education & Certifications:  ● Master’s degree preferred  ● Bachelor’s degree required in Computer science, Business Information Systems, Information Systems Security, Information Assurance or related field or equivalent work experience required  ● One or more of the following certifications, including but not limited to:  ● Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)  ● Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)  ● SANS Global Information Assurance Certifications (GIAC)  ● Certified in Risk & Information Systems Control (CRISC)  ● Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)  ● AWS Certified Administrator  We recognize that few candidates meet every requirement. We hire smart people and expect them to grow and learn and that many skills are transferable. If your resume doesn’t match all of the requirements, apply, but please address any skill gaps in a cover letter--our recruiting team and hiring managers are not as knowledgeable about you as you are.  IronNet Values:  1. The Mission Continues.  2. Thrive personally, grow professionally―be happy!  3. Innovate, learn, lead.  4. Be the best and prove it.  5. Act with integrity―always do the right thing.  6. Be the most trusted, respected, and loved cybersecurity company in the world.  People who are successful at IronNet consistently demonstrate these qualities:  ● Always Accountable -- You commit to be the best at your job and prove it every day, delivering results with integrity, transparency and quality.  ● Will to Win -- You demonstrate urgency and take thoughtful risks, understanding that failing fast is critical to success.  ● Passion for Customers -- You integrate innovation and quality to fulfill customer needs -- the value to customers is the first priority, both internally and externally.  ● Highly Capable and Innovative -- You develop innovative solutions to complex problems, strive for continuous improvement and adapt quickly to changes.  ● Technical Fit -- You understand the technology specific to the team / role / duties of the position. The more senior the position that you are applying for, the more that we expect you to bring fresh perspectives and new ideas.  Recognition & Awards  IronNet is recognized as a representative vendor in Gartner’s “Market Guide for Network Detection and Response (NDR) ”, and Forrester recently named IronNet a representative vendor in its “ Now Tech: Network Analytic and Visibility, Q2, 2020 ” research.  2020 Awards:  ● CRN Emerging Vendors  ● Fortress Cyber Security  ● Hot 150 Cybersecurity Companies  2019 Awards:  ● Fortress Cyber Security  ● EMA Vendor To Watch  ● CRN Security100  More About IronNet:  IronNet delivers unmatched collective cyber threat detection for enterprise on-premise, cloud, and hybrid networks. We do this through the application of advanced behavioral analytics, AI, and machine learning techniques. Our team combines the tradecraft knowledge of the best offensive and defensive cyber operators in the world with world-class mathematicians and data scientists to engineer solutions that empower companies to defend against advanced threats. job_title: Assistant Director, Technology Support Services (TSS) , IITS
job_description: Job Description   COMPANY DESCRIPTION   Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university. Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.   RESPONSIBILITIES   This position is for Office of Integrated Information Technology Services.  Assist Senior Associate Director in prioritizing resources to strategize and direct work plan for ETM services delivery.  To plan, lead and initiate exploration of new solutions focusing on endpoint security and protection of SMU data to create a smooth service delivery management and safe working environment for the SMU community.  Work closely with Senior Associate Director to identify, define and implement endpoints solutions as well as to provide implementation strategy to the IITS management for approval.  Lead the team to ensure endpoint devices meet security standards prior being granted network access, supplements centralised security measures to identify and block risky or malicious activities at the point of entry as well as data leak prevention.  Responsible for the tracking of the progress of the projects.  Lead the team to provide a reliable operation of TSS service administration management and ensure the uptime, performance, resources, and security of these services meet the business needs including ensuring smooth daily operations of ETM systems.  Define support initiatives, champion change and effectively manage the implementation of new services and create new operation processes for ETM.  Assist Senior Associate Director to plan, drive, supervise and lead the transformation of services focusing on change management, problem management and vendor management.  Manage and oversee the development, architecture, evaluation and establish guidelines /policies to ensure processes are in place to pro-actively achieve consistent service quality through rigorous management of change control and acceptance into service procedures in line with service delivery governance and guidance.  Work closely with IT Governance (ITG) Division for audit of the ETM service administration processes.  Work closely with Technology Help Centre Assistant Director on the management of resources, processes and schedule details for the new implementation on endpoint devices.  Negotiate contractual terms and conditions, and service level agreement with ETM vendors. Monitor service delivery to ensure the agreed targets and standards are met.  Establish good user rapport, maintain strong relationships and engagement with key stakeholders. Review feedback and effective communication to smoothen implementation of solution.  Resolve cross-functional issues and problems amongst IITS teams and /or other offices and schools.  Assist Senior Associate Director in tracking and ensuring the TSS budgets are utilized as planned and to coordinate the budget for TSS.   QUALIFICATIONS  Degree in Information Technology, Computer Sciences or Engineering.  8 to 12 years' of experience in managing a highly service oriented technical support team in a fast-pace environment.  Strong communication and project management skillsets.  Experience and familiar with endpoint security and measures.  Strong user focus interaction and resolution experience.  Dynamic, proactive and strong organization skill to formulating goals and plans of action.  Innovative thinker and problem solver who always keeps abreast of emerging technologies to support the new business needs.  Strong interpersonal skill. Patience, tolerance and resilience.  Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a high volume, service and process-oriented environment.  Able to identify good staff, lead, guide and motivate a team of systems engineers.  Wide and excellent vendor contacts and management skills are highly preferred.  Excellent negotiation skill is required.  Experience in managing large and complex projects, as well as managing vendors.  Good Knowledge in PCs, laptops and mobile devices. Windows and iOS environment.   OTHER INFORMATION  Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary. Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Singapore Management University    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.    We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with ByteDance.    Application deadline: November 30th, 2021    Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is firm and includes all TikTok/ByteDance jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.    About the Video Infrastructure team   The Video Infrastructure team creates a world-leading video platform that provides multi-media storage, delivery, transcoding, and streaming services. We are building the next generation video processing platform and the largest live streaming network, which provides excellent experiences for billions of users around the world.    Popular video products of ByteDance are all empowered by our cutting-edge cloud technologies. Working in this team, you will have the opportunity to tackle challenges of large-scale networks all over the world, while leveraging your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis, and large-scale system design.    Responsibilities   - Build global infrastructure for multi-media process, storage and transport, to serve the billions of users all over the world;   - Design, build and maintain a global scale, multi-regional video cloud system;   - Design, implement and operate our critical and scalable services;   - Build live streaming platforms, systems, and infrastructure with knowledge in network and distributed systems;   - Participate in design reviews and code reviews for the video infrastructure team.   Qualifications  - Final year or recent graduate with a background in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems or a related technical discipline from a university;   - Good programming experience with at least one of the following languages: C, C++, Java, Python, or Go; - Familiar with Unix/Linux operating systems.    ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. If you have any questions, please reach out to us at  [email protected]    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  The Role  Turning data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. You will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. You will need to work with strategic planners to help draw actionable insights from disparate data sources.   Responsibilities    · Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports that uncover growth opportunities.  · Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.  · Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.  · Filter, clean and transform data from multiple disparate sources  · Work with management & planners to prioritize business and information needs.  · Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.   Key Skills  · BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.  · Proven working experience in data departments of advertising agencies, consulting companies or technology companies or having worked in FMCG companies.  · Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, process, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information, with attention to detail and accuracy.  · Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.   Required technical expertise  · Strong knowledge of and experience in  programming : Python (including the Pandas module), SQL, Microsoft VBA programming in Excel or Javascript.  · Sound experience in using  reporting packages (such as Microsoft BI, Business Objects, etc.).  · Good working knowledge of  data structure types , with a proven experience in importing, processing and manipulating most common data structures found in a “big data” environment (social network streams, data from APIs and so on). This includes structured data, i.e. tabular data, semi-structured data, such as JSON or XML, quasi-structured data, such as URLs and their tags, and unstructured data, such as long textual fields or images.  · Good understanding of and working experience in using the most common  complex data types , such as nested dictionaries, nested lists, and so on.  · Knowledge of and experience in working with databases.  · Experience in business-oriented database design.  · Knowledge of statistics and experience in using statistical packages for analysing data sets (namely, Python, “R” and MS Excel. Job Description  Oracle Financial Developer  Avensys is a reputed global IT professional services company headquartered in Singapore. Our service spectrum includes enterprise solution consulting, business intelligence, business process automation and managed services. Given our decade of success we have evolved to become one of the top trusted providers in Singapore and service a client base across banking and financial services, insurance, information technology, healthcare, retail and supply chain.  We are currently looking to hire  Oracle Financial Developer  who has proven track record in IT Industry. This is an exciting opportunity to expand your skill set, achieve job satisfaction and work-life balance. More details as below.  Oracle Financial Developer  Roles and Responsibilities:  · An Oracle developer designs and develops applications and common services based on development models, tools, and languages  · They need to conduct performance testing/monitoring, as well as implement support technology teams as needed during design.  · An Oracle developer also need to build database software modules in Oracle; they need to not only build the data models, but also design them and apply data architecture concepts.  · An Oracle developer must work with relevant infrastructure and application development teams to define integration guidelines and development approaches.  - Inclusive benefits package allowing enrollment of dependents and partners.  - A flexible culture that understands the importance of quality of work over quantity.  - A culture of company-wide collaboration and shared success.  - Company supported and employee driven ambassador groups that promote diversity, working remotely and philanthropy.  - Learning and development programs to advance your career and personal growth  - Corporate social responsibility initiatives with global reach  - Regular recognition, feedback, and open communication across all levels  - Team building, bonding, mentorship and support to grow confidence, trust and friendships  - Fully stocked kitchens, biweekly catered lunches, and regular social events for when we get back to the office. job_description: Job Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world’s leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing start-ups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation.  At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams within the Cloud Sales Centre (CSC). AWS is committed to be the most customer obsessed organisation on the planet  As the Program Manager of the CSC business management team, you will lead and manage strategic initiatives and programs to help AWS build the newly formed Cloud Sales Centre and support the teams across Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ). The CSC is the inside sales organisation of AWS and is focused on new customer acquistions across APJ at scale. You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically, as you collaborate with internal stakeholders from sales, operations, partner, and marketing teams, while being part of an entirely new concept at AWS.  ABOUT THIS ROLE  For this role, you will need to ‘Learn and Be Curious’ (see Amazon Leadership Principles), as you develop, implement and own the end-to-end process to manage sales campaigns and initiatives programmatically for the teams across APJ. With a ‘Bias for Action’, and strong ability to ‘Earn Trust’, you will drive the operations and project management of key initiatives and sales campaigns (e.g. implement cadences, review performance) and create mechanisms to help sales teams prioritize their time on activities that deliver results and value for our customers. To do so, you will need to conduct research to understand marketing, partner and sales campaigns and how different functions and teams work, identify problems and gaps, analyze data to generate insights, present and implement your proposal to run campaigns more efficiently. Additionally, you will lead and support other initiatives to drive operational excellence for our sales organization. You are a self starter, who takes initiative, is curious to learn and is comfortable with ambiguity. You have a “can-do” spirit with a strong sense of ownership to execute end-to-end projects. Want to know more about what it’s like to be part of our Team at AWS? Hear from our builders: AWS Builder Stories  Basic qualifications   At least 10+ years' experience working in Sales operations, Business operations areas directly engaging with sales force  Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field  Proven experience with the development and implementation of systems/tool utilized for SFDC, variable compensation, revenue reporting, forecasting etc  Expert level in Excel and Data query tools and Strong business-process design experience   Preferred qualifications   Demonstrate strong project management and stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to lead and drive initiatives.  Demonstrate expertise in being data-driven, detail-oriented, results-oriented, analytical and strong financial/business acumen  Demonstrated proficiency in program and project management is essential   Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com    Apply Now      Report Job     Share this job with your friends

Job Description  The Cloud Systems Administrator is primarily responsible for the operation and management of a large cloud infrastructure with many of AWS and third-party components. The AWS subscription supports a cloud infrastructure that enables customer workloads to be implemented efficiently and safely. The candidate is expected to be an expert in administering the cloud environment and workloads running in the subscription. Activities will include patch management, software distribution and workload deployment using AWS console and automated scripts to be developed by the candidate.  The candidate will have an in-depth understanding on the workings of AWS and operating systems (such as Windows Server and Linux). This candidate is expected to work collaboratively with the customer as well as groups of endpoint engineers and CI/CD engineers. Those engineers will look for expert advice during workload/software deployment / troubleshooting from this candidate. This candidate will be responsible for the overall operations, configuration, fault resolution and upgrade of components inside the AWS cloud. Resourcefulness is a necessary skill in this role. You should be able to diagnose and resolve problems quickly. You should also have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams, peers, users and customers. Your goal will be to ensure that the technology infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently.   Responsibilities:   Lead, plan, implement, track and report the routine patch management of workloads for Linux & Windows OSes. For workloads that fail the patching, troubleshoot, test and escalate to principal vendors.  Lead, plan, implement, remediate, track and report the routine vulnerability scan of workloads and applications. For workloads that fail the remediation, troubleshoot, test and escalate to principal vendors.  Manage the access control and privilege access to applications, workloads, OSes, features and functionalities inside the AWS subscription.  Manage the assets, licenses, inventory and other soft assets in the AWS subscription, giving the customer full visibility on assets, features and functionalities in use; thereby preventing unexpected charges and/or security issues dues to usage of specific functionalities.  Monitor and maintain the availability of the AWS subscription. Report scheduled or unscheduled downtimes to customer immediately. Troubleshoot and root cause any downtime and promptly provide incident reports clearly articulating the reasons for downtime. Recommend and enable best practices for higher uptime of workloads.  Report the status to customer during routine and ad-hoc meetings.  Attend to incidents and trouble-tickets and resolve it within the pre-defined Service Level Agreements.  Lead in the capacity planning and performance management of the AWS infrastructure  Lead in the analysis, diagnosis and resolution of faults for AWS operations.  Fullfill service and change requests relating to system provisioning, backup, log management, two-factor-authentication, security management, monitoring, etc  Adhere and participate in change management, problem management, release management, configuration management, disaster recovery and other ITIL processes.  Test and report on technology explorations and validation of systems components through proof-of-concepts.  Escalate and work to resolve issues with principal vendors during troubleshooting and support incidents.   Job Requirements:   Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or related disciplines.  Relevant cloud certifications such as AWS Certified SyOps Administrator  In-depth understanding of AWS Cloud.  Minimum 5 years of relevant IT infrastructure experience in the implementation, operations and maintenance of the following:  At least 3 year experience with common operating systems, including common flavours of Windows and Linux.  Good understanding of security operations, system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems, 2FA, etc) and role based administration  Good understanding of networking, including network routing, IP addressing,  Experience administering sizeable AWS environments  Task automation via scripting such as Terraform, Cloud Formation, and ability to create scripts in Python, Perl or other language  Experience in DevOps deploying IT infrastructure using templates and scripts  Proven experience as a System Administrator, Network Administrator or similar role  Experience with databases, networks (LAN, WAN) and patch management  Resourcefulness and problem-solving aptitude  Excellent communication skills  Pro-active, dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking.  Strong interpersonal skills, customer orientation, team interaction/effectiveness, proactive, analytical and decision making skills.   Interested applicants, please submit your updated resume in MS WORD format via Apply Now for immediate processing. Do include your availability, last drawn & expected salary.   **We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you.
